text: We tried this deep dish pizza place for the first time. We got there on Saturday so it was 45 minutes wait. The restaurant was packed. We got the Lou which was okay. Honestly I have had better deep dish in Nashville. Also the pizza took another 45 minutes to arrive. I give it 4 out of 5 because of the friendliness of the staff.

My fiance and I were on a mission to find the best deep dish pizza and we both agree that we liked the pizza here the most.  We ordered the lou pizza and the crust was good and topping went well with the pizza. When you get there, check in with the hostess and they will text you a link to check your position in line.  Be sure to go to the counter next door to put in your pizza order since deep dish pizzas take about 30-45 mins to cook.  In the meantime you could order a drink and drink it outside while you're waiting for a table

Holy crap this had a long wait but it was worth it. For a table of 4, we waited about an hour to be seated, then another 15 before getting our food. We ordered ahead of time since it takes 45 minutes to bake a pizza. This specific location was decently sized but it was packed and so busy. The wait staff kept their cool and stayed on top of everything, and they kept it fun. Great place, wonderful deep dish pizzas. Definitely try it out!

I ordered the Chicago style pizza and added pepperoni. It was pretty good. Not sure if it was worth the money or the 45min wait. I ordered for pickup on a Friday around 1pm.They told me about 30min. I ended waiting 45min which wasn't too much longer. They just kept telling me different times. I get they were busy but there were quite a few people waiting much longer than told. If I order take out again I'll definitely give myself a little more time. Pizza is good but like I said it wasn't great. $20 for four small pieces just didn't seem worth it to me. But I'm glad I tired it.

When you visit Chicago.  There are a few food items you must try . Probably the #1 food to try is the Deep Dish Pizza. Just straight delicious. You know when something is good and no one talks at the table, until finished. We ordered the Deep Dish Pepperoni and a Deep Dish Sausage and Pepperoni.  Normally when you get a sausage pizza, they put individual pieces of sausages on it.  Not here they put an entire sausage patty that covered the entire pizza, OMG, OMG.  You talking about GOOD, how about GREAT.   Place can get packed, because the food is GREAT. I'm definitely coming back here. Service and hospitality is excellent.
This was our second time dining at Lou Maknati's, the first time at this location. Deep dish pizza was delicious. Venue was fun. The best was the deep dish chocolate chip cookie pizza. Perfection!

Our first trip to Chicago, friends had told me this was the place to try my first deep dish pizza.  We came here on a Saturday at 1pm, so of course we knew we'd hit the lunchtime rush. We were told it would be a 25-35 minute wait, ended up being only 20. The nice part is you can get your pizza started on, it takes 35 minutes for them to make it. So you can order right at the counter while you wait. VERY convenient!  When we were seated, our waitress was very kind and attentive. Brought us our drinks, and then once the pizzas got there offered to serve us each the slice we wanted. We ordered a classic cheese deep dish and a medium thin crust, half cheese half toppings. The deep dish was AMAZING. Of course, this is our first time trying authentic Chicago deep dish, but really it was VERY good. The crust was thick, but scrumptious. The sauce wasn't too sweet, and the thick amount of cheese was just incredible. We absolutely loved it. Not one complaint. The thin crust was okay, not anything different than what we've had at other pizzerias, but again great sauce, fresh toppings, overall great taste.  Whenever we're back, we're definitely stopping by again!

Always like to try pizza when In Chicago and had heard about Malnati's and there was a location close to our hotel. The food did not disappoint. There were three of us and we ordered a personal Lou's (no meat, cheese and veggies) and then a small Chicago that had sausage and cheese. The crust is to die for, very buttery and crispy even though a deep dish. Tomato sauce is really good and the Italian sausage was sweet and perfectly seasoned. Lots of cheese on both. We also thought the calamari was very good and it came out quickly and was hot and crispy. Only thing that keeps this location from being a 5 is ambiance. It's just a really busy place with more of an "Italian Denny's feel" but we were ok with it. We got there at about 8:00 on a Friday night and waited about 20 minutes to be seated, which we didn't think was bad given the popularity of the place. You preorder your pizza when you check in with the hostess and so once you get to your table, it goes quickly. Try it out.

My first time in Chicago and this is the first place we stopped to eat last night after arriving. Looked up "Best deep dish pizza in Chicago" and this restaurant came up. I didn't have the pizza, but I did have the bow tie pasta and it was SO SO good! My sister and her boyfriend had the original deep dish and also an order of the penne pasta. I absolutely love this place, we were served by Veronica and she gave us beyond excellent customer service. Will be back next time I'm in town!
The most friendly staffs. Place is packed but it was worth the wait. Best pizza I've ever had!

Delicious as always. We wanted to stop on the way through Chicago, but ended up not being able to. We made sure to stop by on our way back through tho. And yep, still the best pizza I've ever had. It's just soo good! We usually get Lou's deep dish style. And it's never a disappointment. The crust, tomatoes, sauce..yummmmm! I wish I could have a slice now!  Only complaint is that it was a fairly warm day out and it was very warm in the restaurant. Which is completely understandable considering the hot temp outside. But it sucked not having the relief of a/c as we waited for our pizza.

We came in around 3:30, expecting it to not be busy but there was still a 20 minute wait. They have the process down though since you can pre-order while you wait for a seat so you're pizza is ready when you're seated. We ordered the small classic and added pepperoni. I absolutely love the buttered crust; maybe even more so than the pizza itself.  We ordered the calamari as an appetizer too, and it was alright. I like more crunchy calamari and it was a little squishy to me.  I'm giving them an extra star just because they have my favorite hi-c poppin' pink lemonade!
Deep dish pizza and freindly staff elegant Restaurant bring your family into the restaurant

Ahhhhmazzinnnng pizza. My first time having deep dish and probably the best way to have it. It was soooo good. I don't think I can even see pizza the same again. And not just because it was deep dish, but it was so good!  They are reallllllly busy. They'll take your order while you wait for your table. We waited about 20 minutes for our table and then another 20 minutes after that...either the pizzas take awhile to be made or because of the volume of ppl, or both. We got a large pepperoni and a medium Lou's. It says the large feeds 4 ppl and a medium feeds 3 ppl, but you definitely fill up pretty quick after a slice. We had so much leftover. We had a group of four and wanted to try the two and probably would've been better off with two mediums. (Or one large could easily feed party of 4-6.) The Lou was definitely my favorite. It was soooooo good. The crust was yummy and it was full of sauce, cheese, and flavor. The Lou's had much more flavor than the pepperonis. I love cheese, so it's def won my heart with how cheesy these pizzas are! I really can't wait to come back one day!

This place was amazing!!!!!!!!! I came after many recommendations even though I am not the biggest fan of deep dish. I thought about just getting a slice and scooping the cheese out (LOL).  BUUUUUT they have a thin crust option!!!!!! I was overjoyed because I got to experience the buttery crust without drowning in cheese :) It was simple, and super fresh. Make sure to come a little early cause it takes about half an hour to make the pizza!!!! Or order some salad, i saw lots of people getting that and it looked amazing. The sign is fairly easy to see, and we walked here so don't know much about parking!

Yup, the hype is real. Lou's is arguably the best place to get deep dish pizza in Chicago if you're not willing to travel. Since this place is pretty much always busy, my friends and I opted for take-out and have the pizza in our hotel instead. We had the Malnati Chicago Classic, which comes with butter crust. Regardless of what you're ordering, get the butter crust. It's delicious and addicting at the same time. The pizza was ready in about 45 minutes; not bad considering it's deep dish and it was insanely busy on a Saturday night. Needless to say the pizza was one of the best I've had. The only small issue I had was that it was a bit soggier than expected, though that might be due to the fact I had take-out instead of ordering in. The tomatoes were ripe and fresh, definitely not canned at all. The sausages were delicious and lean at the same time. Finally the cheese...lots of it. Stretchy. Yummy at the same time. I've now tried Lou's and Giordano's (mind you, 6 years ago). I definitely prefer Lou's over Giordano's.

Lou Malnati's is a chain Pizzeria in a gazillion locations in Chicago, this one happened to be a block from my friends apartment. I really dont like deep dish, but i settled for their version of thin sausage crust, it was delicious. Decent size. I will be sure to drop by the again. Only drawback it took a long while even for thin crust to come out. I cant even imagine for the deep dish.

I'm so disappointed. I spent 60 bucks for my meal and the pizza is just cheese and toppings. I paid for tomato sauce too. I don't understand how or why you would let this dish even leave your kitchen like that. I will take my money elsewhere next time

Excellent place for Chicago Deep Dish Pizza.  It's an entire meal.  Good things take time do don't be in a rush for your pizza.  It's worth the wait. I like the Lou's classic.  Don't worry if your eyes are bigger than your stomach cause they can pack up the leftovers to go.

My first deep dish Chicago pizza and it did not disappoint! I split a medium "Lou's" pizza with two other people and it was perfect. We also got the chocolate chip cookie pizza for dessert. Perfect for 4 people. Our server Bobby was super cool.

We wanted pizza close to our hotel on Michigan Ave and realized Lou's was the place to go after observing long lines outside the place. We called ahead and picked it up. We had to have the spinach cheese bread as an appetizer because everyone said how yummy it was. CORRECT!  It wasn't very big. We got a medium thin crust pizza with mushrooms and it was tasty. We had a few leftovers.  You can't go wrong with this pizza!!

Great pizza! Chicago style deep dish pizza.  The LOU pizza is delicious. We had great table service. The wait is a little long (30 min) from time of order to hitting the table but fresh baked takes time.
Great place, great staff and super pizza! We tried the Malnati's deep dish pizza, but there are many other options.

Order pizza to go and it was stone cold! The pizza was horrible and almost completely hard. The price was way too high for a cold pizza. The bread was also cold and not very good at all. I was very disappointed in the food quality.

While I agree that many pizza places in Chicago are worthy of a 5 star rating, Lou Malnati's is a little slice of Chicago heaven! If you are in Chi-town looking for a great Chicago style pie, you must try Lou Malnati's!

This was our 1st pizza place while our stay in chicago. My 1st imperssion of this place was bad the min we were seated by the bathroom. As a visitor if u take down my number and see that I am out of town you should attempt to sit me in a better seat with the best waiter. It got worst....                      The waiter then tells us" I have bad news your pizza was burnt!" I was confused its a regular chesse pizza and thats what they specialize in. When we finally got the pizza I was not amazed it was salty and old dough. I DID GO TO OTHER pizza place check out my review on them giordonos and connie

Deep dish pizza is a must try when in Chicago. Pequod's was too far out of the way and my girlfriend didn't like the ambiance of Giordano's, so we decided on Lou Malnati's. The lunch wait was 15 minutes for a party of 2, not too bad. It was smart of them to take our order before seating us so that they can get a headstart on our pizza. We couldn't decide which pizza we wanted to order, so we ended up sharing two personal size pizzas.  The Malnati Chicago Classic - I love the butter-crust on this pizza, really held it together. Cheese and sausage are always a good combination, but nothing life-changing.  The "Lou" - The spinach, mushroom, cheese combination was delicious. My preferred between the two that we ordered.  I would highly recommend coming with more people do that you can get the true deep dish, I think ours was a bit miniature sized since we ordered the personal size. Glad I tried it out, can check it off the food bucket list now!
I didn't love the famous Chicagoan deep dish pizza.  I like pizza better when it has a thin and crunchy crust.  It was gooey and the cheese chewy, hard to swallow.
Amazing pizza and good service. We will be back.  Crust is crispy to perfection. It's a great spot for work lunch.  Not to crazy or loud.

A visit to Chicago isn't complete without trying deep dish pizza, right? After being severely disappointed by Giordano's, I decided to give Lou Malnati's a try. The wait for two on a Friday evening was approximately 45 minutes. After giving the host / hostess your name, you can order at the front (so they can prepare your pizza as you wait). They send you text updates (and you can check your place on line) to your phone, so feel free to walk around nearby! I ordered a personal Malnati Chicago Classic - sausage, cheese, tomato sauce all on a Buttercrust! Everything I need. The food came out relatively quickly, and it was all I ever dreamed of! I burned the roof of my mouth digging into the pizza. Very cheesy and rich, but not too heavy. Just perfect. Much better than Giordano's in my opinion. I highly recommend a visit if you want to try deep dish.

The butter crust is not as good as it used to be before Lou Malnatis opened up the additional locations. I remember taking the first bite years back, and I thought "dang this is the best crust I've never had" I got the classic one with sausage and the layers of meat, cheese, sauce, and crust was still good, but their crust was disappointing and tasted like it was undercooked.   I just had Costco pizza the day before I ordered one from here and, sad to say, the Costco pizza was unfortunately better than this.

Lou Malnati's was recommended to my boyfriend and told it was one of the best places for pizza in Chicago. The atmosphere was nice and busy with voices, the way a pizzeria should be. We ordered the spinach stuffed bread as an appetizer and it was delicious. Their marinara sauce tasted so fresh and full of flavor and we devoured our appetizer in minutes. As for the pizza, we ordered half sausage and half Lou (tomatoes basil mushroom etc.). It was an awesome pizza, so flavorful with a softer crust and lots of sauce. We ordered a medium, but we were both pretty full after one slice so we had lots of leftovers. I can't really compare this pizza to others in the area as I am from California and have only tried 2 different pizzas in Chicago. Nevertheless, it was mouthwatering. Would definitely recommend.

4.5 stars Anyone who's grown up in the Chicagoland area has his/her own preference deep dish... and while I haven't managed to pick my No. 1, Lou Malnati's is certainly a top contender. Sure, they're a chain and now have locations all around the area but that hasn't led to a decline in the quality of their food or flavors. To be honest, I've only ever ordered pizza and MAYBE an appetizer or two. But come on, if I'm going to Lou Malnati's, I'm going to for pizza.  While you can definitely pick your own toppings, I like to stick with the Chicago Classic sausage deep dish and the "Lou", a vegetarian deep dish. In the Chicago Classic pizza, the sausage is really slabs of lean meat opposed to ground sausage since it's nestled under your sauce and gooey cheese. While the sauce and buttercrust are already great, for a little kick, I do always add red pepper flakes. Not needed by any means but I find that it does help to enhance the experience some more... and I'm not normally a red pepper flakes kind of person. The buttercrust doesn't get the rise of a typical pizza dough and is more dense. I find this gets soggy less quickly and is a better vehicle for this style of pizza. As for the "Lou", this is also a pretty classic mix of mushroom, spinach, and tomatoes. The two pizzas are quite different in flavor profile and even though the veggie pizza is pretty substantial, it tastes much lighter compared to the Classic. Sometimes when you have a veggie pizza, you can feel like you're missing out on flavors but I've never felt that way with the "Lou". For a group of 6, we preordered a large and a small, waited 20 min for a table and our pizzas came out 15 min later. So even if there's a long wait for a table (depending on location), be sure to put in your pizza order in advance because it really helps to save the wait once you're seated.

Probably my favorite Deep Dish in Chicago. Overall very tasty, and they let you order while you wait for a table, so you don't wait for food very long. Recommend that you try this place if you're just here for a bit, and looking for a good deep dish experience.

First you must understand I have never really liked pizza......until now! This hands down was the best pizza I have ever had. Six of us arrived and were quickly seated. We had a great salad I don't recall the name  but it had an amazing amount of toppings and the portion sizes on the menu are spot on! Our table settled for the Lou, a cheese only, and sausage and cheese with butter crust. All we're absolutely delectable! The waiter kept our sodas filled and served our pizza with a smile. The entire experience was great! It was a short walk from the art museum and well worth it! Dinner and drinks for six with salad ran us 85.00+tip! Not bad at all and we took half of a pizza home - yum midnight snack!

I've been eating Giordano's or Gino's every time I'd venture out to Chicago but have been wanting to try Malnati's and finally got to last night.  We ordered a medium pepperoni pie with their signature butter crust and substituted the sauce for their Thin pizza sauce to keep those annoying tomato chunks off our pizza.  To get the full experience I also got a root beer. The pizza was great and I'd rank it best of the 3 deep dish places I've been in Chicago, primarily because of that crust.  It's not stuffed as much or as deep as the others but that crust is phenomenal, in a perfect world a giordanos pie with a Malnati's crust and you'd change the Chicago pizza game. I also like the ordering system, because it takes about 30 mins to cook, they let you order before you sit at your table.

The people that work here are pretty rude which seems to be pretty consistent with all these brand restaurants across the city. Called in advance and was told if you pre-ordered that you got priority seating. Arrived on site and was told by the manager that is not the case at all. He was pretty rude in his response as was the hostess. Get your story straight people. Basically the pizza carries the place cause if they had to count on customer service they would go under. If the pizza ever goes downhill the place is history.

It's always a good experience when I'm here! This is my go to for all out of town guest so they can experience some good deep dish pizza! It was packed when I can and they quoted me a 30 min wait, but they allowed me to pre order my pizza which was a lifesaver so I wouldn't have to wait another 45 mins for the Pizza. It's like my "umpteenth" time coming her so I know I'll be back to this location.

You can't go to Chicago and not get some deep dish pizza! We picked this place based off Yelp and TripAdvisor. It was a good choice!! We started out with the calamari and three cheese bread. The garlic dipping sauce for the three cheese bread was amazing. Also, loved the calamari. We have a family of 5 and the Medium deep dish was plenty for us. The slices are thick, so all of us could only finish one per person. We actually had leftovers. I don't know why the menu said that a medium feeds 3?!?! The service was also excellent. We accidental ordered the classic, instead of the cheese(not realizing the classic comes with sausage on it). Our kids don't like sausage, so our server hooked us up and rushed out another pizza, not charging us for the classic. So we had a whole pizza to take with us! And the pizza was soooooo good. I see why deep dish is so popular. Highly recommend this place!!! 5 stars all the way!!!

Yummm is the word!  I am not a huge pizza fan but when we visited Chicago we had to try to FAMOUS deep dish!  and OH BOY! it was delish!!!  We were in the city for two days and all we ate while touring the city was deep dish! we ate at the location near the fountain and Gold coast both had good feel about them. on a friday night we waited for approx. an hour for our turn at fountain location and it was toatally worth the wait.  We ordered Lou's bruchetta and Lou's Fav deep dish. We loved it so much we had leftovers for breakfeast the next day and late lunch at the Gold coast location.  I will recommend everyone to try the deep dish to instantly fall in love. I am not a pizza lover but loved the deep dish!

I've eaten at Lou Malnati's and Giodano's many times over the years, but I must say Lou's is my favorite. The deep dish is consistently fresh, hot, and delicious. We got The Lou, which I highly recommend to veggie lovers. I'd actually give my recent experience at this location 3.5 stars because the hostess was rude and not paying attention and although we ordered ahead while waiting, the pizza still took longer than 45 minutes and service was a bit slow. Could've just been because they were busy, but rounded up anyway for the delicious pizza!

My family and I stopped here on a whim on our first trip to Chicago. I wanted a "real" Chicago deep dish experience, and Lou Malnati's did not disappoint! The crust was soft and buttery. The marinara fresh and sweet.  The filling of high quality. I had the spinach, mushroom, tomato pie. It was fabulous. My husband had the sausage. He loved it. My daughter had the ravioli kids meal and gave it 2 thumbs up. You'll wait about 40 minutes for your pizza, but I found that to be standard for deep dish. Pasta dishes will be quicker. The hostess and server were both friendly and attentive. We will definitely return on our next trip to Chicago!

Good pizza, but not worth a second visit on my next trip to the Windy City. 4 of the 5 wait staff that we interacted with were rude. Didn't mind the long wait since this was touted as the place to go for Chicago pizza. I loved that we were able to order our pizza while we waited. Ordered appetizers to go as well, so we were able to eat our appetizers while we were waiting for a table. Once seated, we thought our pizza would be ready in 5-10 min. We both ordered personal sizes of the "Lou," so we figured it shouldn't take long. We were seated after about 30 minutes and the pizza was supposedly going to take 35 minutes. After waiting at the table an additional 20-30 min, I went to check on it and was told the waiter would bring it out. Went back to the table and after waiting for the waiter, inquired about the pizza. Another 5-10 min and suddenly our pizzas appeared. Now, the pizzas were good. The crust is crispy and buttery, cheese has a nice crust to it, and the sauce and toppings were a nice ratio. Never heard any apologies about why it took so long. By this time, we'd been there for almost an hour and a half, including the wait. The wait, combined with the attitude and rude comments I overheard from the waitstaff, are enough to ensure I won't be back. I would definitely consider picking up pizza to go if I had time to spare.

I drool every time I think about Lou Malnati's Pizza, enough said.  I've recently been to this location and it's packed! What I loved about it is they let you look at the menu and order ahead of time. They have a fully automated wait list where they send you text! and notifies you your place in line/queue.  There are different sizes to choose from (personal, S, M, L) there were 3 of us that shared a medium size and we have an ample 2 slices each. It was so worth the wait.

It's not very often that I get to eat deep dish pizza, so whenever I'm lucky enough to visit Chicago I always make it a priority to have a slice or two. On my most recent trip, I happened to be staying just a 5-10 minute walk away from this Lou Malnati's, so decided to come here for my fix.  I ordered pickup, which was pretty convenient. The pizza took about 30 minutes to make, which gave me plenty of time to get ready and walk over. I ordered a personal pizza, which was about 8" wide, with onions and green peppers inside. I will say, the pizza is baseline kind of expensive and then the extra price for toppings is steep, but for a special treat it's definitely worth it. The pickup service was easy and fast, and soon enough I was home eating a delicious deep dish pizza with a perfectly crispy crust, flavorful tomato sauce, and tons and tons of cheese of course. Love how fast the takeout service was, and I'll definitely be back.

Excellent pizzeria! This place is ALWAYS busy. There are usually large crowds, literally, out the door waiting for their pie! It might not be the most convenient place to just suddenly drop by, because of the wait time, but, their sauce, crust, and flavor is great! So, it's no wonder everyone goes here. Customer service could use a little brushing up, but this is a small point. Much of the front staff is very young. It would also be nice if somehow they could figure out a better waiting area or have a bar, but because space is probably limited, this might be tough. In general, however, we've always enjoyed their great pizzas, especially their deep dish. As usual, it takes about 40-minutes from order to table, which is normal for these type of quality pizzas, but weather for pick-up or dining-in, we've always had a good time and a great pizza meal! We'll definitely be back!

First time ever having Chicago Deep dish style pizza and very happy. We ordered one Cheese deep dish and one Malnati Classic. The meat was absolutely perfect, and both pies were amazingly cheesy and delicious. Personally I enjoyed the Malnati Classic more. I would most definitely recommend it and would certainly return next time I am in Chicago.

Man oh man. I have been here multiple times. Not being a local I am always worried that it is a chain and I am missing out on a better experience. I am too lazy to look it up. I come back because I keep  having a great one.  The crust is buttery, crispy and delicious. The deep dish with sauce, sausage and pepperoni is delicious. It is always fresh and amazing. We also had the chocolate chip pizza which was better than it sounds.
Fantastic deep dish pizza.   Chrispy crust and chunky sauce.   Way more ingredients and cheese than all the competitors.  We also ordered spaghetti for our kids which was amazing too.

I wish I were exaggerating when I say that I had trouble even swallowing my meal, gagging at the flavor and texture. I love Chicago stuffed pizza, and I wanted to branch out after eating now countless slices of my #1 go-to, Giordano's -- my favorite aspect is hands down their chewy, flaky, buttery crust, followed by the slightly zesty but mild tomato sauce, and of course the thick layer of cheese. Most other places I've tried (such as J.B. Alberto's) achieve that same basic taste, but fall short of the buttery taste in the crust, or their sauce is insipid, too smooth. But Lou Malnotti's isn't even close; it lacks every aspect I enjoy in deep dish. Though I paid the extra charge for their so-called butter crust on my pizza for one, what I bit into was a cracker (nowhere near thick enough, not even capable of flakiness or chewiness) that's only discernible flavor was reminiscent of cardboard with a lingering taste of grease -- which also felt terrible to chew, and the more I did so, the harder it became to swallow. The sauce and cheese were similarly flavorless, or at least whatever flavor they possessed was overpowered by the greasy cardboard taste. Had I been anything less than famished from having skipped lunch, I wouldn't have forced down more than my initial slice, and even as hungry as I was, I couldn't finish what was a modestly sized personal pie. I suppose I'm thankful for the experience, because now I can go back to enjoying my Giordano's secure in the knowledge that I find it vastly preferable to the other big names, but that silver lining still only earns this one star.

Absolutely the best pizza I've ever tasted! We had the Malnati Salad and the Classic Deep Dish Pizza. We topped it all off with the chocolate chip cookie pizza. Great wait staff and cute little to-go boxes. Don't miss out on this experience! True taste of Chicago!
Personal sized pizza was overpriced and tiny for a man. Decent flavor but not the best I've had.

Best crust I've ever had! Although being from the south, I've not had the most extensive experience with deep dish pizza; Lou Malnati's was absolutely incredible pizza. We also got the Spinach Cheese bread which was prepared differently than I'd ever had before either, but was equally as good. Lastly, the ONLY reason I gave this 4 Stars was due to the fact that they ran out of my type of bottled beer, which was very unfortunate. Other than that, zero complaints, great food, great service.

We tried four deep dish pizza places in four days and this place was amazing!! The crust was just the right amount of crispy and soft. The cheese was overflowing and the sauce seemed to have a wine base (exceptional!). You have to try the Sausage or the Malnati's Chicago Classic, the sausage in both are flavored consistently and thoroughly. Be prepared to eat this with a fork and knife! Also, you have to try the Chocolate Chip Pizza. There's a thin soft (with slightly crisped edges) chocolate chip cookie at the bottom heaped with piles of ice cream and whip cream. I've had this type of dessert all of the US, but never as good as it was at Lou Malnatis. We arrived around 5 pm and got seats immediately, however when we left around 6:45 there was a wait. The pizza took about 50 minutes to arrive (standard deep dish wait time).

Good service, great food! The artichoke dip was some of the best I've ever had. I got thin crust pizza and it was really good. My fiance had the deep dish and really liked it. We are visiting from out of town and have been to 3 different pizza places and the pizza here was FAR superior to the others.

We were looking for a deep dish pizza as our first meal in Chicago.  The place smelled good and the pizza looked good, but it wasn't anything special.  We were so bummed.  We had waited a long time for this and it was a disappointment.  Luckily we ordered the house salad and were very pleased with it.  I wouldn't go here just for the salad though.

The pizza is untouchable. Sausage out of this world. Crust!!!! Omgosh!! The bathroom, however, did smell like urine :(  but with the volume of people that go through there not everything can be perfect!! Service was good.... pizzas take about 30 minutes to cook so they have you order the pizza before you're sat! Less time waiting at the table! The family size salads were way bigger than expected! Probably  could serve up to 6 people, easy!!!!!

Amazing deep dish pizza with great sauce.  This was my first time having deep dish and I am a fan. I couldn't believe how filling it is.  Three girls shared a single pie and we were stuffed and could barely finish it! We opted to get it for takeout, but the restaurant seemed like a nice enough place too.

Yum! First timer deep disher- I gained like 10lbs. lol I had the original Lou's and it was delicious. Tasted like lasagna essentially. I'm from cali and I think New York is best for its thin and the Windy City has its thick crust. A definite must try at this historic restaurant.

Great service! The estimated 20-minute wait was hardly 7, our waiter was super nice and attentive, the curly fries were the right level of crispy, we pre-ordered our pie so we didn't have to wait very long--and it was consistently delicious as other locations I've been to. Yum yum yum.

If you're looking for deep-dish Chicago-style melt-in-your-mouth pizza, Lou Malnati's has got to be the first place on your list. You've probably heard of it, and there's a reason. Their pizza is simply the best.  There are a couple things that Lou Malnati's so great and unique. Firstly, their pizza is awesome and they know it. How do they account for alllll of the people who want it? Multiple ways!  1) They have 48 locations in Chicago (2 new in Phoenix, AZ!)  2) They offer online ordering (in case you don't want to wait in line) 3) They offer catering, in case you want to please a whole bunch of people without the fuss of leaving your own home 4) Most incredibly: they allow you to SHIP A PIZZA. To anywhere nationwide! Have you ever thought while eating, "hey I wish so-and-so could try this but they live somewhere else" (I have), because now you can FIX THAT. And they offer deals based on how many your order! It's a slam dunk. Company aside, this restaurant location is one of the most fun ones in Chicago. It's in the middle of everything, and close to a bunch of bars and clubs so when you're done eating you can go out on the town (if you're up to it, I was pretty full).  I came with a group of about 20 people and we ended up having to wait a few hours. It was not ideal, but we knew what we were getting into. After finally being able to get seated the staff was so nice to us regardless of the size of our group. Everybody ordered apps, everybody ordered drinks, and they didn't seemed stressed at all. We ordered 4 deep dish pizzas to share and even that was a lot. Regardless of what type you get, it will be delicious and you will want to eat until you regret it. We got cheese, sausage, pepperoni, and the "Malnati Chicago classic" and I have zero complaints about all four. If you want to know what eating their pizza is like, it's like taking a bit of a memory foam mattress covered in cheese (in a great way). I wanted to have this pizza as my new pillow.  The only issue we had was we had a friend in our group who was lactose intolerant. We asked for one of the pizzas to be without cheese, but in the time it took them to cook the pizzas (~40 more min) they had forgotten and there wasn't anything for her to eat. The staff was extremely apologetic but it was a little awkward because since it takes so long to cook the pizza, she just had to scrape it off one of her slices.  Other than that, our experience was FANTASTIC. I dream about eating this pizza. 11/10 would recommend!!

I walked in, not knowing what to expect. Right away my server, Bobby, started throwing out recommendations. I went with the Classic, and made sure to add pepperoni on Bobby's suggestion.  Let me tell you, the pizza did not disappoint. I broke the cardinal sin of Chicago Deep Dish Pizza and got a side of ranch that was not even used. The pizza was so good, I can easily say it was the best pie I had ever had in my life. The sausage was fresh and very flavorful, while the pepperoni finished off the top. The cheese was a perfect blend with the ingredients and was never overwhelming, as I have had with other "Deep Dish" pizzas in the past. As a frequent pizza participant in California, I would recommend coming here, sitting in Bobby's section and having the best Pizza of your life.

I had a small pepperoni and mushrooms pizza. I could only eat 2 pieces and took the other 2 with me. Amazing sauce, loved the crust and overall was an awesome pizza. Good service family friendly and worth the wait, enjoy!

Dinner at one of the "Famous` Lou Malnatis. Got in, pre ordered pie. Were seated approximately 10 or so minutes later. Here is where they started to fail....... Waited longer for someone else to take simple drink order about 15 minutes. One guy walked by, looked and kept on walking. Finally ordered drinks, app and salad. Here only for work/mini vacation,  so really don't think what I have to say in review will matter one way or the other. People will continue to come here. We just wanted to try it and say we were here. Pie was okay, but we decided we are not deep dishers. Will stick with our thin crust west coast pizzas. Seems as though  there are  too many locations, and it's too "chainy" .  Not a special place to go. Going to be another Pizza Hut? Thanks for the experience.

Can't come to Chicago without trying deep dish pizza! We were told that the 2 main chains were this and Giordano's. Giordano's had a more old-school, homey Italian feel to it in terms of decor, while Lou Malnati's was a bit more modern. We came in at prime Saturday lunch time, and the wait was only about 15 minutes. They took our order at the counter while we waited so that they can get started on cooking our pizzas, which I thought was really smart.  My boyfriend and I ordered a personal "Malnati Chicago Classic" (sausage and tomato) and a personal "The Lou" (spinach, mushrooms, and tomato). Of the 2, I liked the overall flavors of the "The Lou" more. However, the "Malnati Chicago Classic" is made with a butter crust which made it more crispy, buttery, and therefore, better in that sense. This was my first time trying deep dish pizza ever, and what I most enjoyed about it is the how the cheese oozes out in between the layers of topping and crust, and is super stringy and, for lack of better words, more cheesy than regular flat pizza. In the end though, pizza is pizza, and I will probably never crave this again. But it's a good meal to have if all else fails while you're in the Windy City.

Been to this place so many times at many locations all I could say is eh. Meh. The calamari came cold and soggy and the sausage pizza was over loaded with disks of meat nothing extremely outstanding other than the crust but easy place to get to and order from where I live. If you are a first timer to chicagos deep dish I would recommend peaquods over this any day.

This was the best experience to the famous deep dish pizza experience we had in Chicago.. after a long day out and about with the kids, we were promptly seated within 5 min of arrival..  the bruschetta was full of flavor . We placed our order for one deep dish between us two and 1 cheese thin dish . Perfect size portion and so much flavor. The Deep dish I recommend to get extra buttery.. you won't complain..

May rating is low and I'm thinking it may be my fault. I ordered the pizza for delivery instead of trying my first authentic deep dish in the restaurant.  So not hot at all. And then it's, just not enough crust it was almost like lasagna. I did love Giordano's!

This is my first time trying deep dish pizza. I cannot say enough we have come to Lou to experience their special signature dish. Since they close late which make the obvious choice to stop by after landed at Chicago.  We have chosen the Malnati Chicago Classic. It is a butter crust with tomato sauce. I like the way they lay in layer with the sauce, cheese, and sausage. I like hand made crust. Even the sausage is from scratch. Love the flavor. It has rubber like cheese that can stretch 100 miles. Try to eat that if you go 100 miles. For me just 1200 miles from Tampa.  I like they serve it and cut in front of you. The service is attentive. The close up is quick. The sausage in the pizza is the best. Well made. Only thing is I can only try it once in my whole trip. I am not a pizza person. But I like this one.
Ok,  I visited Lou malnatis about a year ago and had a terrible visit.  Thought to try again tonight....delicious!  The wait was long but well worth it.   Yummy!!!

If you are planning to dine here, it'd be best to understand ahead of time that you will wait. As a visitor to Chicago who was given Lou Malnati's on suggestion for the best deep dish, we were willing to wait. That being said, if I lived here, I may only get the occasional takeout. The pizza was delicious and scratch made with good ingredients, that was apparent. It was just very heavy and I don't tend to eat this way regularly.  Being a busy place, I really appreciated that they let us preorder our pizza and buy a beer while we waited. The web checkin kept us updated on our place in line on our phone. We were sat within the time frame we were promised and ordered an app of fried cheddar curds that came out immediately. They were rich, creamy and also heavy. If you like fried food, they were fresh made and a nice alternative to mozzarella sticks to try something different. I also ordered a glass of Cabernet. The pour was large for $8 and it was a decent restaurant wine for the price. Our pizza still took some time to arrive even with preordering. It was delicious. The crust was buttery and crispy almost like a cookie on the bottom. The cheese was obviously quality. The sausage over the top tasted like it was made there and the same with the tomato sauce. It was light and fresh tasting. Anything heavier would have made the whole pie over the top too much. It was a nice balance.  The service was excellent. The staff were conversational and fun. The environment was casual and clean but very, very loud.  If you want to try deep dish pizza while in Chicago, this place was definitely good. Even big eaters though will probably be satisfied with 1-2 slices, don't over order like we did!
Fabulous pizza! Well worth the trip! Our server was very knowledgeable and service was excellent. Will definitely come here again.

Deep dish pizza was tasty and service was great! Even though the wait times were long, the app was super convenient and helped us keep track of where we were in line. The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because the personal pizza is not really deep dish. I wish I knew that before I ordered. You have to get one of the sizes to truly experience deep dish pizza. The Lou was my favorite; flavor was deep and the crust was delicious.

I can't come to Chicago without stopping at Lou Malnati's. Even if we do have it in AZ now . Came with a group of 5 and we were all set to have a good time. We pre-ordered our pizza which was a nice option to make us not feel so bad about the 15-20 min wait. It took about 30-35 mins but our alcoholic beverages helped to calm our nerves.  This time I tried the gluten free crust today with the Lou...light cheese (praying for my tummy). It was so good. The only issue that I had with this visit was our slightly rude server. When you make comments like, "can you stop talking so I can confirm you pizza order" (approaching our table for the first time to take our order and confirm our pizza order) and "I don't understand what you are asking" (when someone asked the consistency of the various vinaigrettes) or "what are you asking...gluten or dairy" (which her response when I was trying to understand if the salad dressing was both gluten AND dairy free)...you can use some training (Teresa F.).

Best pizza  I've ever had!!! Was recommended by several of the locals, and I can see why! Delish. Staff was great  too. Our waitress Tabitha was as sweet as pizza pie. We tried another pizza spot on out taste testing journey claiming to be number one  but Lou Malnati's stole the show! This is definitely where I would recommend for Chicago pizza and we will ne comming back again! We were considering taking the largest size pizza home with us on the plane and are sad to give up this slice of Chicago.

Got to try this place out! We have had Giordianos many times and we wanted to try another deep dish spot and heard of this place! This pizza joint blew us away. This deep dish pizza spot had a rich cheese taste. You can tell this place is filled with fresh product. We had the  Malnati Chicago Classic Pizza. We had three people splitting pizza and it was more than enough! We literally were stuffed and had left overs. The pizza is delicious and has so fullifilling. I couldn't eat for the rest of the day. It is a bit oily! I wish they had more signature dishes to had choose from because I'm not a big build your own. The pizza is a bit oily but go figure lol. There are several locations in the city and I think it is totally worth trying! If your in Chicago make sure you do that favor for yourself!

Ordered a medium sausage with butter crust. Pizza was pretty divine. Deep dish didn't disappoint. Big chunks of sausage. Flavorful sauce and flaky buttery crust. You pre-order at the counter before getting seated. Restaurant had a 35 minute wait on a Saturday at 3 PM.  Service and ambiance merely befits the price and the type of the cuisine they serve. Keep in mind that this is a pizza restaurant. Would recommend from a first time novice deep dish eater.

Did lots of research to find the best pizza place in Chicago and many said this place. And I knew I was there when the line of people were waiting outside and even more people were inside.  There was an hour wait once I finally got inside and put my name down.  They did have free pizza made and sitting on the counter for those who were waiting which is a nice touch.  They were also allowing people to pre order which is a good option. While I don't know how much longer it would have been if I didn't pre order, it's still better than waiting and hour for a table then ordering.  Got the deep dish option with the famous butter crust and a thin crust personal pizza.  Th thin crust option was pretty good. It's crispier and more like a cornmeal crust which is different. The toppings I had were chicken sausage, mushroom, and the spinach mix which has garlic and onion in it. So good.  I know people like deep dish but I sure don't so I was very pleased with the thin crust option.  Only con is I wish the small was smaller honestly. It's meant for two people vs one like the menu said.  Worth a stop seeing as the whole town is there lol
If you want a Chicago experience pizza, you need to go there. Service is great, pizza is delicious, now thinking to order online to have it whenever. Great place for lunch and dinner with friends.

We ordered ahead to ensure our pizza's were ready and it was good. I tried the cheese and this was my first time eating deep dish so I can't compare it to anything. However, as a pizza lover, I expected a bit more. It was good but not great. The service was really outstanding  though! Would go again!

Came to Lou Manalti's on a trip to Chicago. I was with a group of five. It took us forever to get seated -- you need half your party there before they'll seat you, and some of our crew was running late. One of our crew had to leave kind of quickly to catch a show, so we were able to order a pizza before we were seated. Unfortunately, even with the head start the pizza didn't come out for 75 minutes (!!) so our pal had to leave hungry. The pizza was pretty delicious. We had a family size salad as well, which was huge! One large pizza and a one salad was more than enough for our table of five-minus-one. The manager did end up comping our food, so I'm not too upset about having had to wait. I think in the future I'd come back here for the pizza, but I would likely order takeout and eat it in a park or at the beach or something.

We went there on 6/20/17. We were a party of 10 with 2 children under the age of 6. We were told that we could put our name on the wait list once we were on our way there only to be told that we could not. We arrived at 7:00pm and we did not get seated until almost 9:00pm and we were seated at a bar table with stools...not even a regular table and this freaked out our 3 year old granddaughter because she was afraid to sit up so 'high'. We did not get our food until almost 9:30!!! even after we pre ordered our pizza the wait for our food was nearly an hour. This was totally unacceptable. On the plus side the pizza was good. I won't be back. I suggest ordering take out.

Hostess say us ( party of 4 ) at a table with 3 chairs , then left . After finding my own chair the service was good from that point on . Food was good we got the house salad with house dressing , very good. Then a Lou pizza. They used all fresh ingredients and overall a good pizza.

Visited this place as I wanted to experience Chicago deep dish pizza while in the area for a conference. So glad that I stopped by here. Ordered personal deep dish pizza with pepperoni. About $10. Note that pizzas take 30 minutes to prepare. Very much worth the wait. Pizza has buttery crust and tomato chunks in sauce. Liked it so much that I went back a second time with my work group during the same trip. Highly recommended and will definitely come back when I visit Chicago again!

"They" weren't kidding when they said, "If you're going to Chicago, you HAVE to eat at Lou Malnati's." We had the classic and the Lou, plus the Malnati salad and a few drinks. I'm from Detroit, and have to admit, Buddy's was my fave until this past weekend. Now I'm torn. Guess I need to plan another trip to Chicago... In addition, the service was fantastic. It was my daughter's birthday, which we didn't mention directly to our server, but were talking about as she took care of us. After she brought the checks, she brought a little ice cream cupcake with a candle on top - an unexpected and delightful touch! My daughter was tickled - and so were the adults at the table. And as if that wasn't enough, we asked her to take a pic of the group - 7 in total - as it was our last day in town - and it's the best group pics we've ever had together. So on top of being an exceptional server - she's a great photographer, too. It's the little things, and Lou Malnati's does them well.

If you're in Chicago you need to have the deep dish pizza and Lou's is the place to go! We had the deep dish cheese pizza while visiting and it was amazing! Deep dish pizza just became my new fave . I highly recommend this place and enjoy the best Chicago has to offer! TIP: takes about 45 minutes to make the food so make sure you go with plenty of time or order ahead if you can!
I'm not a Chicago native but visit once or twice a year.  So far this has been my favorite pizza.

We came into Chicago for the day from Michigan, and this was recommended by the dispatcher at Spot Hero (yes, not only can they find you parking, they also suggest restaurants...that's another review though).  We got the traditional deep dish pizzas and they were wonderful. It takes about 30 mins for pizzas to arrive, not bad for fresh. The Malnati salad was absolutely amazing. I'm not a fan of blue cheese, but it worked so well with the other ingredients.  We also had the garlic bread with marinara, which was really good.  Our sever was bery sweet (I feel so bad I don't remember her name), but anywho. All the servers around us seemed to have the same excitement to serve.  I'll definitely stop by again the next time I'm in Chicago!
Unfortunately that was the only pizzeria we tried in Chicago so I cannot really compare it with the others. But pizza was very good and service was fine. We would definitely go back next time

So I'm not from Chicago and I really wanted to try a deep dish pizza...but I'm sorry to say that I really wasn't impressed by it. My table got one medium pizza to share and a pasta. The server cut the pizza for us and it beautifully gooey and cheesy and the soft on the inside with a somewhat crunchy hard crust...I just wasn't feeling it. We actually thought the pasta would be smaller for like $12 BUT IT WAS SO BIG and fed all of us so that we only had one slice of medium pizza. We didn't make a reservation so there was a bit of a wait, but it's really cool they allow you to order your pizza upfront so that when you sit down, the pizza is basically ready for you (very efficient). The table service was really nice but the lady taking orders for pizza upfront was not as nice.

First time having deep dish pizza and it did NOT disappoint. Try going a bit earlier or later than the food rush - it gets busy even on weeknights. For four people, we had a small and a personal pizza and it was more than enough. The ambiance is nice and it was a great first deep dish experience!

I went here for the lunch special the previous week - a drink, a mini-deep dish pizza, and a salad for around $9 or $10.  Not bad at all!  The deep dish only took 15 mins to arrive, so if you're in a rush, but have a bit of extra time to spare, I would go with the deep dish. The service was spectacular as well. Everyone always talks about Gino's and Giordano's for good Chicago deep dish, but among these, my favorite is Lou's!
First taste of authentic Chicago deep dish. Lots of cheesy goodness and a buttery crust, I could only finish one and a half slices! We ordered the classic.

Real nice people and real nice service. Waitress was on top of things. BUT, we all couldn't stand the pizza. A nice pool of water floating on top of a deep dish pie makes for a bunch of mush. Just not my idea of good pizza.  I will reiterate, they were fantastic and nice, just not good pie.
Best deep dish pizza I have ever had!! It was unbelievable. A long wait for an early lunch but was def worth the wait.

***4-4.5 stars*** I only tried 2 deep dish pizza places during my time in Chicago. Lou Malnati's was the first. This location was right next to our hotel, so we conveniently walked over for lunch on a Wednesday (6/7/17). For those that aren't familiar, Lou Malnati's is one of the most popular deep dish pizzerias in all of Chicago. They have been around for a long time. The place that everyone talks and raves about. Fair to say, I had pretty big expectations walking in. I ordered a small cheese deep dish pizza, priced at $12.55. Their deep dish pizzas take about 30-40 minutes to cook, so be prepared to wait a little. It's worth it. Every pizza here is hand made from scratch with high quality ingredients. Service was good for the most part. No real complaints. Our server was pretty attentive throughout the meal. The menu was straight forward, and ordering was not an issue. The restaurant wasn't crowded, which was nice. I was expecting it to be packed. The pizza here was really good. I enjoyed their pizza considerably more than Giordano's, and definitely thought it was better. I liked the dough, and the sauce was superb. The pizza was cooked really well. I also liked that this pizza wasn't overly cheesy. It had the right mix and ratio of ingredients. All in all, this place met expectations, but didn't quite exceed them. I thought the pizza was delicious, but it didn't blow me away. I would definitely come back here again, but am curious to try other places next time I visit Chicago. For the price, Lou Malnati's does provide a pretty good value. I was stuffed. The pizzas here are definitely quality. Go check this place out for yourself!

Visited Chicago for the first time from LA and I was extremely excited to try this place from multiple recommendations by our Lyft drivers. For appetizer, we got the buffalo wings and it was good! Then We ordered "The Lou" and it tasted just ALRIGHT. The main part of the pizza was good but the crust was NOT okay. It seemed like it was cooked all the way.. service was good though.

Between Lou's and Giordano's, this place has it hands down. Their buttery pan crust is just killer. The sauce, meatballs, and cheese, is just made perfectly. We ordered their classic Malnati pie which ran for $23 for 3 people. Yes, it's more than enough. We also ordered the sampler which came with mozzarella sticks, cheese balls, fried zucchini, and fried mushrooms. I definitely recommend ordering their spinach stuffed bread; it's cheesy, full of fresh spinach, and the bread itself is a butter-pan loaf! This location is clean, full of ventilation, and is one of those low-key spots away from the touristy areas.

How can you go to Chicago without getting a deep dish pizza? The debate of the best deep dish seems to be between Giordiano and Lou Malnati's. While I cannot say if Giordano is better or worse, I can confirm that Lou's pizza lives up its delicious fame! Before I sat down, I was impressed with the restaurant's efficient ordering system. Waiting is expected in one of the most popular chains for the city's most iconic food, but Lou Malnati's turned this disadvantage into a method to counter deep dish pizza's notoriously long preparation time. Instead of having you wait for your seat and then wait again for your food, Lou Malnati's allows you to order before you wait so your pizza will arrive shortly after you are seated! This restaurant also uses a texting system so you are not forced to squeeze with fellow patrons in the lobby to secure your spot in the line. Restaurants everywhere should do this! Now the pizza itself was as great as reputed! Initially, I was stunned by how tiny the Lou's Classic personal pizza was, because it was almost as small as a large quiche, but as I dig in, I got over the small size for two reasons: 1) The pizza was simply delicious! The sausages were flavorful without being too salty and complemented well with the zesty cheese and the tangy tomato sauce. The crispy buttercrust was also delicious on its own! 2) Surprisingly, the personal pizza filled me up despite its size! Perhaps the small pizza was really packed. Anyway, if you are in Chicago as a visitor, do yourself a favor and get a deep dish pizza. This place's deep dish pizza will make you understand why it is such an iconic dish! Ugh, just typing about this is making me want to return to Chicago... --- tl;dr version: 1) One of Chicago's most famous deep dish chains 2) Efficient ordering and waiting system 3) Small but filling pizza that is famously delicious!
Pretty good pizza! I thought it lacked a little in flavor otherwise it would be 5 stars. Adding Parmesan and pepper flakes helped. I'd come back.

As a Chicago girl through and through, it's basically in my DNA to love Lou Malnati's. Oh wait, no. It's part of being a human. Lou's rocks. No debate. I grew up going to the Buffalo Grove location and although the food is consistent at all Lou Malnati's, this is why the South Loop Lou's deserves all 5 stars... When you go to Lou's, you have to be hungry. The pizza is super filling. However, going to a restaurant when you're hungry and ordering a pizza that could take 30-45 minutes to bake is not always the best combination. Luckily, I typically call ahead my pizza. This is a pro tip that reduces your wait time for both a table and your pizza. This time around, however, my trip to Lou's was impromptu. My friends and I were so hangry that we didn't think to call ahead our pizza. We were more focused on getting to Lou's. When we walked in on a Sunday at 3:00pm, there was a 15-20 minute wait which is basically 30 seconds in Lou's time. Usually the wait is much longer. The highlight of waiting was that they place your pizza order when you put your name down on the waitlist for a table. This is pure genius! I've never seen this at a Lou's before! Maybe it's because I usually call ahead but it also could just have everything to do with brilliant efficiency at this particular location. Either way, I was so happy about this. The house salad never disappoints. I could eat the sweet vinaigrette dressing with everything. Lou's also happens to have the best ranch dressing. The real MVP of the house salad would have to be the croutons. They are buttery. They are flavorful. They are perfect. The pizza is obviously amazing. I do not eat Lou Malnati's as often as I should, it is always a treat to eat the pizza fresh out of the oven. I think Lou's is drastically different when delivered, carried out and fresh. Fresh is undoubtedly the best.  The service at this location was really great. Our server was awesome and very attentive. I live up in Lakeview but would totally venture back to the South Loop for this Lou's!

We had the The Malnati Chicago Classic... AMAZING! Best Chicago deep dish pizza we've ever had! The "buttercrust" is soooooo good, crispy not chewy, hard to describe but oh so good. There was a wait, but you can order your pizza before you get your table so that was nice. We will definitely be coming here again next time we are in Chicago.

Food was good. Server was weird and got mad at us for passing out our plates before the pizza arrived. She seriously scared us and made us feel terrible. She did the same thing to another table. She had short blowfish hair. Would go back for the food, but run away if she serves us again!

I had a deep dish classic pizza and it was extraordinarily superbly insanely GOOD, wow it's that good. Just try it. The stuff spinach bread was excellent as well. The small pizza it more than enough for two people if you planning to try other items from the menu.

I can't say i'm extremely qualified to review pizza places, but I will say that I really enjoyed this place when I visit Chicago. Just like everyone else - I ordered the famous Lou Malnati's classic deep dish. There was no wait when we arrives (5PM) and the staff are super helpful, as they're used to tourist coming into the city.  When we got our pizza, I was worried that it wouldn't be filling enough for my friend and I, however the pizza is around .5 - 1 inch deep. I was actually almost full after having one slice! The outer layer (meats and cheese) was soft and juicy, followed by a slightly chewy crust underneath. Chewy, not doughy though. I really appreciated this place for it's simple, yet well crafted pies.

This is a different take on the traditional deep dish. The crust is thin and crispy and buttery. The pizza interior is just ok. I had the classic sausage which almost felt like a breakfast sausage patty. But the crust is pretty darn good and unique

Literally googled best deep dish in Chicago and this popped up. I wasn't a deep dish guy before and I can't say I am after the experience. But it was pretty good as it had soooooo much cheese, and I love cheese. Too much sauce. Just ordered a regular pepperoni deep dish. Took forever, was really crowded and it was a weekday. Couldn't imagine a weekend.

A classic place for Chicago deep-dish pizza. Several natives told us this was the place to go, and it did not disappoint! Serving sizes were quite ample and delicious, and with this hefty of a portion, you really don't need more than a slice or two per person. We also enjoyed the pizza chips as an appetizer!

This review is from the perspective of someone with Celiac - 3 stars because their gluten free pizza left much to be desired. I've tried many different restaurants version of gluten free and several store brands and this crust honestly tasted stale to me. I would have preferred an Udis crust or even Dominos is better. I was diagnosed in 2011 before people thought it was "cool" to be gluten free (pro tip- it is NOT cool to have to eat gluten free...it sucks and anyone who does it by CHOICE is not thinking straight!) and this pizza reminded me of what some of the first pizza crusts tasted like that were gluten free. Back then you basically accepted the fact that it wasn't going to taste good but today many advances have been made and I expected more from them. The sauce was great though, very tomato-ey...which I loved! Also, I had their martini drink (I forget the name) and that was tasty too.
Awesome deep dish.  Big, buttery crust.  Instant comfort.  The Lou is my menu favorite.  It never disappoints!

If you are craving for Pizza, or you are a visitor in Chicago who wants to experience chicago pizza this place will be a suitable place.  I recommend chicago classic pizza with Italian sausage which was well mixed with cheese and tomato sauce. However, if you want to have a pizza with beer, you should go to somewhere else because this place do not have draft beer.  P.S. Salad was not as good as pizzas I want to give 3.8 stars

Came here for the calamari after waiting for 25 minutes to get a table preordered my pizza and still waiting another 25 minutes still haven't received it WTH the calamari isn't crunchy soggy any to chew Soooooo disappointed and the pizza got thin crust cheese same thing over all not worth the hassle!!

I was in town for a conference and this pizza place was right around the corner. My husband has eaten here before and told me it is very good. I ordered a personal Lou's to go. My experience was less than stellar. First of all, I was told that I had to wait 30 minutes to pick it up. That was OK because I wanted to walk around a bit. Then when I came to pick it up, the person couldn't find my order initially but then eventually found it with the help of the person who I ordered it from. OK. Then when I asked for Red pepper, he only gave me one packet and I had to ask for more. OK. No problem.  Then when I started eating the pizza it was cold, stuck to the circular paper stand and was worse than tasteless. I am wondering if they simply warmed up a frozen pizza for me. I have had frozen pizza from the grocery store that taste better than this. Maybe the pizza tastes better if you eat it in the restaurant. I'm not going to return to find out.
Excellent Chicago style pizza. Be prepared for long wait times. Pizzas are very good and the buttercrust is definitely worth the extra buck. Definitely place the order as soon as you go in.

Everyone raves about this place and it was recommended to me by a friend so I had to try it.  Unfortunately, I was very disappointed.  Went on a Sunday night (Memorial Weekend) and had to wait an hour and a half for a table.  They take orders when you arrive so didn't have to wait long for food once we were seated.  I was really wanting to love this as I love pizza in general, but it just wasn't that good.  The crust was dry, hard and flavorless.  I ordered the classic which comes with sausage and it was okay but not very tasty.  The tomato sauce and sausage was rather bland.Maybe that's the way it's supposed to taste?

TIP: Order your deep dish pizza as soon s you walk in, even if you don't have a table yet as it can take up to 35 mins to cook. Went here with a 7 person group and ordered our pizza before we got a table. While we were waiting they let us order our drinks and sit outside at one of their patio tables. Overall it was a great experience, and I will be coming back the next time I am in town.

I ordered takeout for the classic deep dish. The place was crazy busy when I arrived for pick up, but was handed my pizza just moments after paying. The quality of the pizza was above average and the ratio of tomato sauce, cheese, and sausage was perfect to my liking. Would most definitely order again.

This was the second deep dish place I had in Chicago, and it was just alright. I came here with a friend and we got seated immediately. The waiter took a bit of time to come around, and we tried ordering but got told he wasn't our waiter. We sat there for another five minutes waiting, and we asked the same waiter as before whether he could get my waiter for me. He pointed our waiter out, who was takin orders from others, and asked if he could give us anything to drink first.  Anyway, once our waiter came by, we ordered the original (basically cheese with sausage) and added spinach and mushrooms. The pizza took about half an hour to come out, as it said on the menu. The pizza was pretty wet and it wasn't too flavorful, and the crust was soggy. My first slice was pretty good in terms of crunchiness of the crust, but the second was just alright. There was a LOT of meat, but in general the pizza lacked flavor. I was somewhat disappointed by this experience.  Price is about the same as other deep dish places; it came out to be a little less than $22 post-tax.

Awesome place, suggested by co-worker!!! Get Classic Chicago deep dish pizza! Salad/BBQ Chix salad! Aaron was outstanding !!!!!! Second time here! Came back here 4 month later, brought friend! And I will be back!

It was decent pizza, neither great nor bad. Took forever and a day to get it. They take your order when you get on the list for a table. 40 minutes later you get seated and then wait another 30 to 45. Weird. The atmosphere is loud and very bland. Staff was friendly but seemed very short staffed. The cashiers were definitely not happy to be there lol

Carried out pizza. The order was ready on time and we got hot pizza. Outer guest (from India) loved the pizza and the flavor was amazing. ordered one veg deep dish and a thin crust.  The online ordering system was super easy to use and order was prepared as asked (i.e., easy cheese).
yeah...it's that good. the classic with the homemade sausage...yum yum yum

The service was good. This just isn't my type of pizza. Don't like the crust or the cheese. I feel bad giving it a 3 because it is a taste issue and not anything they are doing wrong. I just either prefer thin crust or stuffed pizza with that thick crispy crust. This did nothing for me.

The best deep dish pizza I've ever had. I usually go at least once every time I'm in Chicago. The buttery crust just gives it that extra flavor and all of the ingredients are just wonderful. On my last visit to Chicago I went to 2 different locations on separate nights but the pizza was consistently excellent both times and the service was very good as well. Great service and great food always makes you wanting more.
We shared a deep dish pizza and a family-sized salad. The salad was huge. Very generous. Everything was delicious. Excellent service!

There is absolutely nothing wrong with this place. Great prices and great food! I was overall just impressed. Ate all of my pizza and enjoyed the atmosphere around me. Family friendly and service with a smile! Highly recommend!
One of my favorite spots for deep dish pizza in Chicago. Arguably one of the best!

So I have heard people raving about Chicago's deep dish pizza. Personally, I did not think it was anything that special. Definitely not worth the wait. My cousin and her friend are very big foodie and they were not too amazed by it either. After one slice, I was already super full and bloated. Will I ever try it again? I am not so sure; maybe another restaurant. The calamari that we ordered was good though. Otherwise, it was a good experience. It is difficult to wave down the waitress at time since there are just soo many people and tables to manage. Overall, she tried her best and was very friendly.

Preface: I've dined in and have taken out on multiple occasions in the past. This review is on the latest takeout experience. The food is as expected. I ordered a pasta, a salad, and a pizza for pickup.  No utensils were included. No napkins were provided. No cheese or pepper packets were given. NOTHING. No, they didn't ask if we needed any of those items.

Best pizza in the city! We were staying in Chicago with family, and they had this delivered Friday night. The crust is buttery and delicious. The cheese is melty, ooey gooey goodness. The sauce is the perfect combo of tart and sweet. It's everything you want in a deep dish. So glad we were introduced to this! So much better their Giordanos! 4 star only because the house salad dressing  is kinda weird, a sweet vinegary taste. Delivery took almost an hour and a half after they said 45 minutes. Otherwise, great experience and I'll want this pizza again for sure!

This place is a disaster - do not visit. The pizza is only ok. Decent quality toppings - I like the chunky style tomato, and crispy base. Incredibly for pizza, mine was under-seasoned. Perhaps because mine was vegetarian, if you get pepperoni or some salty meat, it might be better. Portions are OK. The personal size is small (but dense and rich) and an OK meal for one. But the nightmare is the wait and organisation. There was a crowd of about 100 people packing the sidewalk and the entrance to the restaurant, with no formal queue system and no signs to direct you where to go. Some are waiting to pre-order, some to collect, some to be seated. The staff laughed because I was the third person in a row to ask about my collection in the wrong place...a clue that maybe some signs would help. If you order online and push to the front the wait isn't actually that bad, but the process is a shambles. Roped queuing lines, a number system - anything would improve the situation. But they don't seem to care.
Pizza arrived over an hour past scheduled delivery time; was cold and also burnt  I'd avoid this location. Delivery driver and restaurant were clueless too

Great location! Really cool decor! Service was friendly and fast. Deep dish  Chicago Special was yummy!  What puts Lou's above Giordano's is the flavorful crust  and Lou's chunky tomato sauce. It's really like fresh stewed tomatoes and tastes authentically Italian! The crust tastes buttery but was a little hard and crunchy but overall a delish deep dish!!

When in Chicago, one must eat Deep Dish Pizza.. this place has been around awhile (1971) Make sure you have enough time, the staff pre warn you, of the 30 minute wait, saying each pizza is made to order.. I have seen the pizza and it looks delicious..  looking forward to sinking my teeth in..

My favorite place to go for pizza. The deep dish and hand tossed both have great flavor. I love the cheese bread. They have many great dishes, including my favorite, the chicken Alfredo. And, I love to finish it off with the chocolate chip pizza

I was not too crazy about the pizza here. I will say that the crust is butter and has a softer texture than other pizzas. I still prefer Giordano because of the flavor of the sausage and how well it went with my pizza. I would go eat here again ONLY for the wings. They were amazing. The wings had the right amount of flavor and just the right kind of crispy. Please try to Gorgonzola dipping sauce, it's worth a try
good food it was sorta worth the wait but definitely long wait time and very full when i was here.  good pizza wing garlic bread lasagna. recommend if you have time

This was our first trip as a family to Chicago and I had heard that Lou Malnati's was the place to go for deep dish pizza. We decided on a late lunch\early dinner around 3 o'clock. We were seated immediately and taken care of promptly and professionally. I had read previous reviews on yelp stating that the house salad was yummy so we ordered that and it was a big family size salad. Next was our medium pizza half the Lou, which was spinach, mushroom and sliced Roma tomato with three cheeses on a garlic butter crust. The other half was cheese. Both were delicious! We ordered more food than we needed but we wanted to take it back to our hotel for a late night snack. This is the place to go for deep dish Chicago pizza!
Might be some of the best Chicago deep dish pizza I have ever had! I highly recommend it. It's worth the wait.

Been to Lou's several times. Appetizers were excellent, pizza quality is inconsistent. However, after a meal that was not the best I've ever had, the manager came out and took the pizzas off the bill. Great service, good waitress, would be willing to come back, seemed to be a one off thing on the watery tomato sauce.

MUCH better than Pizzeria Due --------------------- There's a saying that goes something like: "fast, cheap, good. You can only pick two out of three" Well, this place got it right - fast and good! I think a deep dish pizza takes a lot more work to make, compared with a New York pizza. But these guys / gals got it right - they will always you to pre-order your pie BEFORE YOU GET SEATED. This saves 20 minutes and does not compromise on the taste and quality of the pie.  As for the pizza itself? Awesome. Much better than Giordano's and Pizzeria Due. The cornmeal crust is baked to a beautiful golden crisp, and has an awesome buttery flavor. The toppings were not soggy, and full of flavor.  Why only 4 stars? Not cheap (-0.5 star), and I don't believe they deliver to CA (-0.5 star), while Giordano's can (on dry ice, but must be insanely expensive).  But that being said, DEFINITELY worth checking out - you won't be disappointed!
Fabulous pizza. Try the fry calamari!   The service was pretty good too. The place was clean and with a nice decoration.

I did enjoy this place but I was a bit disappointed unfortunately.  The pizza is just ok, (both deep dish and thin crust), nothing amazing by far.  The deep dish could've been thicker and the crust just wasn't that flavorful, especially for being their "buttery" crust.  The cheesy bread was good but it was just that, melted cheese on bread, nothing too impressive.  For apparently being one of the best pizza places in Chicago I was hoping for something better than I can get in Nevada...I wanted to love this place but it was just ok.  I would eat here again but I would lower my expectations a bit.

So, I made the mistake of ordering a thin crust cheese and a thin crust sausage and garlic pizza, both which tasted marginally better than a frozen thin crust. Next time, I'll stick with ordering the deep dish, which is what I normally order.

On the initial first half of a personal dish, this was definitely better than Giordanos.  It lost steam in the second half and wasn't nearly as good as the first half.  I was loving the buttery taste though.  I would still highly recommend this place.   This is coming from a New Yorker, for what it's worth...

Worst gluten free pizza I've ever had. The crust was like cardboard. For the best pizza place in Chicago you'd think they would have decent gluten free pizza. The staff is really nice though. Very friendly. Wish the gluten free pizza was better.
Got deep dish to go, it was OK, ordered pepperoni and sausage and didnt see much pepperoni at all. Was a little chaotic coming in and there seems to be a long wait for tables.

As a tourist, Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza its a must! They have very good deep dish pizzas. We got the Malnati Chicago Classic (the authentic option) and the Lou (vegetarian) and they were both excellent.  I will say that deep dish pizzas are quite filling. Most people have only one or two slices so keep this in mind when you order.  The line up is typically very long so do plan ahead.

I've never had authentic Chicago-style deep dish pizza before but this was so delicious. I had the personal size pepperoni, easy on the tomato sauce and extra mozzarella. It was delicious and I'm glad I chose to come here. Service was great. Cake in at 11:30am on Saturday and it wasn't busy at all. Deep dish pizza take 30 minutes to cook so be prepared for that but it's worth the wait. I had loaded potato soup as an app and it was also great. Topped it off (barely) with the homemade cookie pizza which comes with ice cream and whipped cream. If you visit Chicago please come here! You can get the lunch special for about $11 which includes a drink, soup or salad and a personal deep dish. My entire bill was $18 and I am very satisfied.
