We got there 6:20 pm on a Friday evening and waited for 15 mins only! Ordered a small pizza (half classic half the Lou), a kid's spaghetti, appetizer honey BBQ chicken wings, large chocolate chip cookie pizza. 2 adults and 2 kids under 5 and we finished all the food! Yes, it's that good! Eating here makes our Chicago trip even more mesmerizing!
The food was good, but service was pretty slow. Often went quite a while with empty drinks and even the appetizers seemed to take forever to show up.

People get excited about deep dish. Who knew? We were staying around the corner and decided to do a fam jam deep dish dinner. We came in fairly early so we didn't have to wait long for a table, but they still suggested we order our pizzas before being seated because they take a while given their cheesy depths. We chose our pizzas, grabbed a drink at the bar and then were promptly seated in a giant booth.  We ordered a big salad for sharing, our pizzas came and it was an OK time. It's a bit of a busy scene, and deep dish is not my favourite, but it was overall a nice night and a true Chicago experience.  Pro tip: Deep dish is super good cold the next morning. Like a quiche that's all cheese and no egg. Get after it, grrl.

Meh. I don't understand all of the hype.  The flavor was very mild, the crust tasted as bland as saltine crackers. The tomato sauce however was very good. Not enough for me to return. We have Rance's Chicago Pizza here in Costa Mesa that has a better, flakier crust and more flavorful sausage and cheese than this place.  We all left a bit underwhelmed. Also, this location in particular is pretty small and doesn't have much of an ambiance.
Pizza was good. I needed a bit of education to be able to get a customized option on one of the pizzas. My son ordered a kids meal it looked and felt like it was warmed up in the microwave.

I need to start off by saying WTF is deep dish?? OMG! i told my family WE NEED TO GO HERE while on vaca in chicago.. we HATE bready food and thought it was going to be very bready. not at all what we were thinking. it was delicious! a blend of crushed tomatoes, cheese, cheese and more cheese and a layer of sausage. oh, and the crust had a buttery taste... amazing! i wish people explained deep dish to me before. i would explain it as a pie crust with layers of cheese, tomatoes and meat.   we ended up ordering a pizza to bring to the airport the next day.

We visited here on a Saturday around 1 pm.  The wait was about 20 minutes, but they let you out your pizza order in while you wait for a table and that is a major positive!  The deep dish is excellent, it's not as over the top at Giordano's, which I liked. The sauce is the perfect amount--too many deep dish places over do it!  The small pizza size easily feeds two people. We then got the cookie pizza for dessert. YUM. That is a must. Service was friendly and fast for how busy they were. Would return again.
First time in Chicago and this was one of the big names everyone told us to go to and they did not disappoint!!! One of our favorites we've tried while trying to experience the REAL Chicago pizza!

Got seated pretty quickly but the pizza took forever. We expected about 30 minutes but I think we waited close to an hour before we got the pizza. We ordered it gooey and it came out with the ingredients swimming in sauce. The crust was good but the sauce had a very strong wine taste. I'm not the biggest fan of chicago pizza and this definitely didn't change my mind but it wasn't terrible either. It does get extra points for their bruschetta though. It was served on deliciously toasted crosstini that wasn't too hard or too soft. Nice buttery garlic taste and perfect amounts of bruschetta and cheese. Would definitely go back to get this instead of the pizza.
Absolutely the best pizza we ate in Chicago! The wait is long, but it was well worth it. Our waitress was super friendly and helpful and food was deliver quickly. We talk about this place often!

In Chicago for a quick conference but had to try Chicago style pizza of course. So glad this place was literally 0.1 miles from the hotel. Service- amazing! The guy who waited on us was super enthusiastic and told us he had been eating there since he was a kid, so we knew we had come to the right spot. He recommended the buttercrust pizza with extra cheese, however I decided to get the lunch special without the buttercrust- it was perfect. Lunch special came with a soup and he spoke wayyyy highly of the minestrone, so I took his recommendation and it was delicious. Haven't tried many others in Chicago so don't know what to compare it to, but I definitely recommend it!

We love this place. But not just for the pizza and food... We are chicago locals and are serious about our deep dish pizza. When we get a craving... it must be met with justice! So when I accidentally ordered a crustless pizza instead of our normal butter crust for my boyfriend and I as a weekend treat.. we were devastated. I was sure we were stuck with the pizza. I called in as a far reaching attempt to try and see what could be done in the situation. That's when Troy the manager stepped into the situation. He immediately took it upon himself to make sure we were happy, even though the mistake was on my end. And he in no way needed to take responsibility, he still went immediately to what he could do to make the situation right. He offered us to come back and get the pizza we meant to order, with no double charge. They even made it in 30 minutes when before it's taken up to 45 (which is standard for deep dish!) our entire night was made. He's the best! Deserves a raise for sure!!! Great caring staff and most of all manager
The deep dish pizza was fabulous and the cookie with ice cream on top is an absolute must!

This place was incredible. You order up front and wait for a table. Seems like it gets busy in there so you may wait a bit. We sat down, ordered a beer, and had some of the best pizza I had ever tasted. I seriously kept thinking about this pizza days after I left Chicago. If you are in the area and want the real thing, go here.

I'm not a big fan of deep dish pizza, but I guess they're OK. Pretty comparable to Giordano's, if you ask me. Lou Malnati's, however, does have a killer salad, AKA the Chicken BBQ Club Salad. Killer 'cause it's good. Also killer 'cause it'll probably kill you with its 3208 mg of sodium. Oh well.
Simply the best pizza I've ever had in my life and I've had a lot of pizza.  The service is efficient and friendly. This is just a great place.

Best Chicago pizza, hands down.  Deep dish!  Crust is what sets it apart, so good.  Typically I wont even eat crust of other pizzas, but this one for sure!  But it;s more than that.  Sauce is perfect and cheese and ingredients seem high quality. The only prob is that we usually have to wait long time to get seated  ;(
This is the best deep dish pizza I have ever had. A friend recommended them, he was so right! Been a couple of times and service was great even know they were busy. Highly recommend them!

First time getting delivery from here and was impressed!  Online ordering was logical and easy.  Food arrived on time.  Driver followed all delivery instructions and was very courteous.  The order was 100% accurate.  Will absolutely order from here again!
Pretty good but sorry for this die hard Chicago Pizza gal not as good as Giordanos!!the family style salad was good and the dressing was DELICIOUS!!

I've definitely had better experiences with other locations and I'm not really sure what went wrong on there part, but when my pizza arrived it not only was not the pizza I paid for, it was cold! So when I called to resolve this issue, I was handled very professionally and considerately! She offered to refund my money, have the correct pizza sent to me (which was ready at the time of said call, as well as the time the delivery guy somehow grabbed the wrong pizza), told me that the first pizza was on the house, and offered me a free drink! I declined her giving my money back because I already felt like she had offered me so much to try and reconcile this situation for me! Now keep in mind, this was already an 1hr and 15mins into my order because I'd received my delivery, it was just wrong. I guess for some reason the driver thought it best to complete his route before fixing this issue because it wasn't until another hour later that I get a call from him asking me what my address is! I didn't think it would take an hour to deliver a pizza that was apparently ready to deliver when the driver took the wrong pizza. I ended up just cancelling my order! After a 2hr wait, $35.95 lost, and some cold pizza that I didn't want! I lost my appetite and $35.95! I mean, granted I did get a pizza, but I honestly didn't eat it! My girlfriend was upset! And it kind of ruined the movie-night thing I had going on! Not thinking about using this location again! Major buzz kill! Probably should have just taken my money back! Lol! You win some you lose some!

Ate lunch here on Tuesday 28MAR17. It was a quick walk from my hotel. I liked the location and the inside was clean. I ordered the lunch special which consisted of a house salad and a personal deep dish pizza.  The salad was good I liked the house vinaigrette dressing. My pizza was good - but I ordered a pepperoni pizza and they brought me a cheese pizza so I was a little bit disappointed.

Back when my friend and I came as tourists in the summer of 2015, we went straight to Giodano's. This time, I'm not a tourist but my friend came back to visit. Instead of recreating our first trip, we decided to try Lou Malnati's! We were quoted a 35 minute wait but it was more like 20. We shared a medium classic deep dish (~$20) for 6 slices. After tax and tip, twas $~13/per person making it ~$4.33 per slice. I'm still finding this incredibly inexpensive for the quality of the pizza. Things to note: -They have an app now. Spend a certain amount (I think ~$150?) and get $20 off.. not a bad deal. But as I told my friend, I'd only eat deep dish when I have out of towners come visit. So it'd probably take me a while to accumulate! -Their preorder system - if there's a wait for your table, you can preorder your pizza as the pizza does take about 45 minutes to make.
First time visitors to Chicago and this was great pizza. Be prepared for a heavy meal!

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOU MALNATI'S!!!!! I was in Chicago for the weekend and I had a couple of deep dish places in mind, thank god I decided to try Lou first because OMG I fell in love!! I did OG cheese and half pepperoni (you can never go wrong with these toppings) the cheese melts in your mouth and the crust is just perfect. I also tried the 3 cheese bread with their marinara sauce, awesome! & their red wine sangria was yummy too. Definitely recommend and I will go back when I visit Chicago again!!!!

What a major disappointment. Had a large pepperoni deep dish delivered to my hotel in March 2017. Delivered on time, came with plates and knife and fork...Bonus points for providing parmesan and hot peppers. Tasted ok ...But my goodness the thin layer of sauce...Cheese..And topping was DWARFED by a thick slab of crust. The true test was the next morning I gave it the ultimate pizza test. Yep...Cold Pizza is the ultimate judge. Inedible. Baffled by the buzz.

So we were in town and decided to try a different deep dish pizza eatery. This place is definitely a lively spot w great service. I liked that you could order your own personal pizza which was just enough. I went w "The Lou". We also had the spinach salad and the bar b q honey wings. Everything tasted good especially the wings which was our fav. My friend ordered the deep dish pepperoni which I did enjoy better than the Lou.
Best pizza in town!! Get the Classic! Service was also good but didn't come here for that. :)

Took a taxi here from union station between trains. The waiter was very nice and warned us that it would take about 30-40 minutes for the pizza to cook. It was worth the wait! We also got Parmesan spinach bread which was AMAZING. The small pizza with the bread was more than enough food for two people. I would love to come back here.

Malnati's was recommended by my bellman at the hotel as it was his favorite. Safe to say it is now one of my favorite spots to get my "deep dish Chicago" pizza. I had a good salad with the house dressing and then a personal 'Malnati' deep dish. This pizza was made with lots of tomato sauce (my request) crumbled sausage, and standard extra cheese. The first bite set the tone to a great lunch. I made it thru 80% when my stomached said 'no more',  This is a nice spot. Not a large restaurant by seating counts, but the food is worth a visit. I doubt you will walk away hungry. Great food. I'll be back.

Lou's is great Chicago pizza, make no mistake about it. It's one restaurant that has expanded everywhere around the region without loosing quality. I think their deep dish (and possibly their thin crust) has actually improved over the years. I've had an occasional inconsistency, but generally if you specify exactly what you want when you order (such as extra cheese, thicker crust, a little more crispy, etc.) they deliver the results. Salads are also great. This location gets really crowded because of its proximity to several south loop colleges, but it still has a nice neighborhood feel.

I have nothing but good things to say about Lou Malnati's. They were my favorite spot to grab deep dish pizza during my trip to Chicago. Can you believe they even have a "ship a pizza" option?!?!?!? I almost want to order a couple of their deep dish pizzas right now and have them deliver it straight to my door in Cali.  THE PIZZA: Our group got a pepperoni and sausage pizza. It took about 40 minutes to make  because they handmade it from scratch. The texture was perfect to my liking. It was thick like a true Chicago style, but not overly thick and crusty. The crust was flaky and buttery and the cheese was soft and gooey. The sausage and pepperoni were wonderful additions as well. At other places, I found that pizzas may be a little heavy on the crust or the cheese that it overpowers the toppings that you put on. That was not the case here as all the ingredients blended together nicely. THE WINGS: Stunning. Chicago is known mainly for their pizza, but while less decorated, the wings in this city deserve some accolades of their own as well. I had some of the best buffalo wings of my life here at Lou Malnati's. The tastiness of these wings were unparalleled.  BEER: They have a bunch of awesome craft beers. It was our last night in Chicago so we decided to get 3 pitchers of beer and chug them to see who can gulp down a pint the fast LMAO. Twas' a good time indeed.  SERVICE: The staff was nice and attentive. They were very knowledgeable and the waiter came over to us and told us the approximate minutes it would take our pizza to come out throughout our wait.  Overall, Lou Malnati's hits on all cylinders and is a must-try in the great city of Chicago.

We stopped in to Lou Malnati' s for our last meal in Chicago because we wanted to compare it to Giordanos. Here's my take: The service was the best part of the whole dining experience. Danielle, our server was so great. She was helpful and made great recommendations.  The lunch special was a great deal. You get a personal pizza, soup or salad, and a sofa for $10. We upgraded to the classic for $1.75 extra. I liked the vine ripe tomato sauce which is chunky. The crust was awesome too.

I was in Chicago for business, and my group of colleagues wanted to try some Chicago pizza.  Lou Malnati's was recommended by a co-worker and met all expectations.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  The food was fantastic!  There were seven in our group and everyone agreed that the food, atmosphere, and staff were all a hit!
Pizza is perfect. Good server. Arrived at 5:30 and walked right in. (Busy now). Waiting on the chocolate chip cookie pizza dessert. If that is as god ...

A-okay! Perhaps I'm just not a fan of deep dish pizza but after getting several recommendations to try Lou Malnati's it was a must-try for my trip to Chicago. We arrived right at lunch time on Sunday and were seated right away. They have a great lunch special available daily from 11-2 that includes a personal deep dish pizza, a side salad and soda for $9.95. The salad was delicious! I've never had a salad with warm croutons before and I'm happy to report that it definitely makes a difference. The personal pizza is a great size and they are very generous with the toppings. I tried the sausage and cheese and there was sausage in every bite. I'm a crust person so I was a bit disappointed that the crust was rather flavorless. I noticed a group next to ours ordered a butter crust, so maybe that makes the difference? The cheese was quality mozzarella and the tomato sauce was fresh but needed some flavor. Service was great so given our experience I would definitely give them another chance but unfortunately it didn't live up to my expectations.
Pizza was soggy and basically inedible. We had Giordano's a few days ago and it was much better

BEST deep dish pizza hands down! We had their house salad which was the most amazing thing I've ever had. If I can have that salad everyday, 3 times a day, I would. Our server, Robert, was hilarious and very friendly. Great place for family, friends, couples and tourists!

First time in Chicago, Uber driver recommended that this was the place locals go to for deep dish. Since I'm used to my normal pizzas without the extra cheese, my friend and I shared a personal pizza with a side of calamari. The pizza was incredible to say the least; we were too full that the walk back to the hotel seemed impossible to do.  Definitely recommend if you're looking for chicago style pizza!

Great venue for all ages. It's very neat that they have pictures of the famous people throughout the restaurant. The Deep Dish Pizza is great obviously. The dessert cookie was fantastic though - surprised me. Our server was okay as she was a little slow bringing our waters but Fernando, our Bus Boy, was amazing - he was very quick with boxing things and taking plates out of the way and was just great. This is relatively cheap and is a nice restaurant with lots of tradition.

Pizza is great. While Chicago deep dish is what they built their reputation on, the thin crust is my preferred choice here. This location is extremely busy and you order at the bar so your pizza is started before you get a table.  The service was attentive and outgoing.     Our kids loved it (1.5 and 4 yrs old) and I would go back my next trip to town.

This place already had great reviews.  In business since the 70s another plus! Crazy busy but they seated me right away.. friendly, smiling staff! Yes!!  I ordered the personal butter crust pizza.. The waitress let me know it would be about 30 minutes. Just did I order an appetizer while I wait. Ordered the mozzarella sticks, they were extremely good & the marinara was perfect. Pizza came out hot, cheesy delicious. Because I ordered the appetizer,  I could not finish the entire pizza. Small box to go came in handy later for a late night snack. You won't be disappointed if you come here.. be hungry!!

The deep dish was amazing!  And that's saying a lot coming from NJ where it's hard to find a bad pizza  I will order the Lou's pizza online when I get back home to share with my family. This is a place you must stop if you love good sauce.

First time to Chicago, and first time having real (non Uno) Chicago style deep-dish pizza. This was the first place I went after I touched down here for the Midwest Clinic after checking into hotel and it did not disappoint.  I ordered some wings and a personal sausage pie, plus a soda. The food was great and the servers were very attentive.  I will definitely go back again, even though I went to Giordano's for the rest of the pizza stops I made.  And in the battle for best Chicago style pizza between Giordano's and Lou Malnati's, it is a split decision. I liked them both.
Absolutely the best deep dish pizza in Chicago. We always get a large so we can take some home. There is usually a wait but it's worth it.   And get the Lou's salad too.

Cheese and sauce are definitely on point but the crust is flavorless and hard in a "they didn't add the right amount of yeast" way... I ordered the classic personal pie... it took 35 minutes to prepare and was about 5 inches in diameter...
The food was delicious! I love the thin crust. It's so buttery and flavorful! I had an excellent server Alberto. Great service and food.
One of the best pizzerias in Chicago- we will return from Indianapolis to get more soon!

First time in Chicago and tried their sausage deep dish pizza. Chicago pizza has the cheese on the bottom and the sauce on top. It's really good if you like a lot of cheese, sweet chunky tomato sauce and crispy crust. Also, liked the taste of the sausages :) Service was good as well- drinks are always being refilled.
The food here is great and very authentic Chicago pizza! The service however is really slow also I'm lactose intolerant

Before visiting Chicago, I asked a bunch of people what their restaurant recommendations were and every person insisted that I try Lou Malnati's.  There are several locations which is convenient and our server was excellent.  He was attentive, pleasant, and made sure our drinks were always full.  He even recommended sight seeing for us and told us where good parking was.  We ordered stuffed spinach bread as an appetizer and got the lunch special that included a personal deep dish pizza, a drink, and a salad or soup.  The pizza was good, but I felt like it was a little bit dry. This is a good place for families, couples, and large groups.  They also had a covered patio that was nice and warm (in the dead of winter), but it looked like the garage doors open when the weather is appropriate.

Amazing food and such wonderful and attentive service. Our waiter was very friendly and always kept checking in on us as well as explaining the menu for us.  We came on a Sunday night and was seated immediately. Deep dish pizza usually takes 30-40mins to bake so our waiter recommended we order an appetizer and was it ever good! Lou's salad was the perfect combination of everything. Even when I'm not a fan of "blue cheese" it was mild enough and the perfect blend. Would defiantly come back again!

Excellent deep dish pizza. Super wholesome crust (of cracker consistency) , rich cheese, and a whole continuous layer of sausage, topped with tomato sauce.   Got there at 5:20p last night and was already crowded. good that they take orders ahead of time and text you when the table is ready.  Overall, awesome experience. We had the leftovers for breakfast. The pizza is also good cold!!

My friend and I came here on a Saturday evening around 4pm - it was early, but we were seated immediately. We each got a personal pizza - the cheese deep dish for my friend and the Malnati Classic (sausage w/ extra cheese on buttercrust) for me. The waitress warned us it would take around 30 minutes for these to come. The cheese deep dish was great, but my Malnati Classic was sitting in a small pool of water. I'm not sure if the dish was wet to begin with, or the water broke for my poor pizza. The buttercrust was rich (maybe the richness of the butter provided a barrier against the water??), and there was large chunks of sausage and tomatoes scattered around. The cheese was the cheesiest, and would have stretched several feet long if I had given it the chance and not been so hungry. By the time we left around 6pm, there was a crowd waiting to claim our valuable seats. Although we didn't do take-out, I believe ordering before would have greatly decreased the wait time to receive one's ZZA. If I'm in Chicago, I'll be back!!

Stopping in around 11pm on a Friday night, we were treated to great service, great food, and one of the best deep dish pizzas in Chicago. The Malnati Classic is an absolute must. Sausage, tomatoes, and the buttercrust?! Bro, WTF are you waiting for!!! Get in, order a large, and reap the heavenly rewards of tomorrow's cold pizza.

Favorite pizza on earth! Been going here for over 20 years and is the place I go the most. Downside is the wait for the pizza and the wait to get in but this is why its everyones favorite. Can't give it a 5, went to the new on on Lincoln in north center and got a burnt thin crust pizza....almost broke a tooth on it. Should of said something but was hungry. This was the only time it has happen in over 20 years though.
Amazing pizza and very friendly staff. We had amazing service:) We were sat right away. would definitely come again next time I'm in Chicago.
We never eat pizza so this was a treat. It was busy when we got there but they have a great system in place. We did a half and half deep dish. Very good!

As far as deep dish Chicago style pizza goes, Pequod's and Lou's are a photo finish. Giordano's is not even in the discussion unless you're a loyal fan because of childhood nostalgia. Lou's has mastered the perfect balance of sweet, salty and spice in their sauce. The cheese blend is rich, flavorful and works well with the buttery crust. I'm not too adventurous when it comes to pizza toppings, so I usually stick with sausage, pepperoni and green peppers. Occasionally, I'll add fresh garlic and onion. When dinning in, I order the house salad with sweet vinaigrette. .. it makes me feel a little healthier. The BBQ wings are also as good as you'll find in any bar. If you're a tourist, don't fall for the Connie's or Giordano's traps. Go to Lou's. All of their locations are consistently great.

We went to Malnati's with 2 out of town friends. We had never been to this specific location before. We got there before the dinner rush and were seated immediately. By the time we left, there must have been about 50 people in line, so I am glad we got there early.  The pizza of course was wonderful. What really made me happy was the house salad. As many times as I have been to Malnati's, I never had their salad. It was crisp, with a variety of veggies and and a very refreshing vinaigrette type dressing. I could have made a meal of just the salad. I may in the near future. We also had a dessert that consisted of a hot fresh made chocolate chip cookie topped with vanilla ice cream. It was plenty for my hubby and I to share. It was also delicious. I live near a different location, but if I ever come to this one again, I will make sure to come on an off hour. If you are downtown and looking for a satisfying and filling meal, you can't go wrong coming here.

First time having pizza from here. Had the Chicago Classic delivered to my hotel and it was great. The crust was really good. A few more tomatoes than I'm used to but even boys ate them without complaining. Will eat there again.
The pizza and service were meh to be generous. But the stuffed spinach bread is AMAZING. I would go back just for that.

First time coming here and I can't believe I waited this long to come! Food was amazing and the staff is friendly. Our server Taylor was real nice! Kept our drinks full and didn't feel rushed at all. Recommend visiting for anyone, will be back again

This place is always packed and a must try for out of town visitors. We had the sausage and mushroom butter crust pizza with calimari and the spinach stuff bread as sides. Pizza was great, both sides were excellent. The wait staff was helpful.  No complaints, I highly recommend this place.

Cannot say enough good things about this place!!! Staying in town for a few nights, read a few reviews and decided to make this our stop for "Authentic Chicago Deep Dish".  Yum!  There is a considerable wait for your pizza, but it mentions this right up front on the menu, so no big surprise.  The pies definitely taste handmade, and the sauce has a great flavor.   Waitstaff was OUTSTANDING.  We had a cranky 3 year old in tow, and our waiter made it a point to pop over and talk to him several times while we were waiting for our food,  Even brought some crackers to keep him happy. Highly recommend!

I really really wanted to love this place...but sadly, I didn't. Maybe it was because of all the hype, or maybe it was because we made the mistake of trying Giordano's stuffed pizza first, or maybe it was because the pizza here just wasn't THAT amazing. With only three and a half short days in Chicago, and most of those days packed, we made the executive decision to visit this restaurant on our last day instead of going to the Navy Pier. We figured that with all the hype, it would be worse to miss out on Lou's pizza but in retrospect, I think the pier would have been the better choice (don't judge..sometimes food beats all else, especially when it's supposed to be otherworldly).  We came over at 11:40, and were soooo excited to order. We each got a personal pizza and some drinks along with starters and anxiously awaited. As soon as our pizzas came out, we were disappointed. They looked....tired if that makes any sense. Depressing maybe is the better word. Nonetheless, we dug in, and were quickly disappointed by the lack of emotion we felt (at Giordano's we were practically dying of joy with every bite and were praying that the moment would never end).  We were so unimpressed, that we didn't finish our food and didn't dare to order dessert. We just paid and left as quickly as possible, unimpressed that we gave up a local 'attraction' for this. We got amazing dessert elsewhere (another review coming soon) and left the memory of this sad pizza behind. Could it have been bad luck? Maybe. Or maybe we had the better pizza first and had we not, maybe we would have loved this one. Who knows. All I know is that the next time we're in Chicago, Lou Malnati's won't be on our to do list.

My first time in Chicago and this was my first Chicago deep dish pizza ever and I must say it was amazing. The size of a small can easily feed 3people. There was an enormous amount of cheese! The sausage was house made and it was flavorful. Their calamari was crispy and soft in the middle. I loved the atmosphere and will definitely come back again.

In town for two nights and had to try Chicago deep dish pizza right!? The pizza was the best I've ever had for real! We only had to wait about 10 minutes and that's pretty good because this place is hopping!  We are from Oklahoma and the pizza here is ok but nothing compared to this heavenly place!  If you are in Chicago and haven't ever had pizza here, then come here or you are missing out on the best pizza I've ever had! Great service too.

I think 'lou malnati's' is the best pizzeria in Chicago. I had been to Uno, but my Chicago friend strongly recommended this house and now I know why she did!! Just awesome and enjoy classic and the Lou deep dish pizza!

This place has good service, atmosphere, and the calamari appetizer was good The only down side is the flavor of the pizza was too heavy - too much butter, the sauce was salty and the sausage was even saltier.  You might enjoy it if you prefer heavy flavor.

I came here because this place has good reviews and was disappointed. I don't think this pizza is anything out of the ordinary. As an appetizer we ordered the wings, which were good. But we ended up ordering a deep dish butter glazed something pizza and it was okay. A little bland. I honestly prefer dominos.  My boyfriend and I ended up only eating one piece and gave the rest of the rest to a homeless guy. Besides the food, our waitress was a little frantic and needed to slow down.  The one thing I loved was the busser. He was young but very determined, I didn't see a plate left on anyone's table for more than a minute. Hope he gets promoted. xxx
Went there twice during our brief visit to Chicago. Pretty good food, mediocre service both times. Will be visiting again during future visits.

Lou does it again!! Long wait to get a table but I love that they have a system to let you know where you are in line to get your table so you know if you can cruise around he area or if you should be staying close. They also text you once your table is ready. I also really appreciate that they encourage you to pre-order your deep dish so it will be ready shortly after you get your table.  In addition to our deep dish, we also had the cheddar bites, house salad and garlic bread. All very delicious. My only issue is how they really pack the tables in. I respect that they're trying to seat as many people as possible but where our table was the employees and other customers were using all sides like a lane so we were bumped into several times. Otherwise this was a pretty awesome experience!
Good as expected.  Mozzarella sticks take the shortest amount of time in case your group is starving and waiting on a deep dish.

This is my go to deep dish pizza whenever I am in town. They are by far the best deep dish I had, given I only had unos, giodiarnos(??) And Ginos east and out of all of these places Lou is the best. I always get the classic and Lou ( if there's more than 5 of us) and I have never been disappointed. Lou is probably why I question myself whenever I get a pizza that isn't deep dish but I will forever slightly lean towards the NY style pizza But lou is the sole reason I'm not 100% NY style pizza Service there is always friendly and welcoming The place itself is nice and pizzaria type of place  Not sure about the other foods but I always go with the pizza and nothing else Overall 5 stars just cause they deserve it

Ordered a gluten free pizza for my mom who is gluten free. They said oh we can do a gluten free plain cheese pizza. I said great. We pick it up and they say here's your "crustless" deep dish pizza. Sounds interesting, okay. Halfway through eating a huge slice i notice the "crustless" pizza is a sausage crust. Ive been a vegetarian for 22 years!!! And no one thought to mention crustless pizza was literally meat crust? Really???? It tasted like a wet sock too.

This place will always be my favorite deep dish pizza place! Ordered the classic medium size for 3 people to share and it was very filling and delicious! The delicious cheese follows you after slicing it and even after each bite! It is really fun and good to play with and the best part of the pizza was the meat in each bite as well! The crust was also cooked to a crunchy crust and it has a hint of a butter taste! They also have lunch hours as well!  Good vibes, good pizza, and drinks! If you love deep dish pizza, you can also buy the frozen ones to take home but it's not the same in my opinion!
Always a great place to have some fantastic Chicago pizza.  The pizza is always a hit for the family and has never disappointed.

We ordered 2 pizzas and some wings through Grub Hub. Not only was our order over an hour late, but when we called the restaurant to check on our order, we were lied to not once, but twice, when we were told on two separate phone calls that the delivery driver "had just left the restaurant". It wasn't until we contacted Grub Hub that our food was delivered within 5 minutes (we live 3 blocks from the restaurant). One of the pizzas was lukewarm, as if it had been sitting under a heat lamp for some time. Definitely not going to be ordering from Lou's anymore. Poor customer service, mediocre pizza, and overpriced.

As history goes the Chicago deep dish pizza was created at Pizzeria Uno in the 1940's. The man running the kitchen at the time was Rudy Malnati who continued to do so until he died. Lou Malnati also worked with his dad and left to start Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. Lou's half brother Rudy Jr. started Pizano's and Pizzeria Uno's former cook Alice May Redmond went to work for Gino's and supposedly perfected the crust there. The long and the short of it is there's a lot of deep dish pizza joints in Chicago that claim to have had a hand in it's creation. I considered going to Uno or Due in Chicago but was put off by the revues reporting that it was nothing more than a tourist trap with dubious quality. It seemed Lou Malnati's would be my best chance at getting a Chicago style deep dish pizza. I ordered the personal Chicago Deep Dish Classic, the name which is trademarked. It comes with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust (also trademarked). Seems there's a lot of trademarking going on. I'm not from Chicago but I loved eating at Kylie's Chicago Pizza in Seattle and I've eaten Windy City Pie (Pequod pizza clone) as well as Delfino's so they're my only frame of reference.  My first impression of my pizza was that the tomatoes were bright and fresh just like Kylie's. The sausage was... just sausage and the cheese was as you'd expect. I came to Lou Malnati's though because of the famous Buttercrust (again, trademarked!).  My impression of Lou Malnati's started to take a nose dive with the crust. My lasting memory of the crust was that it was impacted. Like someone had smashed a disk of pastry dough into a form and cooked it. It wasn't difficult to chew in the way a high gluten dough would be but rather because it was so hard and dense. I think the crust was the biggest downfall of Lou's Chicago Pizza. Really to be honest the only thing I thought was above average about it was the tomatoes. Maybe my expectations were too high. They say the best Cuban food isn't in Cuba. Maybe the best Chicago Pizza isn't in Chicago.  I'm headed to Giordano's later in the week so we'll see how they fare. I did get a nice dark Oatmeal Stout to go with it though so there is that.

Omg !!!!! I have never tasted a better deep dish pizza.The sauce is perfect!!!the crust is perfect!!!!! The Louie pasta, The over priced tiny buffalo wings with the amazing ranch and blue cheese sauce.Everything. ooo and the ceasar salad. You must add chicken I can't wait to go back home to eat here again. Service was awesome every like 20 times I've been there.I had a problem one time when they forgot to cook my wings and have two sent us two orders and one to go.Let me stop before I end up writing an essay.

I ordered the sausage deep dish per a recommendation from a local friend.  This was one of the best pizzas I've had.  I loved how they placed a solid patty of Italian sausage on the pizza rather than the typical round/oblong pieces.  The dough to cheese to meat to sauce ratio was spot on.  If you are in town, you should definitely give them a try.

Hands down my favorite deep dish pizza place! This location is huge and farther from Downtown so I had no wait time.  We ended up getting the Lou Malnatis Classic and the spinach/mozzarella bread. UGH. I WISH I LIVED IN CHICAGO FOR THESE THINGS. The dough/crust was by far my favorite thing about both dishes. They were so buttery and flaky and paired with the fresh tomato sauce and stringy mozzarella cheese it was a match made in heaven. The proportions of the ingredients were great so one never overpowered another. Getting the bread was a great choice since the pizza takes 25-30 mins to come out. When the waitress cut the pizza and gave me my first slice, there was SOOO much cheese. We left satisfied but also sad knowing that we had to board our flight. Since coming back to SF I dream of coming back.

Great Chicago deep dish pizza. Our first night in Chicago we went for a walk and say this pizza place. I knew that I wanted to grab a famous Chicago deep dish at some point in my stay so we gave them a try. I usually have a different Chicago pizza go to. We were not disappointed. A word of advice, ask for the butter crust. I had my doubts but it was delicious.

Tried this place out on a business trip few months back. Amazing Pizza.  The dough, sauce and ingredients were all amazing.  Best deep dish I've ever had.  The only problem I had was the wait.  Long long wait times, so if you ever decide to go please plan ahead of time.  Other than that everything was good.

Every time my boyfriend comes to visit from Boston, I always have to treat him to some classic Chicago deepdish. From all that we've tried in the Chicago-land area, Lou malnatis is hands down the best. Not much else to say here. Definitely go for the buttercrust sausage.
Omg waaaaay better than Giordanos by far. That butter crust tho!! All locations are really really good. When my family comes into town from Cali this where I take them.

Hands down this was the best deep dish pizza that I have tried while in Chicago! I ordered "The Lou" which had Spinach mix, mushrooms and sliced roma tomatoes covered with a blend of mozzarella, romano and cheddar cheese on garlic Buttercrust. So good! It was very flavorful that's for sure. You can choose from personal pans, to small pan, medium pan, to large pan.  Here are the prices: Personal Pan (serves 1)- $9.75 Small (serves 2)- $15.35 Medium (serves 3) $19.95 Large (serves 4)- $24.55 There were some other choices as well like cheese pizza, sausage or pepperoni and cheese, The Malnati Chicago Classic which had Lou's made sausage, cheese, vine ripened tomato sauce on top of a buttercrust, and also for those health conscience people on a low carb diet the "Crustless" pizza which is made with a sausage base, mozzarella, and vine ripened tomatoes. Prices all vary, and I have only included the prices for the type of pizza that ordered and ate.  The server who helped us was very friendly and made some suggestions of what is popular as for their deep dish pizza selections. The menu was pretty extensive too. There were appetizers, salads, soups, pastas, sandwiches, and pizza. So many things to choose from, but since I have been trying to watch my food intake, I decided to just do the deep dish pizza since that is what Chicago is known for! I highly enjoyed my pizza. It came out on a hot pan and the waitress served our first slice to us. The pizza orders take about 30 mins from the time you order, but if you are a first timer and let the waiter or waitress know, they will give you a heads up about that. It was pretty crowded in this joint with a lot of people enjoying some comfort food!  I hope to make my way back to this awesome city to enjoy more of Lou's deep dish pies and some of their other food items. I'm getting hungry now just thinking of it!

What can I say about this place that hasn't been said 1500 + X! It's awesome, we went all classic.  Suggestion from our waiter Taylor, we ordered the Lou M salad and Chicago classic deep dish!  Great suggestions and a friendly attentive waiter.  All good, all great! See my pictures... The Real Foodie (snob) Just keepin' it real deep dish

You have not had Chicago Deep Dish until you have experienced the beauty that is Lou's. I'm sure people associated Beyonce and other big-named artists with the pizza when they talk about the illuminati. Well friends, it's Lou Malnati's pizza that will give you the best touristy food experience. Out of all the major pizza chains, Lou reigns on top for me for one reason- the crust. It's not oily nor flaky, but perfectly baked, buttery, and delicious. Their secret seems to be well kept because other deep dish joints have not done their crust as good as Lou's. Each time I've brought visitors here, we always order the Chicago Classic, which contains sausage, cheese, and tomatoes. While the sauce is not as present in their pizza, it's still baked perfectly into each large slice and makes for one hearty meal. The layers and layers of cheese on top also give it a nicely needed kick of HELL YES. If you simply want to try the pizza, a personal size will do for even a party of four. These slices are large so do not underestimate the power of deep dish portions! So please come and check out Lou's for a great deep dish pizza. Mind you that lines get long and you may end up waiting up to an hour for a table during a dinner rush. You'll be able to order your pizza in advance so that it is delivered within ten minutes of you being seated after waiting nearly an hour for the table itself. If you want to avoid waiting, you can always order take out which will take about 30 minutes for the pizza to be ready.

Great service and friendly atmosphere!  Lou Malnati's is a must-try for deep dish pizza. We had such a memorable food-experience. We ordered calamari, bowtie pasta with sausage, The Malnati's Chicago Classic pizza, and trio of dips pizza chips. Calamari: delicious. Lightly battered with grilled calamari taste. The sauce has a slight kick to it, but it's oh so good. Bowtie pasta: also another crowd favorite. The pasta was made fresh, so tender. The sauces resembled eating a pizza. Really tasty. Pizza chips: A must-try! Whoa, so creative. Literally its like eating a pizza  as a chip. The sauces are all amazing and make for the perfect toppers. Also very fresh. The garlic saucce was my favorite. Order & you won't regret it. The Malnati's Chicago Classic pizza: the definition of what deep dish pizza should be. Thick, cheesy slices of well seasoned hot pizza! The best part...the crust is crunchy and not soggy! A small is more than enough for two people.

I left soooooo satisfied with my meal! First time ChiTown deep dish experience and it did NOT disappoint. Being a Texan, I was skeptical seeing just how many pizza joints we passed by to get to this place. I was thinking this BETTA be good. Also side note: I really thought my Chicago native friend was saying, "Illuminati's" so naturally I had all these conspiracy theories in my head. We went in on a Monday evening around 9pm with a party of 6. Guess what? NO wait! But really though no one probably eats something as heavy as a deep dish that late lol. We put in our orders and then had to wait - the only semibad part. All of the pizza is MTO, so as expected it takes a while to pop these out.  Now for the flavor. Woah! We ordered the Lou, which was the perfect mix of spinach, cheese, and sauce. It had strong oregano, garlic and black pepper flavors. Definitely NOT bland. One thing they have right is the ingredient proportions!!! This pizza has more cheese than anything else - exactly what a pizza should be!!!! Each small pie is DEFINITELY enough for 2 people - in fact I couldn't even finish part of my second slice! (The waitress will serve you your first slice.) Ya, ya I knowww you're "supposed" to eat this with a knife and fork and probably should but I was wayyy too eager and hungry to care - picked it right up no shame once it got to a more reasonable size. My one deduction is that it ended up being like $16.25 for my 2 slice share of pizza, drink, and tip which I realize probably doesn't seem bad to people in Chicago but my Texas brain was expecting beef at that price ;) Thumbs up!!!!

Lou Malnati's deep dish pizza is separated from the rest of the deep dish field because of the flavor of the sauce. It is fantastic.  It makes you smile with every bite.  We had their signature pizza and it met every expectation. It is impossible to eat a whole pizza because it is so filling, but the good thing about it is that it tastes just as good the next day when you reheat it. A real bonus is the box they give you to take it home in. It is the best pizza box I have ever seen or used.  Just a another touch of class by Lou Malnati's.

Stopped for lunch with a friend & asked waiter what he recommended. Small Chicago classic pan & malnati salad. What a perfect suggestion! Salad was delicious & more than we could eat. Pizza took about 30 min,which is typical for the pan, and was definitely worth the wait. We added onion & green pepper to the standard pie of mozzarella, fresh Roma tomatoes, Italian sausage & butter crust.  Price was average - $35 total.  Recommend you try if you haven't already!!
Love Lous pizza! Would not get pizza anywhere else. I have it at least once a wk. My fav is the Chicago Classic with the sausage patty, I add garlic and extra sauce.

Came on a recommendation. Great deep dish pizza but the crust was not as good as advertised. Very dry and burnt at some parts. The 35 min wait for the pizza was expected but what came was a much smaller pizza than expected. What was advertised as "serves 2" really only serves 1 adequately.

So I may be the only person in the world who thinks Pizza can have too much cheese. This pizza is very very cheese and so just not for me. If that is your thing you will probably like it. I got the personal with Sausage, Onions, Mushrooms, and Basil.  The Fried Cheddar Cubes were good. I'm glad I tried it as a Chicago institution but probably won't again.

Long wait to dine-in during the day of the World Series victory parade but we got it to go and our pizza was ready for us at the time they told us to return. Service was great and friendly despite the huge volume of customers during normally non peak hours. I was so excited to dive into this deep dish pie that I could hardly wait for the walk back to our Airbnb apartment. We ordered the "Lou", which comes with spinach, mushrooms and canned sliced tomatoes. We figured we'd try to get some veggies into our otherwise indulgent dish. First of all this crust is to die for! Buttery and crispy ALL the way through, not too thick and baked to a golden brown. The cheese was gooey and delicious and in the perfect ratio to everything else. Sauce was delicious and not too salty. Toppings tasted fresh and not wilted at all. This place makes a 5 star Chicago style pizza.  I don't care if it's a tourist trap because my tastebuds give it a 5!

This and Pequod's are my favorite Chicago Deep Dish pizza. The crust &a the pie itself is heavy but not too heavy. It has an amazing taste & and texture. The pizza itself is not greasy but a bit soggy for those that like to eat your slices with your bare hands. Just be prepared to wait during peak times.

Everything I expected about Chicago deep dish pizza. I had two slices and needed a nap afterwards. So filling and tasty. I got the sausage and cheese pizza and the spinach loaf as an appetizer. Amazing. Would recommend this to everyone!

I had tried the one in Schaumburg and it was fantastic and decided to try this location for lunch. . I was on my own walking around the city.  Finally found it and had the personal sized pepperoni pizza and cup of minastrone  soup. Service was fast and attentive. . Liked the decore.

It was my first time in Chicago so my mindset for lunch was to eat some Chicago Deep Dish pizza! I was starving by the time I entered around 12:30pm to get a table on a Saturday. By that time we were told our party of 4 was going to have to wait about 30 minutes, but we would be texted when our table was ready. We could order appetizers ahead of time, but the pizza would be ordered when we were seated. We saw people who came after us being seated before us. When the waitress finally came back to us over 40 minutes wait time, she apologized and did say we did have a "large party". I did not think 4 seats counted as a large party (a regular square table seats four people!). We ordered the spinach salad with chicken on the side, brushetta and a pie of the Lou deep dish pizza. Everyone except one person had experienced dining at Lou Malnati's previously. Bruschetta was good; bread was toasted well with a good crunch and tomatoes and basil were flavorful. The salad tasted like a tug of war on my taste buds. It was too tart from the balsamic vinaigrette. Yes, I do realize balsamic vinaigrette is sour but this was like having an attack on the taste buds every time you ate a forkful. Also the spinach leaves were left whole so the whole thing was difficult to eat without it hitting the side of your mouth and splattering the vinaigrette on your cheeks. The goat cheese was tossed in and it too begged for your attention as soon as you tasted it. The flavors of the salad were all doing their own thing instead of complimenting each other like a good dish does. The waitress came and served us each a slice of pizza from the pie. This pizza was like a heavy brick of dough with topping cooked onto it. The crust did not have any taste; it wasn't chewy, flaky or appetizing at all. It was a like a thick pie crust at the bottom of the pizza, like a nice wall of cement at the bottom. It had the aroma of a dough that had risen too much (that yeast smell). This pizza does not have any sauce on it, which may have hindered the overall experience. My friend had tried the cheese deep dish previously and she even said that was not that great either. Even the extra oregano and parmesan I had sprinkled on top did not help that much. We picked this pizzeria due to its location and high yelp rating, but overall I think it was a big let down. It has turned me off towards Chicago style pizza for now. We didn't finish our pizza so we packed up the rest to go. You know how some leftovers taste better the day after? Well the Lou Deep Dish did not taste better after.  Every time we walked past this place it was packed, but I still do not know why. Perhaps we should have gone to Uno's instead.

This was my first visit and I am SOLD!!! We had side salads (which were HUGE!) with ranch (amazingggggg ranch!), the cheese bread (PHENOM!), and we shared a personal deep dish sausage and it was so delish!!!! Inypically don't like sausage pizza but this so amazing. The service was great and fast (which was good for us-WORLD SERIES BOUND!!!). I will def be back!!!

Not a fan of Chicago deep dish but if I were this would be the place to go. I have to admit, I'm NY pizza all the way.  The place was packed from start to finish so obviously they are doing something right. You put your name in and then order so when you get your table your food will be not too far behind. That I appreciated since you're hungry when you arrive.  The chocolate chip pizza dessert was top notch so if you go definitely try that!!
Pizza was bomb and thick and hearty. My boyfriend is a big guy who likes to eat and we got a medium for both of us and had plenty left over. Good sauce and toppings. Loved the outdoor patio.

The best deep dish pizza in the world. The cornmeal crust is the difference-maker. One of these days I need to order some frozen shipped Louminati's to CA to tide me over between trips to Chicago. This place is a national treasure.

Local people advised us to check this place out for the best pizza in town. This was my first time trying deep dish Pizza and I had a really good experience.  Pizza takes 35 min to cook and it  was delicious,worth to wait .Service was excellent,prices are average,atmosphere is beautiful.

The wait was about 40 minutes, but it was worth it. I've never had Chicago pizza before, but I'm glad I tried this first. They have a neat system where you order your pizza once you arrive so it's cooking while you wait. Once we were seated, our server was super nice and loved to smile. After our appetizer arrived, our pizza soon followed.  Sooooo good!!!

Four stars is because of the service. Our waiter was very good. Young man who knows he works for tips. Pizza was very good, though I prefer NY style thin crust. If you like Chicago-style deep dish then this is your place. My only other deep dish was Uno's, which I didn't care for. If I lived near this place, I'd be back.
Not from Chicago so my gf and I were trying our first deep dish. It was cool. Not the greatest, but worth the time to stop and say you had it.

First time in Chicago and this was our first stop for deep dish pizza. No regrets - it was a delicious find. The reviews hold up. Lunch specials are great; house salad and individual pizza for $9. Yes please!
Pizza and service was great. We checked in an le Ordered the pizza at the same time. By the time we sat pizza was almost ready. A must in Chicago. Delicious chunky tomatoes and spicy pepperoni
Great Chicago Style pizza!  Individual size is perfect for 1 person.  Not too big and not too small.  Try the soup too!

You can get a personalized pizza for ten bucks. They recommend the Lou which is spinach and other veggies. I think it's vegetarian. And the malnati is meaty with sausage and pepperoni. If you can't make up your mind, get half and half. They don't charge you extra for that which is cool. It was my first deep dish in Chicago so can't compare it to others here but I'm gonna say that I like the dough from masa of echo park in Cali way better.

Hands down one of the best pizza places that I have ever been to.  Not only was the pizza the bomb dot com, the salad was also the best I have ever had.   We chose the regular size salad that they recommend (malnati salad), which had mushrooms that were as sweet as it was fresh (a plus coz I love mushrooms), and sauce that was the best I've ever had.  The pizza, which was the Chicago deep dish classic, was also amazing, especially with butter crust. It tasted like they put some kind of wine in the oil, which made it flavorful and sweet.  The sausage wasn't bits and pieces like your typical pizza, but it was a whole layer of them on top of the pizza.   Lastly, the service was great.  Friendly and attentive.  Would recommend.

I wanted to give this place a special shout-out to their customer service and their manager Bill and team. I ordered pizza from this place for the first time a couple weeks ago, ordering a medium deep dish half-pepperoni (for a friend) and half-greenpepper (for me, a vegetarian). I was disappointed with the pizza because their was pepperoni baked into the pizza on my side, so I had to throw away most of my pizza. I wrote a message to the store letting them know about the situation and if they could be more careful next time. I get a call from Bill the manager a few days later, and he offers to make a whole new pizza for me on the house because of the inconvenience. I've never had that happen before, and wasn't expecting that to happen from a large chain restaurant in one of the biggest cities in the US that I just moved to. So just wanted to give a special shout out to this store for maintaining that customer service despite being so popular. Oh, and their pizza is top notch!

Had to do the obligatory deep dish pizza experience while we were in Chicago.  Got the Lou's pizza but substituted onions and peppers for the mushrooms. Really tasty! Note: The medium pizza is pretty big, can serve 3-4 people easily.

No wonder this is on of the top 10 deep dish pizza of 2016.  Service is great, the waitress is super friendly and attentive. She recommended on what local beer to try.  I order the lunch special at the restaurant. I choose the minestrone soup (the broth is seasoned with beans, veggies, & pasta) the soup is in this lunch special is a perfect size to start up with when the weather is a little chilly outside. I order the Stuffed Spinach bread (a perfection of spinach blend with cheese and herbs stuffed inside a soft and crunchy bread outside and dip with a marinara sauce on the side) the cheese is chewy where u can pull out a long string for it. When u see that you will know this is a good pizza place.  I also order the personal size Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza. The crush is crunchy with the perfect thickness of the bread topped with ripened tomato sauce blend with the flavorful sausage. The smell of the tomato sauce and butter crust make you salivating the moment you see the pizza.  I'm not surprise to see this is one of Chicago best recommended deep dish style pizza!!! MY FIRST time in Chicago and a very good impression on a first time deep dish pizza eater!

Well, If i could give 3.5 stars I will. When I look for a good place for deep dish pizza so this place come out.  Pretty much like most ppl said, you really will wait for a while for your food.  I was here in an odd time so it was quiet here. I did not have to wait and I can get a table.  The service was attentive and great.  I had the authentic Chicago style deep dish pizza personal size. It was different. The crust was still pretty crispy and it was hot and fresh.  Just when I eat it, the crust was so easy to fall apart from the content. I was not too sure if that is suppose to be this way or? I also ordered an order of buffalo wing but this was just an extra order.  It was not spicy and very salty.  Overall. I don't know too much abut deep dish pizza but I do like it.
What a wonderful place to enjoy Chicago style deep dish pizza! Amazing food and great up beat service by Kristina Jones. Thank you for a memorable experience!!

Chicago Marathon weekend this was the place to be!! I ordered take out Classic Deep Dish to go...40 mom's later I had cheesy and meaty goodness. Very impressed with Chicago style pizza...Layer of sausage was yummy!

It was our first time in Chicago and we only had a few hours before heading back home. The staff was so welcoming and accommodating. We ordered the Buffalou wings, fries (which are curly,btw) and shared a small deep dish, butter crust with spinach and poultry sausage! The wings were great, and got an approval from my boyfriend who does not typically like buffalo wings. The sausage could have used a bit more flavor, but ohhhh was the pizza an overall experience. Piping hot, cheesy and so filling. We had one slice left of our small to take home. We may get some shipped to our house, but overall we can't wait to return to Chicago and come back for more pizza!
Love, love, LOVE the pizza here. Excellent Chicago deep dish pizza. Great crust, great toppings. Mmmm mmm.

I had the lunch special, which consisted of a one-topping individual sized stuffed pizza, soup, and a drink.  For the soup, you can have either minestrone or soup of the day, which was potato and bacon when I visited, or you can instead get a salad.  The daily special is $8.95 before taxes, and is available daily from 11:00 AM to 2:00 PM.  I really like how it is available every day, including weekends since a lot of other restaurants only offer lunch specials during the week.   I called ahead to speed up the order, but they only half back it until you arrive, and when you arrive, they put you a list to be notified via text message that you can be seated.  I had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated on a Saturday during lunch time, and then had to wait another 10 minutes for my order once I was seated.  You should definitely allocate a lot of time if you come here for lunch, since they are very slow and busy as well. The pizza was very good, definitely better than Giordano's and Gino's East. Of the three, I would definitely rank Lou's the best for stuffed pizza, followed by Giordano's, and then followed by Gino's east.  The crust is very buttery and flakey, and the sauce is chunky and very good.  My only complaint about the pizza is that they never put on enough sauce.  I will order extra sauce the next time I come to Lou's.  The soup was not that good, but I really came for the pizza. The wait staff was nice but not very attentive.  i was not asked once for a drink refill, but I will say they are efficient at cleaning the table when you finish and quickly providing and processing the check - I think they are on a mission to get you in and out as quickly as possible to keep the people moving through since they have lots of customers to serve.  Lastly, as most people know, you can order frozen pizzas to bake at home, which start at $12.55 for the 9" pies.

Oh I enjoy the deep dish pizza here. The butter crust and sun ripened tomatoes really enhance the flavor. I always order "The Lou" - spinach mix, mushrooms with three different cheeses on thin crust. The deep dish version is delicious, but I still prefer thin crust. I also ship their frozen deep dish pizzas to my cousins in CA and NJ. On weekends prepare for a wait to get a table. Service is always excellent.

First night in Chicago and I was starving after a long day of travel! I had Lous bookmark on yelp because of high reviews and it's proximity to my hotel. On the trip to the hotel one of the other people on my shuttle recommended for Lou's, and it was also listed on the recommended local restaurants at the hotel... I went online and saw that I could order in advance since it was a very busy in the area and I was very hungry and tired I placed an order for takeout. I walked over and sure enough it was crazy and crowded !The cashier staff were friendly and efficient. I have the green salad which was huge, but basic. It had an amazing sweet Italian dressing. I ordered a personal deep dish pizza with spinach, mushrooms,and onion,no cheese. The sauce was good and chunky vegetables were great. The deep dish crust however was lacking.... it was soggy in the middle and a really hard and crusty at the edges.... it was like eating a cracker . I'll give it another shot, but I prefer NY style pizza.

Great service and yummy food! The wait was kind of ridiculous but I like that they take your pizza order while you're waiting. But seriously... we got here around 3 pm and there was a 30-40 minute wait. At 3 pm?! Why?! But the pizza was good (my first real Chicago pizza experience) and the salad we got (forgot which one but it had bacon?) was also super tasty. Our waitress was awesome and super friendly. I only saved one Chicago meal for pizza and I'm glad this was my choice.

I'm not a big fan of deep dish pizza but their deep dish pizza was delicious! I highly recommend the "Lou" with pepperoni and the malnati Chicago classic. The personal size dish was the perfect size for one person. I also recommended the cheddar cubes for appetizers, they were very cheesy and addictive. The service was great, our waiter was very attentive and helpful. I went on a Saturday evening and there was about a 30 min wait, but it was worth the wait. I will definitely return next time I visit.

Very very disappointed. This is my first time having Chicago deep dish and this was honestly worse than Pizza Hut. The mozzarella cheese is very cheap. They over do the sauce I guess to compensate for lack of flavor. Also extremely over priced for what it was.
The rest of my group got the deep dish, which they liked but I got the thin crust which was amazing (and tasted fantastic cold the next day too!)the cheese bread was great too.

My first time in Chicago and my friend kept pushing this place and I'm SO glad she did! First, let me start with my server... Taylor worked his a$$ off to make sure not only my table was taken care of, but he rocked the whole section. He made great recommendations (the stuffed spinach bread was amazing!!!) and he was just great all around as was all of the food. For my first Chicago deep dish experience... This was definitely the best! Thank you!

We couldn't come to terms with not trying a Chicago-style deep dish pizza while visiting here, so we did just that. We both never tried one, so our palates were filled with curiosity and excitement as we walked into Lou Manalti's. We were seated immediately when we walked in since we came on a non-busy weekday for lunch. After browsing the menu, we decided to go with the Chicago Classic. The waiter told us in advance that the pizzas take 25-30 min to cook but we didn't mind the wait. When our pizza arrived, our waiter served the slices on our plate. Immediately, we could see the gooey cheesy goodness that everyone was talking about. There was so much cheese! We both took our first bite, and our taste buds were pretty satisfied. The thick sausage was nice and flavorful, but we weren't a huge fan of the super thick crust. Some parts were very tough and difficult to chew.  But overall, the pizza was well seasoned and very authentic. The portion was very generous, and we were stuffed with the small size (serves 2 people). Also, the service was excellent and our waiter checked in with us periodically to see if we needed anything.

Atlanta boy came north in search of the world's best pizza.  I am putting my flag in the ground here. It's the crust!  All other pizza bakers in the world give you a crust that could also serve as the box you carry it home in. The crust is the foundation that allows you to add the quality ingredients that other pizza bakers have. But without a good foundation you don't have a Great pizza.

Cannot tell you how upset I am being a loyal Lou customer. I had ordered our useual for carryout and was there to pick it up after the hassle of parking bcos of all the construction. I gave a gift certificate voucher at the time of checkout and the girl at the counter informed me that it had expired, I said can I speak with your manager. I  probably got it during the holidays as bonus for  the many giftcards and completely forgot to use it till yesterday. So the really unfriendly manager comes and says its not something he recognizes and its expired. I said its from your store and I didn't read the fine print can you make an exception ? I said maybe I got it as customer appreciation from one of the employees Megan and I was looking up my messages while he continued to help other customers. Finally, I gave up and paid for the pizza because I didn't want to end up getting a parking ticket on top of this drama. when I asked for my gift certificate back the Manager seemed very unhappy and reluctant to hand it over....very weird, its my gift certificate and I want it Back!!! "he was like,if you must"   Zero customer skills, if werent for my kids who love Lou atleast 2 times a month I wouldn't go back!!!

This pizza place hits the spot!  Came on a moderately  busy Sunday night and was immediately greeted by friendly faces. The expected wait time was 20 minutes.  While you wait you can buy yourself a beer at the counter right next to the server and you can also place your order.  This was great, since by the time we were seated we did not have to wait long for our deep dish pizza.   If you like appetizers, this yelper suggests the spinach garlic bread.  Warm, cheesy, and deliciously seasoned.  It comes with a side of marinara sauce.  Our pizza arrived, yet we still wanted to keep working on that spinach garlic bread!  The Lou's Classic, a simple cheese and sausage deep dish pizza is simply the best cheese and sausage pizza I've ever had.  I usually prefer multiple toppings but this simple 1-topping pizza was just as satisfying.  The only thing that better than the pizza was that I didn't have to pay downtown prices for a simple cheese and sausage pizza.  Will definitely return.  Definitely recommend.   Other notes: metered street parking and parking garages available in the area.  Attire is casual for downtown. About a 10 minute walk from CTA elevated rail (Roosevelt/State).

I don't remember the last time I had deep dish pizza, but all that matters is the fact that I've never had it in the city of Chicago. For shame! Yes I know. My boyfriend and I made sure to stop by one of the many Lou Malnati's locations during our Chicago vacation, prepared for an insane lunch wait. Actually, it wasn't too bad. We arrived and placed our order at the counter, since the pizza takes awhile to prepare. The wait to be seated was around 15 to 20 minutes, then the wait for our pizza continued. In the meantime, we ordered the mozzarella sticks with marinara sauce. SO GOOD!! The cheese was not too melty, and there was just the right amount of batter. Great way to start our meal, and I would highly recommend them. Our pizza finally came. We shared the Malnati Chicago Classic, made with Lou's lean sausage, extra cheese, and tomato sauce on Buttercrust. The highlights were definitely the cheese and the crust. I've never had such fresh and tasty cheese on a pizza before, and you know a pizza is good when you're aiming to finish all the crust. I wouldn't want to have this pizza super often, but I definitely want to come back and try the other types of pizza other than the Chicago Classic. The "Lou" with spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes covered with cheese on garlic Buttercrust sounds amazing!! I'm looking forward to my next Chicago trip already.

oh yea 5 stars baby!! one of the best deep dish pizzas I have ever had.  Went to Chicago for the first time and looked up yelp for the best deep dish pizza et viola Lou Malnati's shows up.  We pay a visit, wait an hour for seating, paid $12 for 2 beers while waiting.  We were given the menu and asked to pre-order our desired pizza (this is before one hour wait).  And the wait starts, lol.  They have an app where you can see your position in the wait line and they also send you text messages when your table is ready.   Ok, the pizza - awesomely amazing deliciously excellent.  so its the butter curst, deep dish, Chicago Classic pizza, one of their best sellers (in the menu it said 'loaded with extra cheese' muhahaha) We LOVED this pie, yes it was super loaded with cheese but mmmhhh was it worth it (yes later ked couple miles just to convince our bodies that we burnt some calories) and we don't even eat pork/beef that often STILL LOVED the each and every bite of this pie.  the pizza's were decently priced for the quality.  We also tried their tiramisu and it was good not great.
My favorite Chicago deep dish. Love the crust!
The food and service here is always top notch. Visited with my sons today and Theresa our sever made them feel like kings with her attentiveness.  By far my best place for pizza!!

I have to go five stars because this is what Chicago deep dish pizza is all about. Lou Malnati's may or may not be the originator of the original deep dish recipe, I will leave that to Chicagoans to debate. I just know that this was THE place recommended to me to try it, and is pretty darn good!  So, as a New Englander in town to try some deep dish, this was pretty darn good, and I would recommend this spot!  Remember, deep dish takes about 30 minutes, so give it time!  The pizza is layered and baked, so the sauce is on top. You need a knife and fork to go at it! It is a safe bet to go with the classic!

This place can get pretty crowded so be prepared to wait for a table . You might want to order your pizza while waiting since the pizza takes some time to prepare .This was one of the highly recommended places to have a deep dish pizza in Chicago and we were not disappointed .  The medium pizza serves 3 people but since it is quite heavy it could easily serve 4 of us .
If you're in Chicago, this is where you want to go for Chi town pizza. Ive had pizza in NY, and Chicago, and this tops it. 5 star

September 14, 2016 ONLY This is my favorite hands up FAVORITE PIZZA  spot. I ordered pizza today and I swear this was the WROST pizza I have ever had from  Malnati's close to NO sausage on my deep dish sausage pizza. Cheese pizza no flavor tasteless. Truly disappointed.

Crust is flaky and holds. I thought the sauce isnt as bold as some other places (e.g., Giordano's ) and some people would prefer that. One key idea is that they'll take your deep dish pizza order while youre still waiting for your table, that way when you get seated, you dont have to wait as long to get the deep dish. That cut down on our sitting time and was definitely a time-saver. The wait was about 45 minutes on a holiday weekend Sunday for lunch.

Came here at 3:00 on a Saturday and it was packed but service was still great. Their Lou Malnati salad is really good (has little bits of salami instead of bacon bits). The pizza took about 45 minutes to come out. It was great - get the Malnati classic (sausage deep dish with extra cheese) and add pepperoni and jalapenos!

This is my second time trying Chicago deep dish pizza and I'm so glad I tried Lou Malnatis. First time was at Pequods, and it was just OK. Lou Malnatis tastes a lot better!  I tried the Chicago Classic and the "Lou". The classic is soooo delicious. Hot and Cheesy, nice crust, good sausage. I enjoyed it a lot more than the Lou. The lou was just OK for me. I came here with my BF and we each ordered our own personal pizza. It filled me up just right. We then ordered the 3 piece dessert plate. Basically pick 3 out of 4 available desserts. They messed up our order so waiter ended up giving us all 4 types of dessert. They were just ok. Not outstanding. Only thing that stood out was the chocolate chip pizza which was delicious.

When in Chicago, do as the Chicagoans do and that means eating deep dish pizza. After consulting my friends from Chicago about where to eat, almost all of them said Lou Malnati's is one of the go-to places. After a quick search, there are a bunch of Lou's scattered across the city so regardless of where you are, you're probably in the proximity of a Lou's.  I was immediately impressed by how this chain of pizza restaurants has the dining experience locked down. They anticipate being super busy so they allow you to put in your order with the cashier first before even seating you. While you wait in the little waiting area, there are outlets for you to charge your phone so you're occupied.  I got an order of the personal Malnati Chicago Classic which has 4 big slices. I was so excited for this meal and it was pretty good! I may have hyped the deep dish pizza too much in my head to where it didn't fully meet my expectations but it was still delicious nonetheless. I love thick pizzas and the crust was fantastic. I didn't love the buttermilk crust at first but it grew on me as I ate more slices. Not to mention, the amount of sausage that was on the pizza was generous. The sausage was pretty good. The service is a bit slow but I was told to expect that at a pizza place since it takes a while to cook. Overall, if I'm back in Chicago, I wouldn't hesitate about going to Lou's.
The Chicago deep dish pizza is always spectacular. Their original with butter crust is the best I have ever eaten. I do wish they had a bar/bar seating.

Well to say The lease this place did not live up to my expectations. The plates were dirty. The wait was long the pizza was mediocre at best.  I would not eat there again. The waiter seemed very scattered. I was told this was one of the best pizza places in Chicago I did not think it was very good.

I'm not much of a pizza fan but it was our last day of our 5 day Chicago road trip. We got to the restaurant around 5:30 PM on Sunday and we waited about 30-40 minutes. But we could order the pizza in prior to getting a table so that our order can be ready when we get a table. Five of us (3 girls and 2 guys) got the classic and the Lou, both in small size. We should've ordered a medium and a small. I personally preferred the Lou because the spinach and mushroom complimented thick tomato sauce and thick layers of cheese. The crust, however, was a miss. It was a bit soggy. The classic had Italian sausage which made the pizza thicker and heavier. If you're a meat lover, get the classic. Maybe I'll visit again to try other pizzas and the Malnati salad and actually experience the hype. But overall, I'm not really impressed.

Poor waiter in Nikola. Ordered, waited over 45 minutes (only a personal pan pizza) for our food only to have another waitress bring our food out that was warm. Not hot with steam coming off like other tables. The A/C vent above the table is leaking and dripping onto us as we eat. The pizza was very plane and not worth the hype that others lead you to believe. I had to ask for our check and then had to wait another 10 minutes for Niokla to finish dropping off food to the table next to us and taking orders for two other tables. Very poor service and you can get better service anywhere else.
Best Chicago pizza and best pizza I have had in a long time. Very flavorful and great crust, has the taste of a real pie.

First time having deep dish pizza. I ordered the personal size which was the perfect amount of food. I ended up finishing it all. Service was great, they have you order your pizza as you wait for a table so that it's ready once you sit down.
