The salad I had was pretty good, but I don't like the pizza. There is nothing special I can mention that would make it surpass other pizza.

We ordered Home delivery at East Groveland Park on 12th August. Ordered their Deep dish pizza and we're told it would be delivered in an hour. Waited for 1.5 hours and it never got delivered. Repeated calls were not picked up.   Suggest you guys not to take orders if you can't delivered. My 9 year old son went hungry thanks to you !!

Our first dinner ever in Chicago. Arrived during prime dinner time on a Thursday and it was packed. The good thing was, we were able to order while waiting for our table, apparently pizza takes 45 mins to cook.  We ordered the Chicago classic deep dish pizza and their signature pizza. Both pizzas were amazing. If you're looking for something meaty, get the Chicago classic. The sausage and cheese really hit the spot. If you're looking for something more tangy and refreshing, get the classic. It's different and nothing less than satisfying.  We also ordered the malnati salad, it was, hands down AMAZING!! Perfect balance for the dressing, fresh lettuce leafs with bacon bites that gives you the crunch you need. Together with the pizza, we were two very happy customers!

What's a trip to Chicago without trying their staple deep dish pizza? There were so many options in places to go, but we set our hearts on Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. We went on a Sunday night for dinner and waited around 35-45 min., not too bad when you have good company. LOL. So when you get there, basically you go inside and order what you want at the cash register, and then you wait to be called to be seated.  My friend and I order the personal sized Malnati Chicago Classic (don't judge us, we were trying to make some room for an appetizer because...CARBS). We also ordered the Stuffed Spinach Bread which I definitely recommend! The spinach bread was super crunchy, with spinach and cheese and onion inside, and a side of tomato sauce to dip the bread in. The personal sized deep dish pizza was cut into half into 2 pieces, about 6 feet in diameter both ways. The butter crust on the pizza was like perfectly baked, and the flavor of the meat came out in every bite. I would definitely come back just for that alone! My only problem with this establishment is that in addition to the wait to get seated, we had to wait another 20-30 min. to get food, and by that time I was already HANGRY. I thought that the point of ordering first was that by the time we got seated, our food would be ready very shortly. Other than that, great food. :)

3.5. As a Chicagoan, yesterday was my first time trying Lou Malnati's. The wait time was only about 10 minutes and our server was very attentive throughout our meal. We ordered the buffalo chicken wings as an app, which were very good and saucy. We also ordered a deep dish pizza. I thought the crust was nice and crispy and had a great amount of cheese; however, I feel it did not outdo Giordano's pizza. I wish Lou had more options when trying to pick a pizza and have the pizza be a bit more saucy to match the amount of the cheese.

My first Chicago deep dish experience. Unfortunately I haven't had any other deep dish pizzas to compare, but I definitely was not disappointed with our choice. Amazing. So much cheese. Just the right amount of topping. The base was perfectly cooked. We tried both the original and the spinach. I personally preferred the spinach. There just seemed to be more flavour to it. The only downside was the excruciatingly painful wait. This place gets busy. I would recommend trying to hit this place up outside of the busy typical dinner timeframes. Try to visit either later or earlier in the evening, before you end up having to wait hungry for up to an hour. The service was also slow. Although we had pre ordered, we still had to wait almost half an hour at the table for our food to reach us. It was a little disappointing, and felt that staff could have been a bit more proactive in seating people faster. Considering the huge line, there were many tables which would become vacated and waiting to be cleared. Then there was a huge lag between tables being cleared and staff calling the next guests.  Despite the food being fantastic, service contributes majorly to an experience for me, so unfortunately I couldn't quite justify rating the overall visit as high as their potential could have warranted. It's a popular place, but I'm sure there are some other locations which may offer a better all round experience.

OMG best deep dish in Chicago. As compared with Giordano's and Uno/Duo, the crust is flakier and butterier. They also use about half as much cheese as Giordano's, and I really appreciated that. I could actually taste the other parts of my pizza! Aside from the food, the atmosphere was calmer and quieter than your usual pizzeria. I don't even remember much about the table service since the food was so good!
The thin crust is crispy, the pizza sauce has red wine in it, I like it.  Downside; everybody likes it so you have to wait in line for a table. Therefore I never eat here.

I went to Lou's around 6PM on a Sunday. As I approached the line was out the door - a good sign! We were able to put our pizza order in immediately (it takes 45 minutes for the pizza to cook), and we had a table in 20 minutes. I went to Lou's because I read they could make a dairy-free/vegan deep dish pizza. I ordered "The Lou" with no cheese. It was the blandest pizza I've ever eaten. There was no seasoning on the pizza or in the crust. I guess most of the taste comes from the cheese. My boyfriend got The Lou with cheese and wasn't very impressed either. I'm happy with a restaurant can make a dairy-free meal - but it should taste good too.

Not a deep dish pizza fan, but I can dig this one for sure! Shared a small deep dish pepperoni and small salad with red wine vinigarette dressing. Place was busy for a reason but the service was great.

First time having deep dish pizza, on the fence about two other pizza places till I took a mini survey of hotel staff and cab drivers.....So Lou's it was. Lucky for us, no wait, we decided to get the personals size and that was too much. The pizza was delicious, crust was great, I personally suggest getting the sausage in your pie (lol as a topping, sorry).  Check was around $20 so all in all a total win.
Delicious deep dish pizza!  Would definitely return here next time we're in Chicago!  We enjoyed Lou Malnati's more than Giordano's.

This is my first time at http Lou Malnatis.  The pizza was very good. There was a line when we arrived and they said it would be a 15 mins wait.  The restaurant allow you to order your pizza while you for your table.  That is very cool.   Once we set down we ordered appetizers and our drinks. We order a personal pan pizza, small pizza and a pizza that serves 2 people.  Also, spinach cheese bread appetizer was the awesome and ordered a family size salad.  The salad dressings were delicious.  The pizza was really good.  The crust was buttery and my friends enjoyed their thin crust pizza.   The staff was friendly.  I'll go back to visit.

I came here because of the good reviews on Yelp. Every time I rely on Yelp for a good place it never disappoints. This is definitely a place to go. Deep dish in Chicago, enough said. Get on a plane or drive here and get some.

Lou Malnatti's is some of the best pizza Chicago has to offer. However, this location on State St had a HUGE problem with flies on 8/22/16. It was disgusting for my wife and I to try to eat our meal while swatting flies with our free hand. They were all around the dining room everywhere. I got up to go to the restroom and there were flies all throughout the men's restroom as well. I went from swatting while eating to swatting while....nevermind. It was disgusting and they need to possibly close down and clean the place before allowing customers to eat in that type of environment. 9/12 - I was contacted by management about my review and they sent me a gift card and expressed their desire to keep me as a customer. I appreciate that greatly. That's why I edited my review.

I heard that Lou Malnati was the Mecca of Chicago deep dish pizza. After about a week in Chicago and a few other pies under my belt, I got to give it a try. I was with a group of about a dozen people and we were able to sit once half of us arrived. After that, I never felt like it was a group dining experience in a negative way. Our server was on top of his game getting our orders placed and drinks refilled.  So the pizza... I split the Chicago Classic with three other people. Perfect size. It came out hot in the pan and our server quickly distributed the first slices. The chunky tomato sauce on top was different for sure. I'm not sure if that's my cup of tea, but it was quality. I was excited deeper into the bites hitting the cheese. The sausage was thinly sliced and nicely distributed, not to mention tasty. The buttery, flaky crust was probably my favorite part. We also had a bruschetta for the table, which was as good as any other bruschetta I've ever had. They didn't offer drafts and the bottle selection wasn't too big. I ended up with a Lagunitas Something Something. So the deep dish verdict? I think I favor my first pie, Gino's East, but still totally enjoyed my Lou Malnati experience.

The Husband and I had Lou Malnati's bookmarked for our recent trip to Chicago because of its high Yelp reviews in its many locations across the city. They don't take reservations so we arrived around 5:45pm on a Friday to a 35-40 minute wait for a table for two.  We put our name in and our pizza order in so that it would be ready by the time our name was called for a table. Otherwise you will end up waiting an additional 45+ minutes once you sit down. We had to stand at one of their tables outside and wait because the lobby was PACKED with people so it was hard to even get in and place your order. Get out of the way people! When we were finally seated my Husband ordered a cup of Minestrone Soup to start which he thought was tasty. I ordered a Goose Island 312 beer to keep it local and it was OK. Having beers in bottles here seems to be big, not too many places have a lot of beers on tap. I ordered a Personal Thin Crust Cheese Pizza and it was OK. I wasn't really a fan of the texture of the crust, but I thought the sauce had good flavor. There wasn't too much cheese either. A personal size was perfect for me because I'm not a big eater. My Husband ordered a Personal The Malnati Classic Deep Dish Pizza and he thought it was OK as well. Not the best he has had in the city. A personal size was good for him as well and he is a big eater. We probably wouldn't come back when I'm Chicago again unless someone else wanted to go. There are too many other pizza places to try! Gotta keep moving.

Being that we are in Chicago, you have to get the well famous Deep Dish Pizza. Well, onto Lou Malnati's we went.  FYI: Be prepared for a long wait time.  While you are waiting for a table,  you actually get to order your deep dish pizza in advance, so by the time you get to your table it should be ready.  Once we got to our table, the pizza was ready in a few minutes. We went with The Malnati's Chicago Classic. Most popular according to the menu. Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust.  The pizza was cheesy gooey, tomato-ey (yes it's a word), great lean sausage, and buttery. It was a delicious deep dish pizza and very filling.  For dessert, we got the chocolate chip deep dish pizza. It was basically a huge chocolate chip cookie with vanilla bean ice cream, whip cream, and a cherry over it. That was sweet, warm, cool, and definitely made me feel so good eating it. We got the small deep dish pizza which can perfectly feed 2 people. They are big slices, so don't order too much or else you be taking home a lot of pizza. I definitely recommended it. There are many locations around the Chicago area.

This was my first time in Chicago and everyone told me I needed to try the deep dish. The girlfriend I was staying with lives near this place. We went to on a Saturday night around 8:30. It was sooo packed. People were waiting outside and inside the restaurant for their take out orders and tables. They do have a cool preorder system where you can order before you get your table. I was hoping that would speed the process up a bit but after waiting 40 minutes to sit down we still had to wait 15 - 20 minutes for our food. Taste wise the pizza was worth the wait. Totally delicious. My biggest complaint is that it was so little food for the price. The personal pan pizza was $10 and it was probably slightly smaller than 1 slice of New York style pizza. I can easily eat 2 of those and was hoping to have leftovers. So I was disappointed by the size especially for the price. I ended up ordering a salad once the pizza came to ensure I was satisfied. I have to give special kudos to our server. The friend I came here with is one of those people that can be really difficult to deal with and borderline rude. And the waitress maintained her professional face the entire time. Great food, great service, not so great price.
One of the best deep dish places I've found in Chicago! We had the spinach salad and the sausage pizza. Both were delicious! A great casual place with kids and pricing was reasonable.

One of the best meals we had in Chicago. It was packed that night and every night we walked by the place, but after we put our name in we were able to order a pizza and it worked out perfectly as we arrived at our table. One of the best meals we ate

It's my first time having deep dish pizza, and I was kinda disappointed. There was a decent amount of cheese, but the bread was thicker than I've expected. The service was not good. I would have gave it 3 stars if it was just the food. We pre-ordered our pizza at the counter before our seat was ready. After we got seated, we ordered a salad. The server didn't notice we have already ordered a pizza so he kept on giving us a weird look. Later, we asked him how much longer do we have to wait for the pizza because it has been 20 mins. he said 5. Another 20 mins passed, still no pizza. We asked again. He said 5, and apparently very impatient. When the pizza finally came, he almost "threw" the pizza and plates on our table. He cuts our pizza, and literally ruins it by pulling the cheese off of one slice of the pizza so we ended up piling everything up to eat it. Finally, he tries to clean our table when we're obviously still eating and there's still half a pizza in the tray. I guess you're not allowed to ask what's going on with your pizza?
The Lou's pizza is the best!!! It is everything i wanted my pizza to be. With fresh vegetables, tangy savory sauce, and the best tasting cheese that is far better than anything i have back home.

Love this deep dish pizza ! It was recommended by my uber driver and delivered . For two we got a medium but could've been satisfied with a small . We did a deep dish pepperoni with onion mushroom and garlic and it was amazing . The service was great probably the best server I ever had she really held it together and made the experience that much better .  Would definitely recommend !!

Came here on a recent trip to Chicago. Showed up on a Thursday night with a party of 10 and it took about an hour to get seated. It was fine since they took down my number and I was able to order while I roamed around Barnes and noble next door. Once we got seated we got waters really fast and our server was really friendly. Ordered a cheese, the Lou, and a thin crust pizza (for the health conscious at the table). Everything was amazing!! Even the thin crust! Seriously!! The crust was so good and well done and crispy not soggy at all. All of the pizzas were extremely good. I definitely think this place is better than Giordanos where I swear I just got globs of soggy dough. Will definitely come again if I'm ever in town. Considered how many desi weddings there are in Chicago...very likely and looking forward to eating at Lou Malnatis again. Stop calling it illuminatis people -_-

Delicious! The crust was nice and crisp for deep dish - not soggy like some other places. The service was nice. The restaurant was very clean, inviting and family friendly. The deep dish pizza takes 30 minutes to make after its ordered but it's worth the wait!

I've tried 3 deep dish places in Chicago: Lou Manalti's, Giordano's, and Pequod's. Lou Manalti's is definitely my favorite because the crust is amazinggggg and everything is much more well-proportioned. I feel like Giordano's and Pequod's are too thick and have too much cheese so I get full really quickly and feel fat and sluggish afterwards. Lou Manalti's deep dish is noticeably thinner than the other two so I'm not drowning in excess cheese. Also the buttercrust is a game changer! I've tried the following: - The Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish. Medium (serves 3) $19.95.  Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. this is my favorite of the two pizzas I tried, mostly because I need to have meat on my pizza lol. tbh I'm not even a huge pizza fan normally but I love and dream of this one!  - The "Lou" deep dish. Medium (serves 3) $22.25 Spinach mix, mushrooms and sliced roma tomatoes covered with blend of mozzarella, romano and cheddar cheese on garlic Buttercrust. for the vegetarians and vegetable lovers out there, this is also delicious. maybe I will consider adding meat to this one day and it will achieve perfection.  - Malnati Salad. Family size (serves 4-5) $13.95 Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, salami bits and gorgonzola cheese with our Sweet Vinaigrette and romano cheese. OK. let me be real. I am so not a salad girl at all. I literally rolled my eyes when my friend asked if we could order salad for the table. like what?! who goes to a pizza place to order salad? SCOFF SCOFF I SAY! but wow was I wrong!! this salad is delicious. something about their dressing that makes it so good. don't be a hater like me. try it!! I heard they also sell the salad dressing separately. apparently its that good!  this was a perfect amount for 6 girls with a few slices left over. the medium pizzas have 6 slices, not sure if this changes for the other sizes. I usually eat 2 slices. some of my girlfriends could only eat one (weak sauce :P)

I have to say I much preferred Giordano's. There's something about Lou's that I just didn't care for. It's not to say it was bad, but it definitely didn't live up to the hype of that "Chicago Deep Dish Pizza" experience all my friends who visited talked about.  If you go I would actually recommend getting the thin crust - I found it to be a good cheese-to-crust ratio.  Also the spinach cheese bread was good too, but not a MUST TRY.  Stay Cheerful ;)

Well after all I heard about this pizzeria I must say it is overrated the crust was hard as a rock the cheese thicker than the crust where was the buttered crust all the way from California and if this is Chicago's finest I will keep my Pizza Hut in California any day over this terrible tasting pizza I must give kudos to the salad and the hot wings but I went for pizza I was highly disappointed

Def try this pizza if this is your first time in Chicago looking for chicago style deep dish pizza.... I recommend lou pizza for all the vegetarian lovers. The serving size is generous... Recommend also to try their tiramisu. Will be back next time I m in town..... Our  server was amazing and gave us honest reccs... :) overall worth the wait for 45 mins on busy weekends...

We were here on vacation and had the Lou's. Great crust and and flavor was amazing. Super busy and got got right in. Had a great time with great food, drinks and company. We would def go back next time we're in town.

Favorite pizza in Chicago - the crust is divine and it's not overly cheesy like other deep dish. The servers cut and serve the pizza on your plate for you, which feels like an elevated experience. Lots of locations around Chicago as well, go try it now!

We were impressed even though we had a wait,  at how they let us order and that way we didn't have long to wait one we were seated.   The waitress was great!   She was very nice and did a wonderful job keeping our drinks full!   My husband drinks a lot of water...or pop...whatever he is drinking.   The food was outstanding too!

Staff is superb. My parents were eating here when my mom felt faint and started having symptoms possibly like a heart attack. The waitress hailed a cab within a minute, and while they were heading to the door, had their pizza boxed up for them, and the manager comp'd their bill, without being asked and refused to take my dad's cash. I've never heard of better service. My dad was taking my mom because he had eaten there previously and thought it was the best pizza he'd ever had, and he can't wait to take her back again now that she's healthy.

We love that pizza - deep dish sausage is always first class (yum)!  I enjoy their salads too!  So glad they opened up a restaurant in the South Loop.  It is closer to work and much easier to double park there to pickup dinner.   As an aside, I ate the last piece of pizza last night and was not disappointed.  Good to the last bite.
Never really liked pizza in my life before..., until today! Thanks to Lisa from Renaissance Hotel who recommended Lou's pizza here.

It's hard to give these guys anything other than 5 stars because this is what you go to Chicago to eat when you want a deep dish pizza. They are the guys that make it. Was is super thick? Yes. Was the cheese blend different than all other pizza I've had? Sure. But these are the guys that do it- it really just is what it is. Makes me thankful this is not my only option for pizza in NY, but as a tourist it was fun to see what all the hype was about. We did half plain and half Lou. We all liked the Lou better. The sauce was on top of the cheese on the plain, and the crust stayed nice and crunchy- even under the center of the pie. All good.

While the pizza was just as awesome as expected, the real surprise was how good the salad was! I'm definitely not a salad person (I avoid vegetables as much as possible), but the dressing... Wowza. I ended up going back and buying a bottle of it for when I leave Chicago! Also if you're trying to go on a weekend night, the way to go might be ordering a pizza and picking it up. I've done this twice and it's worked out perfectly. We tried to sit down the first time and it was over an hour and a half wait to get a table, so we ordered online for pick up. It was ready in 45 minutes!

This is not my first visit to a Lou Malnati's, but the first time to this location. It is an easy walk from the Hilton Chicago, and is one of the famous deep dish Chicago Style pizza joints. On this trip I had the The Malnati Chicago Classic which is the lean sausage, cheese and tomato sauce on their signature Buttercrust.  Definitely tasty.  I prefer more cheese and less tomato chunks for my pizza, but this is Chicago and when in Chicago I have to respect their style.
Hands down best pizza ever. I love love love their pizza and their salad with their special salad dressing is to die for. I typically keep a bottle in my refrigerator.

The pizza really lacked salt in my opinion, and I never say that about any food in America normally. I'm fighting with my boyfriend on which was better, Giordanos or Lou Malnatis. I really feel like Giordanos is better however, I'll give Lou Malnatis another chance with different toppings.

Great pizza! I'm not a huge fan of deep dish pizza, so I ordered the thin crust sausage and cheese personal pizza and it was sooooo delicious. Love their crust! Service was great and our order came out fast. It was the perfect spot for a quick bite!

Came here on my 2nd night in town after having trouble deciding which famous pizza place to try.  This location isn't the oldest in Chicago, but it's the 2nd oldest active location in the city.  There are 12 total Chicagoland locations.  There was only a 20 min wait for my table....and they tell you to pre-order your pizza at the counter to the right of the hostess. After being seated they take your drink order.  They only have a small selection of bottled beers, some wines, so this isn't a major drinking spot.  They focus on the food, specifically the pizza....  their non-pizza menu items are pretty reasonably priced. I ordered the small Malnati Chicago Classic, and added pepperoni.  This was a good pizza for 2 people that want to eat light or 1 person with a big appetite.  The butter crust is great, as well as the deep dish style and is something we will never have down in Texas. Food was good, service was a little crappy, since my waiter never offered to refill my drink, get me a to go box when I obviously had more pizza in my pan after asking for the check, and didn't seem to be on the same page since he was more focused on the table of 10 that came in 15 mins after me. I'd still come back if I was ever in town, but I may try another location.

Being from the east coast, I am usually biased towards New York or New Haven style, thin crust pizza.  And I've had deep dish pizza (from other parts of the country) and was not impressed.  However, after trying the deep dish pizza from Lou Malnati's, I'm a convert!!!  This was one of the best pizzas I've ever had, period!  First off, the location is ok, though I had to walk by some sketchy characters to get there.  The wait wasn't too bad, about 10-15 minutes wait.  Once seated, we quickly ordered the Chicago Classic and the Lou Lou (personal size pizzas), and a side of calamari.  All were cooked to perfection.  It was like I went to pizza heaven.  Prices were reasonable, about $9 for a personal size.  Anyway, this will be my go-to-place the next time I am in the Windy City.

Soon as we touched down in Chicago this was our first stop. Oh deep dish pizza how i have been longing for you.  We ordered a medium deep dish pizza with sausage, olives, onions, mushrooms and peppers. When the pizza arrived 35 minutes later, since it does take time to cook. The waitress cut the slices and slid the steaming hot slice onto our plates. First bit was delicious, the sausage was full of flavor and the tomatoe sauce was perfection. Trust me after one slice you are full but you cant resist so you will find yourself going in on another slice, haha. The medium pizza was perfect for 3 people, we also ordered the wings, which were finger licking good , and a few beers. What a great way to start our visit off.  Thank you for having us, your hostess was so welcoming and the waitress was phenomenal . And for anyone who visits Chicago or wants amazing pizza you have to go here, you wont regret it.
We love Lou Malnatis!  The best Chicago Pizza, and loved our server Alex. We will be back!
I was in Chicago for a few hours and had to get their deep dish sausage pie!!! I wasn't disappointed. I even ordered a medium so I could take some with me!!!

The first time I dined in here the original pizza was amazing. But I've since tried to impress friends getting it to-go and both times it wasn't good. It upset our stomachs. Too much sausage and grease. I don't remember it being like that the first time dining in. This won't be my go-to Chicago pizza place anymore sadly

Their flatbread and deep dish are probably THE BEST pizzas I have ever had.  This place is super crowded. When we went we were told it was about an hour and a half wait. We probably got seated 50min in. But it's definitely worth the wait!!! The hostesses and cashiers are all so friendly and provide all the people waiting with some free samples...yum!

They need better managers! They should help the waiters move the tables. People sitting waiting for their check, then taking forever to pick up the payment while lobby packed waiting for tables. 1 hr 1/2 wait. Pizza was good as always. Don't ever order ANY of the salads they were all nasty!! Order to take out or go somewhere else that knows how to move tables!! Poor management!! Not going back and we live in the neighborhood!!

I was recently visiting Chicago for work (from Washington, DC) and my hotel recommended I go to Lou Malnati's down the street..  The place was packed with a fairly long wait, so clearly it's a popular place.  I also spoke with friends in Chicago who said it's a very popular local chain.  I didn't know either of those things when I first went there so my review is just based on my experience. My travel colleague and I agreed that this was the worst pizza we've had in years.  To clarify, we both ordered regular (thin) pizzas and not the Chicago deep dish that I believe the place is known for.  The pizzas took about 1 hour 20 minutes to be prepared so we were excited for great food, but I swear I could have bought a frozen pizza at the 7/11 down the street that would have tasted better. The pizza was paper thin like a cracker and was difficult to bite into because it was rock hard (also somewhat burnt but not terribly).  There was very little sauce and no real flavor.  It tasted like they forgot to put salt in the dough or something because it had no flavor either.  Local friends asked me if I liked the cornmeal texture on the crust and I said that we didn't have anything like that, so maybe the restaurant forgot to add it.  That would have definitely improved the pizza for me because I'm a fan of pizzerias that do that. The interior was very interesting and had amusing decorations.  The hostess and our waitress were very friendly (front desk woman was somewhat rude, though).  We left a tip for the service but not the food quality.  Based on our experience my colleague and I would not recommend this restaurant. However, I would be open to giving it a second chance based on the high recommendation I later received from friends (they think it might have just been this location and not the chain in general).  The fact that's it's such a popular chain is a good sign, but all I can do is comment on my experience.

Incredible meal. 3 dads, 4 teenage boy visitng Chicago. 6 of the crew visiting Malnati's for the first time. Big time hit on the salad and 3 deep pan pizzas. Wow! Had leftovers for breakfast..Wow! Our favorite meal so far and we've had great Italian Beef, Chicago hot dogs, seafood and Japanese. Heading to Giordano's soon to compare, but how can they beat this pizza???!!!!!

Went here 7/18/16.  Food was great - although I'm not a local Chicago citizen, I think the pizza was pretty good.  Service on the other hand was rather odd. We had this strangest server - who seemed more interested in looking out the window than taking our order. When she finally did, she was very awkward, and seemed uninterested in serving us. Our deep dish pizzas arrived (which took 45 minutes) and she served us- she did it specifically because "the pans were dangerously hot", she said - so I stick to the memo, and asked her if I could have another - as in if she'd SERVE me another - and she just said, "yeah help yourself"!? I wasn't asking for permission, I was asking for help! Also just in case restaurant management is reading this, my table was broken - (where you turn the square table into a circular one: the expansion part of the table was dangerously wobbly)  Other than that, atmosphere was really nice - busy afternoon,  great view!

Perpetually crowded with only average pizza despite its reputation, Lou Malnati's Pizzeria may be worth a visit during an off hour, but don't go out of your way.  Yeah, Giordano's pizza is better. Really the review can be summed up with that sentence. I've settled the great Chicago (tourist) pizza debate. But before we get to that let's talk about the really long wait to get inside - it's best to come during an off hour, as this place was packed. To the restaurant's credit, they're pretty quick at seating, so we were seated in a very reasonable 45 minutes.  So of course we ordered the Chicago Classic deep dish pizza. It was only okay - the biggest problem I had was the ratio of cheese to sauce. It may be heresy to say, but there was too much cheese not enough sauce - the sauce wasn't traditional sauce but a sort of stewed tomato sauce. If you're a fan of cheesy bread you'll probably love this version of pie, but I love sauce more, and I just wasn't fan of this interpretation.  Overall, Lou Malnati's offers a pizza that some will love and others will find only average. I fell in the latter group, as I think there are better and less crowded pizza places in Chicago.
The stuffed pizza was great and so was our drinks. The calamari was just right...I truly recommend this but be prepared to wait.
Great pizza place I love there deep dish pizza and always love pizza but this is my favorite place to eat at.
Legendary, Deep dish pizza with a butter crust with sausage patty that's all I need too say ,all ways on point
Delicious deep dish pizza and I prefer thin crust. Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs so we had leftovers. Family sized salad fed six of us. Exceptionally friendly wait staff

Got the Lou and the cheese deep dish, The cheese and sauce are perfect but the crust is alright. Would definitely eat here again.  Malnati Salad is amazing and full of flavor and because I know how huge the food portions are in the US I got it in small size which was enough for 4 people.

I really enjoy this pizza. The sauce is delicious and I love the crust.  They could make the sausage not so thick though,  I pride myself in being a pizza connoisseur so believe my 4 stars. Best of Chicago!

Let me be clear about one thing: I am a New Yorker who loves NY pizza. It was my first time in Chicago and as a pizza enthusiast, I had to try deep dish pizza. So there are two top dogs for the deep dish: Lou Malnati and Giordanos. My friend in Chicago recommended going to Lou Malnati as a first timer.  My friends and I stopped by on a Monday night at around 7pm. The restaurant was spacious (with tons of seating) and lively. It was packed and the host informed us that there will be a 20 minute wait. We were told that it would be best to order the pizza while waiting since it takes half an hour to prepare. Note that you cannot order appetizers until you get a table.  What was ordered: - Combination Platter - (Breaded mushrooms, breaded cheddar cheese bites, and mozzarella sticks with marinara sauce and ranch dressing) - Classic (Lean sausage and extra cheese) - I always go for the classic or the original when I first try something. It was delicious, but very filling and heavy. - The "Lou" (Spinach, mushrooms, Roma tomatoes, Romano and cheddar cheese) - This was my favorite of the night. It felt lighter than the classic.  The pies come in different sizes: personal, small, medium, and large. We went with two small pies. I was the only person at my table who was able to finish two slices. We ended up getting the leftovers to go. Granted my friends are not big eaters, but seriously the pizza was super filling. Lastly, service was great. One thing I liked most was that our water kept on getting refilled.

Amazing. Lived up to all the hype on Yelp. Even worth the long wait. I had the Italian veggie soup which went down fast and the special Malrati Pizza and was nothing short of amazing. Fresh ingredients and the crust was just right.

Classic Lou Malnati's! Had to visit while on a business trip to Chicago last month.  The pizza was obviously delicious, cheesy, and saucy, but IMO the best part was the Malnati's salad!!! I still crave it regularly. It comes with romaine lettuce, mushrooms, olives, tomatoes, Gorgonzola, and a sweet vinaigrette, and it's so tasty!  Fast and efficient service for a restaurant that is always hopping with tourists. Can't wait to go back!

I read the reviews and got the classic deep dish but I didn't realize there was an entire layer of sausage on the whole pizza! It was too much, I can't really imagine how someone would like 1/4" of sausage on every bite. But this is the thing: even WITH that sausage that I didn't like, that pizza was amazing.  We came back again a week later because everything except the sausage was so great. This time, we got the deep dish with pepperoni and it was perfect.  This pizza is more filling than regular pizza, so be ready! Also, pro tip: the leftovers taste great if you warm them in the oven.

The waitress took awhile to get around to me but the pizza that resulted from my patience was well worth the wait!  Of all the pizzas I have had in Chicago thus far, the Classic here has been the most delicious of them all. I suspect the difference here to be the sauce.  The atmosphere was very friendly and light. A little noisy so do speak up! All in all, loved it.

Yum!! Very delish. I'm deducting a star because the management was fairly obnoxious about a left-behind credit card. And the server was just gratuitously combative about juice and rules and the like (we were told a glass of juice was refillable, it was purchased specifically for this reason and she denied this and refused the refill making everyone feel just bad for absolutely no reason whatsoever). But I liked the food a lot and would recommend it to any/all and  would happily return.

Though I will never say deep dish pizza is as good as new york style thin crust pizza, this place I will admit is pretty good. We had to wait 20 minutes in line but it was worth the wait. We kept it simple and just order the classic sausage deep dish. The pizza had a good amount of sauce and sausage. The sauce was not overbearing and had a good savory and slightly sweet taste to it. The sausage was juicy and complemented the sauce well. Though I cannot each deep dish pizza every day (or every week as a matter), would definitely come again when I have a deep dish pizza craving.

Wow oh wow!!! The atmosphere is great!! Very welcoming and laid back! The staff were friendly and professional. Alex was our waitress and she was great! I really enjoyed myself. I ordered the Malnati's Classic deep-dish pizza and it was delicious! I added pepperoni to it!! It is a must visit!!!!
I'm a tourist and I ate at Lou Malnati's!

Horrible service. Waitress never checked in to see if everything is ok. Waited 40 min (sitting at our table after ordered food) to get our pizza. Just signed up for Yelp to leave this message. Don't try this place. It sucks.

For true Chicagoans (people that actually live here and aren't just tourists visiting) this pizza is just plain awful. I decided to give it a try because I always see lots of people waiting outside, and I've heard good things. To be honest, I already have my favorite go-to pizza places around the city, but like I said, I wanted to give Lou's a shot. We come in, ask for a table for two. They say 15-20min wait (around 9:30 on a Friday night). Okay. The hostess told me that a few hours before the wait was 2+ hours for a table for two. Bless anyone's heart who actually waited two hours to try this mediocrity. Moving forward, eventually we're seated after 25 mins of waiting. Server got us drinks, everything was fine. We opted not to get any appetizers since nothing on the menu looked good. Finally, 45 minutes after we ordered it, the pizza comes. Overall, I would describe this pizza as completely bland. Literally nothing in it has an ounce of flavor. Crust, completely bland and dry, sauce not a HINT of spice/seasoning, even the cheese was just bleh. I really wanted to like this pizza, I really did. But it's honestly embarrassing that tourists come here and think this is "Chicago pizza." Trust me, there around people better pizza places in Chicago. The only good part about the pizza was that the sauce has chunks of fresh tomato in it, which I liked. Unfortunately, this still didn't give the pizza any flavor whatsoever. My and my boyfriend had to dump a ton of red pepper flakes and parmesan on top of our slices to even be able to eat it. Overall an expensive disappointment. If you're in the area (south State St.) and you're hungry, try Devil Dawgs up the block. It has great Chicago style dogs, excellent burgers, and great friend chicken. Skip Lou's. It's not worth the price and it's certainly not worth the wait.

We did the typical search that tourists do. We asked Yelp for the best Chicago Style pizza. Lou's was the closest and best rated at the time. We had the Lou's classic and went for the pizza chips with several different dips to get us started. Plan on a thirty minute wait for the pizza but worth every minute.

Order the Lou pizza, which won't disappoint!!! Also tried the Classic Chicago (took off the sausage) and it was ok, my friend had it with the sausage and thought it tasted like a lasagne. If I come back, whenever I do, I'm ordering the Lou & the cookie dessert!!!  I got a dessert voucher from the Blake Hotel and I'm sooo happy I asked for their referral to the best pizza joint. The cookie dessert is fantastic.:)

I placed a catering order in on Tuesday to have delivered to my office on Thursday between 11:30-12:00pm. I explained as I placed the order that I'm located at suite 800, and the delivery man will need to go up to the 8th floor. I felt I made myself clear in the matter but was absolutely wrong. Day of the deliver, I did not receive my order until 30 mins after the stated delivery time. If this were for a single person that'd be fine, but it was a thank you gesture for co-workers who helped out with a huge sales initiative. I called Lou Malnati's twice for an explanation, the first time Latoya said that her manage "threw in something extra" to make up for it being late. I had to hold for about 5 mins before she was able to tell me that. She did not ask for my number to look up my order, she mistaken it for an order placed from the 18th floor of the same building, she said that it'd be there in 2 mins. I communicated to everyone that it would be here within 2 mins but 5 mins later I had to call again. They looked up my order and realized their confusion...so no we did NOT get anything extra. My pizza total was $113 you'd expect better service, especially since they had two 1/2 days to prepare. Once the delivery man arrived he continued to place the blame on the cooks that they didn't have the pizza's ready in time and its not his fault that it was late. And that his manager told him to go to the 18th floor first and not deliver mine on time. Just unprofessional! I love Lou's its my favorite Chicago's deep dish pizza, this location is definitely giving it a bad name! I'd recommend going to a different location, don't waste your time.

The pizza here dominates.  I absolutely love pizza.  I do not care what kind it is. We ordered the classic deep dish small size and it was enough to feed two people very well. The personal size is not enough to feed two people and I think in most cases not enough for one.  You will always be left wanting more. I had a great experience and it was my first time having Chicago style pizza. I would recommend that you place your order for pizza while you wait because there will be a wait but this way your pizza does not take so long when you finally sit down. They are cooked to order!!!! My friends who have lived in Chicago recommend Lou Malnati's because it is simply the best in town. Cannot wait to head back to Chicago for a second round.
A pretty good example of Chicago pizza. The sausage was very tasty and I enjoyed the flavor of the sauce. Service was efficient and we had a nice lunch there.

The place was too busy, packed environment and overwhelmed staff. Our server got the pizzas wrong and forgot my kid's pizza and said I never ordered it. She tried to correct me even though my party heard me ask for a simple individual size pizza. She went to the manager and she came back apologizing. One pizza was credited but still it was a long way for food we didn't even want. The bottom of the crust was super hard and the cheese was barely there. The overpowering garlic flavor made the pizza unappetizing.

Friendly wait staff and good service. But it seems they need to spend more time creating a tasty gluten free crust; it was hard and mealy, with no flavor. The sauce was tasty, though, and the cheese too.
Great food. Fabulous service. Interesting decor. Reasonable prices. Don't come here if you're trying to stick to a diet!

I know that I'm in the minority, but I really didn't think it was anything special. The wait time for a small personal pizza is well above 40 mins, which would be fine but the pizza that follows isn't worth waiting that long for. The deep dish crust was very bland and overall I just wasn't impressed especially for the wait time and the price.

Lou Malnati's was my favorite food stop of my Chicago trip. I enjoyed their pie far more than the other deep dish pies I tried while in town--and I tried quite a few. I really enjoyed their cookie pie, as well.

We arrived about 9PM with no wait. Service was friendly and on the ball. We had excellent calamari while waiting for our Malnati Chicago Classic to arrive. The pizza was well worth it, less grease and more flavor than the other deep dish competitors. You could taste all the ingredients in the pizza.  You got to try it.
I calculated after the fact that I consumed 2,010 calories in polishing off three slices of the medium classic. Oh well.

Deep dish pizza was delicious! Ate a small sausage and house salad. I had a late dinner after traveling to town for work so I didn't have lunch. Otherwise I would have been okay with a personal size and the salad.

This place is the definition of Chicago style deep dish pizza!!! Hard to avoid long lines but this place is definitely worth the wait. From the dough to the cheese to the sausage to the tomato sauce even all the way to their buffalo wings. I give them 5 stars! Our waiter (forgot his name) took great care of us and made sure we got everything we needed for our lunch. We sat on the second floor overlooking state st. Make sure to order your pizza as soon as you arrive!!!

Was in town last week with 4 colleagues to work a trade show, and the legendary Malnati's was our agreed upon first nights dinner. Added bonus was that this location was just a couple of blocks from the Hilton Chicago where we were housed for the week.  I have been in Chicago several times, and of course dined on pizza each time. I believe this was my first time trying LMP however. We kept it simple with just sausage, black olives and green peppers. All ingredients were garden (and animal) fresh, and that crust, oh lord, was perfectly baked with that signature deep dish flaky crust. Excellent!  Service was excellent as well, with our waitress a constant presence offering to reorder drinks for our boozy party. We also shared their family size Malnati Salad dressed with their house made Sweet Vinaigrette. It is so delicious that they offer bottles to go, and I should have grabbed a couple. Wine by the glass choices were limited, but I enjoyed my glasses of pinot.  As luck would have it I had a visit scheduled the next day with one of our business partners, and yep, Malnati's again for lunch! Not a problem with my coworker and I. See, even a favorite of life long locals.  I have to say that my local Chicago Pizza standby here in SoCal measures up very closely with this Chicago institution. And that is Tony's Little Italy Pizza in Placentia:  yelp.com/biz/tonys-littl…   Very comforting to know that I can just drive up the 57 freeway to get my genuine Chicago Deep Dish fix right here in OC.

Great experience, got their signature Chicago style personal pizza "The Lou". Cost me just over $10. Took about half an hour and the place was pretty busy. The pizza was fantastic and not soggy in any way. Both the crust and the cheese really popped. Defiantly recommended!

Wanted to take my son to a Chicago pizza place for his 1st visit to the city. Someone recommended that we come here above other well known pizza places in town.  Food was excellent but service was a little slow and impersonal.  Waited forever for drink refills.  Asked for boxes for our leftovers and that took forever also.  He only brought a pizza box when we had salad and appetizer leftovers but, I didn't want to wait any longer so I just took pizza to go.  Highly recommend the spinach bread appetizer though!

The service was a little lackluster and slow, but other than that, the pizza was tasty. Go ahead of the time you actually want to eat, because you have to wait for a table, then you have to wait on your pie.  Definitely eat here in Chicago, though!
Not the fanciest place I've ever been to and I'm not a deep dish pizza authority, but it was tasty!

This pizza is so fresh and delicious! It's made to order so takes a good 20-30 minutes but it's well worth it! You can call ahead and if they're not in a wait you came sit and be served once it's ready. They also have take out. Full beer and wine menu too. Relaxed atmosphere that's kept clean.

They got the best pizza and customer service ever. The waiting was kinda long (30-45minutes) but they did tell us ahead of time about the it. They gave out free samples while we're outside waiting so time really flew fast for us. Since we were just visiting Chicago, we have no sitter and had to bring our well behaved kids everywhere with us. We have a 3 year old and a 16 month old when we went there... The waiters/waitresses accommodated us and made us feel welcome even though it was so crowded and we have this huge stroller (for 2 kids). They gave our little boys crayons and drawing sheets... The apps and pizza were served fast, they gave us our soft drinks and water while waiting for the apps. They were so full and busy, but still managed to give the best customer service. I noticed so much people are ordering pizza for take out (thats probably why it was crowded in the entrance). We ordered so much that we had to have a whole pizza boxed, we ate it in our hotel room a day after and it was still really good.  Cant wait to come back...

This was incredible pizza and the spinach salad was also very good - I also liked that when it is busy and you have to wait for your table that they let you pre-order your pizza so it's ready right when you get your table! Smart thinking!

Finally!!! Delish deep dish Chicago pizza!!! I tried the "other" popular pizza place, but I was so disappointed. I'm so happy I got to enjoy this Chicago pizza before flying back home! Pleasantly surprised with the great customer service! Very welcoming and attentive!...Tabitha was lovely!!

I'm from out of state- east coast- and I've never been to Chicago before. This was some great pizza. I don't know if I can really call it pizza, its so different from what I was used to. But it was flavorful, filling and delicious, and it took no time at all. We found it on Yelp within our distance and it was fairly highly rated and seemed to frequented. I'd definitely suggest this.

I'm allergic to dairy, but I still wanted to try deep dish pizza in Chicago. Was vegan or dairy-free pizza even possible? Thankfully, my server at Lou Malnati's yesterday had no problem suggesting a few different courses of action. I could get a thin-crust pizza without cheese, or the "Lou" (vegetable pizza) personal pizza without cheese and without a garlic butter crust. I ended up having the latter and it was definitely hit the spot. It takes about 30-45 minutes to get your pizza once you have sat down and ordered, so don't think you can squeeze this stop in 2 hours before your flight. Instead, I would recommend it as a leisurely option after the Chicago Art Museum (a quick walk away). The decor is nothing fancy-think of your neighborhood pizza joint-but it doesn't need to be. Overall, I was really impressed by the service and selection, and I would definitely come back.

This is barely a 3 for me.  Over-hyped.  I think that I could fall for Chicago style pizza, I just haven't met/eaten the right one yet:)  We ordered the pepperoni, lou's, and the classic.  I liked the Lou's the most, but...meh.  The crust was not flaky like other yelpers mentioned.  It was harder and not all there flavor wise.  I'm a crust person, and this didn't do it for me.   One thing is the pizza size is generous, so order accordingly.  Table of 5 women, a man, and a child and since there were a couple of salads and a pasta before the pizza, we could only handle a medium and a large.

Best Deep Dish pizza in town! Chicago natives might not eat this but as a tourist it hits the spot! I try to stop by everytime I visit! The crust is buttery and crisp and the cheese and sauce melt in your mouth! Best pizza in the world!

Very yummy! I hadn't eaten all day and visiting from out of town, felt disappointed at not having a taste of Chicago's finest. My driver recommended this spot as the best. I prefer thin crust and Lou's pizza was just the right touch! I'd ordered half sausage half pep/spinach. The sausages were fabulous, I'm a sucker for good juicy sausages. The pizza was warm, the sauce was mouth watering and those sausages  I'm only envious of the locals with that goodness nearby!

I couldn't leave Chicago without having some deep dish pizza #donttellmytrainer #cheatday). So I, of course, went to trustworthy Yelp to find the option closest to me. Luckily, Lou Malnati's was a short walk away - so off I went. I was quickly greeted and seated. The waiter came by, took my order, and it took 15 minutes for him to come by with my beer and about 35 minutes later my personal-sized deep dish pizza arrived. Usually, I don't mine slower service, but I was on a bit of a time crunch, having to get to O'Hare (with their lovely magnificent mile long TSA lines #seewhatIdidthere). The service was slow, the pizza was warm (not hot), the crust was overly dry, and the cheese wasn't melty. I feel like my order sat out for a bit before it was served. That being said, the flavors of the pizza were great and all the normal sized (not personal-sized) pies looked incredible. I will be back when I have a bit more time to spare and order a bigger pie.

Lou's is such a staple when you visit Chicago. Not going here & trying their Deep Dish would be like, not visiting the Eiffel Tower in Paris. This city is all about Deep Dish Pizza & Lou's has been a huge player in the Chicago Pizza scene since 1971. Staying true to their original recipe, Lou's is the perfect place for both locals & travellers to get their pizza fix.  I visited Lou's on a work overnight from Sydney on the recommendation of a Chicago native. I wanted to know the best place to try Deep Dish & I absolutely wanted to know where the locals went for it.  Hearing this, my friend & I walked down to the South Loop branch & after some server contemplation, ordered the Sausage Deep Dish. This pizza was awesome! Yummy, cheesy & delicious. I can't recommend Lou's enough if this is your only opportunity to try Deep Dish in Chicago.

Wow! I am visiting Chicago and I wanted to try the famous deep dish. I was referred this place by a cousin who is a local in Chicago. I loved my experience at Lou's. We had the Lou's toppings on our deep dish, three cheese bread, calamari, tiramisu and garlic bread. Everything was amazing. The deep dish pizza was delicious. The calamari tasted fresh enough. The tiramisu was in my opinion the best part of the meal.  Service was great and understanding too. They entertain requests for vegetarian versions of dishes that contain meat according to their menu, which is a massive plus for the restaurant. All in all, there is nothing wrong with this Chicago chain. 5 stars for a five star place.
Good pizza! Not to long of a wait at all.. And you can even pre Order your pizza.. Very good place to eat!

Lou pizza, spinach and mushroom which were mostly absent. We also added poultry sausage to our pizza. I found just three pieces. When it came to the pizza I was very disappointed in this place. The service on the other hand was excellent. From the hostess greeting us and encouraging us to order our pizza first so it will be ready when our table was ready to our waitress who was friendly and came by to ask if we were doing fine twice.

We are visiting from Arizona and our son recommended this restaurant for good pizza. He badly understated this place. I am a pizza snob, and haven't enjoyed a pizza in many years. The pizza here is among the very best I have ever eaten. Outstanding sauce, fresh, high quality toppings on a perfectly prepared thick crust made this dining experience memorable. I look forward to returning to try their other offerings.

As a first timer to the Chicago area, I always knew that I had to check out Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. Everyone from Illinois raves about their pizzas, and they are certainly right to do so. While pricey (a small, personal pizza runs almost $17), the quality of both food and service can't be beat. I highly recommend it, even if you're nowhere close to your nearest location. Beer and wine only, however, and limited parking since it's right downtown on State Street.
First ever deep dish pizza in Chicago. Must go place. Reputation, service, taste and price, none of then are bad to me. Highly recommended check it out if you never had it before.
It was a good pizza if you're into the deep dish style. We ended up with a medium for two people and could barely finish half. They are super thick slices.

Visiting from out of town and while staying at the Congress Hotel was looking for a good pizza on-line. I took the eighth minute walk to this place and wow!!! Probably the best Chicago-style deep dish pizza I've ever had in my life.. Friendly staff and amazing food..

Absolutely amazing!!!  Never had Chicago deep dish pizza...and had heard Lou Malnati's was one of the best.  They we're RIGHT!  The pizza was piping hot, had just the right amount of garlic in the sauce, the cheese was very stringy, and the crust with buttery and crisp.  Outstanding!!!

For my first visit to Chicago, I had to seek out a Chicago pizzeria experience. Lou's is walking distance from my hotel and I have to say it was delicious. I started with house salad that came chopped and tossed and could have fed two easily.  I followed that up with a small Mammals Deep dish with added mushrooms.  I was not disappointed with a tangy sweet sauce with sausage and thick cut mushrooms on a bed of melted cheesy goodness.  And the crust was perfect. Take advantage of ordering while you wait to shorten your wait for the food.

I loved it!  The pizza was totally delicious, even though the wait was incredibly long.  This is your basic tourist trap in Chicago, but again, serves on the promise of yummy deep dish pizza.  They allow you to order your pizza while you wait, so when you sit down to eat, the pizza is on its way to your table within 15-20 minutes.  We ordered "The Lou" which was surprisingly light (or as light as a deep dish pizza gets). It comes with a garlic butter crust- no complaints here!  Check this place out if you're in the mood for ooey gooey pizza.

Oy. I really wanted to like this place, I did. Another recommendation from a friend, which turned out poorly. We only had time enough to try one deep dish pizza place and Lou's won. I wish it hadn't. Perhaps I don't like deep dish. I've never actually had it as I'm not a huge fan of all the crust. But, when in Chicago... The pizza was really bland. All you could taste was cardboard crust. Sorry we wasted our time here.
This is MY place for meatball sandwiches! I've eaten there since the 80s. I've never eaten a bad meal. I eat at the one on Grand and Wells but it's good to know there's one in the south Loop.

Ordered the "Malnati Chicago classic pizza", small size and added giardiniera. I am a pizza lover and I was disappointed. First time eating deep dish in Chicago. Overall it tasted ok. Not the best.  Didn't like: That it has celery and carrots.  Very messy to eat. The sauce was eh, ok Liked: The Crust - It was crunchy The cheesiness I'll take Gino's deep dish pizza anyday. Customer service was good and wait time for a table took some time.

This pizzeria is amazing!  It is quite a walk from where I ended up parking, which was all the way at Lake Shore, next to the Navy Pier.   Siri ended taking me around and around probably because I was deep in the heart of downtown... not sure.   Once I found this place, I was relieved as we were seated immediately and our order was placed within minutes. The place has old pictures of icons and family members.  The restaurant is large enough to hold at least 200 people, I believe. The AC was on full blast and place smelled amazing.  We ordered a delicious salad which we finished.  My family couldn't decide on what pizza to order so we ordered both the sausage and pepperoni pizza - best decision ever, as we had more pizza left over for our flight back home.  Our sever was excellent, prompt and courteous.   Note: Walking down to State Street could be a bit nerve wrecking as there are a few sketchy people sitting out near by.  I suggest visiting during the day time.

I have never experienced such a rude service:  (1) they didn't want to seat us until at least 50% of the group had arrived (even if it takes 30-45 min to have the pizza); only insisting that we would order right away and that we actually were already 50% they gave us a seat; (2) they were just unpolite the whole time and on a rush (probably knowing that anyway the tip was included, being a group of 6+ people); (3) they brought the bill when actually an additional friend had just arrived and needed to order something more; (4) they were taking the bill and money without making sure that we had payed all (and in fact somebody was still missing). The deep dish was pretty good as usual (the only reason why it is not a 1 star), but frankly it is not much different than other deep dish pizzas. We were treated even worse when we decided to join other friends at their table, since anyway it was late and the restaurant was half empty. It was clear that they expected us to order something anyway and treated us pretty badly. There are many other deep dish pizza restaurants.  I used to like maybe this a bit better.  Now I would avoid it.

I've never had deep dish pizza before, but this restaurant not only introduced it to me, but also made me fall in love with it. The deep dish pizza here is not filled with grease and has a nice distinct flavor and crunch. In my opinion, the lunch special is one of the best deals because you get a fountain drink, soup or salad, and a personal sized deep dish pizza all for under $10. I would definitely recommend this place if you want some legendary deep dish pizza at an unbeatable value!

My friends came to u.s. for work last week and I brought them here expected to have a real Chicago dinner. But the waitress was very impolite. First of all, she was impatient with us all the time( we didn't take much time to order because we have decided when getting the line, and we haven't requested anything during the dinner. Don't know why she was so impatient. Maybe it's our Asian face and she has experienced Asian customers who don't pay enough tips?) And before we finished, she asked whether we are done, my friend didn't understand at that moment and smiled at the waitress ( not because my friend's English was bad, but it's really noise at the restaurant). And then the waitress just took away their plate. I said for my friend that she was not finished. And the waitress again unpleasantly gave back to plate. I've been a huge supporter for Lou all the time. I alway go to Lou at near north near my apt. This is my first time to go to Lou at south loop. And I won't go there again.

Our second time in Chicago eating pizza.  Lou Maltani's was recommended by some Local folks. We had "The Lou" with buttercrust.  It was excellent.  Service was great, our waitress was very good, nice atmosphere, good location.   We are from out of state, really enjoyed this visit.

While in Chicago ...we had to try the pizza of course! I must say the sauce on this pizza was really tasty. The calamari was cooked perfectly and the wings were delicious. We are returning to Chicago in September. This will be our first stop :_)

Well I was disappointed. Staff was very nice!! Host, waiter and bidders were extremely respectful and pleasant. The one star is for them and the best salad of my life!! The Malanati salad is to die for. Then we got individual pizzas, 3 of them so we could try different things, and they were underwelming. They were small which is expected but deep dish I would not call it. After sharing a friend pulled a hair out of his and my stomach dropped. With that being said I needed to go to the bathroom and a one bathroom stall was just uncomfortable. Even if you have two people in the bathroom there's no room to wait to use it or if someone opens the door your going to be hit. And when someone is throwing up its extremely weird! LOL. I recommend Chicago pizza oven grinder or Giordianos. Those are traditional Chicago pizza and worth the money.  So update on review. I gave my number to the manager and he called back. He was very understanding and refunded our dinner, which was not necessary. Obviously things happen and being a server I understand how resteraunt a work. No one can do anything about the bathroom situation. Just because of service and management I will try again!

Amazing pizza. Perfect balance of fresh ingredients, cheesey goodness, and crunchy crust. This was the 3rd pizza place I tried during my week in Chicago and it was a close winner, just above Giordano. No beer on tap though.. I have it broken down like this: Lou Malnati - Perfect balance of cheese, ingredients, crust. Giordano - Intensely cheesey. Essentially a cheese pie with ingredients baked into it. Pequad - Intensely bread heavy. More crust than cheese/ingredients.
Delicious and authentic deep dish. Not too greasy and perfect for big groups. The classic is my favorite!  They don't take reservations and you'll probably have to wait around 20-30 min for a table.

While this wasn't the oh-my-god experience I was hoping for, Lou Malnati's certainly did the trick. My fiance had not been to Chicago before and we were looking for the best deep dish pizza we could find. We've had Giordano's in Indy which is good, but we wanted better. We think we found it at Lou Malnati's. The dough, cheese and sauce all tasted a bit fresher here. They have a good system where you can order your pizza when you get on the wait list for a table, so we got in and out in record time - less than an hour. Service was friendly. They have a modest beer and wine list (no fancy craft beers here) but I got what I wanted - a glass of chianti. Prices also seemed very reasonable for the tourist appeal (Chicago Style pizza right off N. Michigan) and the flavor - our medium pepperoni was about $18.00.

Got the personal Lou's deep dish and I thought it was good but not great. I had higher expectations and was kind of disappointed. However, I would recommend coming for the lunch special which makes it a bit worth it.

Malnati's is definitely my favorite of the Chicago deep dish "chains", and while I'd been to other locations before, this was my first time at this particular Malnati's. Please note that my four-star review is for the food and the food alone; if I could give the location and service a separate review, it would be more like 2.5 or *maybe* 3 stars. As other reviewers have noted, you put your name in with the host and then place your order at a separate counter, so that you are waiting for your food (the deep dish pizzas take quite a while to cook) while you're waiting for your table. Of course the pizza (we just got the cheese, but of course with the buttercrust!) was perfect, and I also suggest the Stuffed Spinach Bread as an appetizer. Again, my main issues are with this particular location - first, because the entryway is VERY narrow, which makes for a crowded and confusing experience when trying to approach the host and then move on to order your pizza. Additionally, once we had our food it was like our table didn't exist at all, and we eventually even had to flag down another server to get our check. I understand that they were busy but seriously, we didn't see our server once after she brought out our pizza. Also, I don't know if it was just that day or what, but the music in the bathroom on our side of the restaurant was so loud that I actually had to cover my ears when I went in there. It was the same music playing out in the restaurant, but at a seriously noxious level. So yeah, go here for the pizza, not for the atmosphere or the service. I will say that my best Malnati's experience was at their Naperville location, and leave it at that :)
Pizza was delicious. Now remember that I am a Former New Yorker who takes his pizza very serious!!

Not being from Chicago, the first couple generic things you hear is the city being very windy and their deep dish pizza is bomb. A few of the natives mentioned that Lou Malnati's was definitely the best in town. Skip Giordano's and come here. So that's exactly what I did.  But, I didn't have enough time to sit and eat so I took a whole pie with me back to San Francisco and enjoyed it with my boyfriend. I ordered the Lou which was the vegetarian option. We threw it in the oven just to heat it up a bit and voila! The pizza was delicious. Definitely different from the deep dish pizzas we've ever tried. That garlic buttery crust was so good! I can't wait to come back to the windy city to try this fresh out of the oven!

First time trying out deep dish pizza. It was just okay for me. The crust was HARD. Its buttery but yet too hard for me to chew though. The Lou's filling was good. I loved it. Cheesy and the vegetables portion are just perfect. We had combination platter for appetizer which had cheddar cube, mozzarella stick, fried eggplant and fried mushroom with ranch and marinara sauce. Sauces were great. The best of all was the fried mushroom. We topped of our dinner with chocolate chip pizza. Ice cream fantastic. The cookie dough was SWEET. I will come back next time to try their thin crust.

Worse location of Lou I have ever been. The service was AWFUL ( the waitress - blond short hair- was just rude rude rude, loud and impolite) and the manager rolled her eyes of us, just because, after having consumed, some friends joined our table. I don't think I will recommend or come to this place again.

Did not want the pizza but we had the meatball and beef sandwiches.  They were super good and each comes with curly fries that are seasoned. Highly recommended when you are in downtown area. Easy walk from our hotel on the south side of downtown.
Excellent service, great staff, great food/ drinks, and wonderful decor/atmosphere! Next time we visit Chicago, we'll be visiting Lou Malnati's again

Food was great, staff were wonderful. There was a bit of a wait, but it wasn't bad at all because you could order and have them start preparing it right away. Very nice atmosphere and a convenient location to the parks!!

This is my first exposure to (authentic) Chicago-style deep dish pizza. I say authentic because there was a place called Pizza Chicago in California we went to often but after having this, I realized it's nothing like the real thing. We got a Malnati Chicago Classic and a Malnati Salad. The Buttercrust is very distinctive - it has a hard crunch from the cornmeal used at the bottom, almost like deep-fried Chinese mantou. The entire thick crust was flavorful - the Pizza Chicago in California was basically just bread, but here the fragrance of the butter on the bottom really helped accentuate the flavor of the center, which is one of the hardest parts of a pizza to get right. The toppings were all excellent - compared to good NYC places I would say their taste is more hearty but less refined. The salad was very good but it's just a standard salad so I don't have much to say about it. Because of how filling deep-dish pizza is, you can only eat so many slices before you're full so it's a great deal.

Coming from New York, it's hard to beat New York's thin crust pizza. However, when in Chicago, you must try the deep dish pizza.  We arrived at Lou Malnati at around 7:40 pm on a Wednesday and were quoted a 10 minute wait. Not bad given its a restaurant for tourists in a tourist location. The best part was that the hostess informed us that if we were ordering deep dish pizza, to place our deep dish order in advance because it takes 30 minutes to cook. Music to my ears because we were waiting for our table and our food at the same time! They also text you when you've been placed on their wait list and then text you again when your table is ready. New York can take some notes there!  Once seated, we also ordered the trio of dips with pizza chips. The three dips consisted of garlic, artichoke and cheese, and hummus. Of the three, I liked the hummus the most. The artichoke and cheese was okay as it was a bit too cheesy; I didn't enjoy the garlic spread, but my friends enjoyed the garlic one the best. The pizza chips weren't really pizza chips in my opinion as I thought they were just toasted flatbread with tomatoes on top.  Then the deep dish pizza arrived. We were extremely disappointed because it didn't look like a deep dish pizza. It wasn't thick as we expected; it just looked like a sad drooping pie. The taste lived up to its looks as it just tasted like dough and huge globs of cheese. Where's all the tomato sauce and pepperoni ?! Of the 6 slices, I think we only had like 10 slices of pepperoni at most. The crust was also too hard as well. Unfortunately, none of us finished our 2 slices nor did we want to take the leftovers of the pizza and appetizer home. However, at least now we can say we had deep dish pizza in Chicago!

I found myself spending an extra day in Chicago due to a canceled flight. Since Chicago deep dish pizza is one of my favorite types of pizza i went searching. I asked locals as well as servers in pubs where the BEST deep dish pizza was, in Chicago. One restaurant kept coming up either first or second.  Lou Milnati's.  I set out  and 8 blocks later I was inside.   At first I was underwhelmed. It seemed boring.  Not at all like a pub.  No bar. However,  the staff,  and relaxed atmosphere helped me warm to the place.  There are TVs and beer.  The beer menu is relatively small, but has a fantastic variety of diverse  local and national craft brews.   But the food,,, I ordered wings and a single serving deep dish Chicago pizza.  The wings came out quickly with plenty of celery and Gorgonzola cheese/dressing.  Great little improvement from ordinary Bleu cheese!   The pizza was unassuming.   That is until I bit into a piece.  The sausage was no run of the mill bland sausage.   The flavor popped out.  Then, the cheese. Lots of it and thick like a cheese stick.  The sauce was just right.   Not too watery, or too thick.   Not too much garlic, ,,,you get the point.   But, the whole pizza was completed by the Buttercrust.  It is fantastic.  All I can say is that I wish I lived nearby.

The quality is no doubt there, especially regarding the crust. It was definition of perfection but the make-up of the pie itself was still just a little behind giordanos . Overall though, I still give the edge to LM.  I will be back MANY times. Start a tab for me, mates ;)

I may be a taste snob here but I absolutely 100% prefer Giordano's to Lou's. My large pizza came undercooked in the middle and I'm just not a fan of the sauce. This place may tickle your fancy if you're into a traditionally less sweet more natural tomato sauce taste.  The establishment itself is clean and the staff is friendly. Price is pretty up there.

We decided to spend our last night in Chi-town at Lou Malnati's and wish we had gone to Giordano's instead. We had high expectations for Lou Malnati's after reading all the reviews, but sadly it disappointed.  Our salad was way overdressed and the pizza was lacking in flavor and depth. The only redeeming quality was the crispy crust.  Service was abrupt, and they were removing our plates before we were even finished! We get the lines of people outside, but that's no way to rush out your paying customers.
Very disappointed with their deep dish pizzas. Too salty. BJs La lot better. Try their salads. They are pretty good.

Have always heard good things and reviews here sounded solid. I cannot tell you the level of huge disappointment we experienced. We ordered our drinks, 2 appetizers, a salad and entree all at the same time. Drinks and cheese curds came out quickly. Curds were cooked far too long in old grease and we didn't even eat half of them. Then the salad came out. It was delicious and the only highlight of the meal. We waited and waited on the wings and when they finally came, they were barely warm and had way too much sauce. The pizza eventually came and it looked terrible. We ordered the classic, which is sausage and Roma tomatoes. The flavorless crust had a thick layer of cheese and then it seemed a solid layer of a sausage patty covered with Roma tomatoes. None of it had flavor, it was way too much cheese, and very unimpressive. And the worst part is the waiter noticed we didn't eat the curds or hardly any pizza and never said a word. Never go back.
Bobby the server was the best super informative; from pizza to beer to history. Pizza was fenaminal though service always makes the place.

Terrible pizza.  The worst ever.  Won't add pictures not worth it.  Dough was so plain and sauce had no flavor.  By far the worst pizza ever.  Wing came out cold, service could be much much better.  Will not come again.
Great atmosphere! Pizza was BOMB! Service at table could have been improved. The ordering system was fantastic! Definitely would recommend this restaurant!!!

This review is for delivery to my office in Willis Tower.  Everything went very, very well.  I asked for an 11:00am delivery.  They said they have a 30 minute window so it could arrive between 11 and 11:30am.  That was fine.  The delivery man was there at exactly 11:00am. The half sausage and half spinach large pizza was delicious, as expected.   The only reason I deducted one point is because I wanted to order on line but one of the last pieces of information you enter is the time of delivery.  There is a drop down box that you must choose a time from.  The drop down box times started at 4:00pm and ended at 11:00pm so there was no way for me to order a lunch time pizza online. This was confusing because the website said delivery times were 11:00am - 11:00pm.Yet I can only specify a 4pm or later delivery for an online order?? I called the store at 10:00am and ordered over the phone.  All was well. Lou Malnati's is my most favorite pizza EVER!

Eh.... Visiting from out of town we were excited to try some well reviewed deep dish. We got the Lou Malnati which has extra cheese and the buttery crust.  I'm sure the locals love it but I found the crust too buttery/fatty and the extra cheese overpowered the sauce.  If you're a tourist and want a deep dish pizza and come here, go more traditional and let me know how it turns out.

Calamari ordered very awesome taste Enjoyed the tomato cocktail sauce had a great taste. Ordered 3 different small deep dish pizza  The clasico The Lou And a pepperoni deep dish  the clasico was my best choice the amount of cheese and sausage was perfect.
