Lou Malnati's Deep Dish Pizza has always been my favorite and the pizza my friend and I enjoyed on Wednesday, April 30th at the 805 S. State location was no exception. It was fantastic and so was the service and ambience I have found here and at all the Malnati's locations I have visited. Mary, our server, was magnificent. She was cordial from the moment we sat down until when we left. She came back often to ask us how everything was and if we needed anything else.  I look forward to my next visit which will be very soon! Matt H.

Best chain for all deep dish pizza.  Moved to Chicago recently from the east coast so I'm used to the thin crusts but my eyes were opened to the world of deep dish with my first bite.  Always hearty and always satisfied.  I usually go simple with just a plain pepperoni but it's just so damn good...

Several people recommended Lou Malnati and we saw a little feature of the pizza from this restaurant in a tv show, so my friend and I decided to give it a try. We went there on a Sunday afternoon after going to the Shedd Aquarium. We were seated at Table 32 right away but the shade that was on the window didn't help much. My friend had the seat with the sunshine shining directly towards her direction, it was very uncomfortable. The sunshine was shining on my back but I didn't mind it. Our waitress was Kaitlyn, that's the name that was listed on our check. Her service was very slow. She barely came by to check up on us. I asked her for recommendations but she seemed impatient and asked, "For what?" I said, "Well, any of the foods." She recommended the classic deep dish pizza, nothing else. We ordered two personal pizzas: The Lou and The Classic, and a House Salad with red vinaigrette dressing. The salad arrived very fast. The pizzas took a while. The waitress didn't inform us about the 30+ minutes wait for the pizzas until much later. I observed the other customers and some of the staff. The manager with glasses (he's in one of my pictures) was very friendly and helpful. I felt that he was the hardest working person there. He helped buss tables, asked customers if they needed anything, delivered dishes, and more. Yes, he's the manager and managers are expected to help when the staff is busy, but I felt like the waitress was supposedly to be doing some of the things he was doing. I saw her pacing around at some point, but maybe I am wrong, maybe she was pacing to go do something. Either way, her service was extremely slow and she didn't seem interested. The salad was good sized and the red vinaigrette dressing went well with the veggies. It was sweet but not too sweet. The veggies seemed fresh. The Lou pizza was both my friend's and my favorite compared to the Classic. We liked the mushrooms and the veggies. However, we both agreed that the deep dish pizza from Pizzaria Uno/Due is still the best.

Delicious, delicious, hmmm delicious!!! Was recommended THIS pizza spot from several locals over the other competitors. You will not be disappointed. We ordered the calamari since the deep dish pizza is a 30 minute wait and it was yummy! We ordered the traditional Malnati Chicago Classic (*drooling*). The crust is by far one of the best I've had!
Best deep dish in town! Not as filling as other places. I didn't feel bogged down by a heavy, cheesy meal. Wish we had this here in Detroit! I highly recommend a stop here when you visit Chicago!
Not a fan of deep dish but I can rock with some Lou malnatis butter crust cheese pie, crust was crispy, sauce was tasty, I was happy

Hater here. What is the number 1 touristy thing to do when in Chicago? That's right, try Deep Dish Pizza at Lou Malnati's. Ok, I can check that one off my bucket list and move on to much better experiences. The place is very chaotic. Mostly due to the fact that this is the place to visit for every tourist in Chicago. So yeah, you can imagine the chaos. The pizza itself is very mediocre. The dough is just a regular pizza dough, the marinara sauce is a mass-produced-mass-processed-nothing-special-marinara sauce, the side salad is fresh, yet comes with another unmemorable cheap salad dressing.

OMG. Genuinely the best pizza joint I've ever been to. First of all: I have an anti-anti dairy allergy, meaning I can't eat something unless it contains some form of dairy--milk, cheese, yogurt, chocolate milk, chocolate cheese--you get it . . . This being a deep-dish pizza establishment, there are MANY menu items that are VERY accommodating to my disorder. Chicago Classics with cascading mountains of mozzarella cheese, super-savory toasted cheddar cubes, melt-in-yo-mouth mozzarella cheese sticks. MY-O-MY, I had a feast. All in all, this is the place to go if you love some cheesy goodness. If you don't love cheese the way I do and still decide to come here, simply request a pizza without the stuff or be on your merry way (there's a Devil Dawgs right around the corner, and the Clucker is the best chicken sandwich on this side of the Mississippi, *****).  Can't wait til I hear, "Welcome to Lou Malnati's in the South Loop" again!!!!!! PS - My Grandma Misuraca swooned over our waiter -- if I remember correctly, his name is Bobby. PPS - My Grandma Misuraca actually died Dec. 2014, but I feel she would've truly been charmed by Bobby. The guy is a class act.
Got a recommendation to have the classic, was awesome. Cheesy and great crust! Best part of the night, our server actually fished out the pizza. Not just piece one but piece 2! Was worth the trip.

Looking for that traditional Chicago deep dish pizza? Look no more! Ordered a medium deep pepperoni for two people which allowed 3 large slices per person. Since they take 30 mins to bake, we also ordered a wing appetizer. The wings had amazing flavor and kick to them! When the pizza came we couldn't wait to dive in. Fluffy, tasty, and oozing with cheese and sauce. Loved every bite. This restaurant only serves a small selection of beer and wine.

We revisited Lou's because we really enjoyed it when we tried it a couple of yeas ago. Unfortunately our second visit was nothing like the first. We went on a Friday night and were quoted a 45 minute wait and ended up waiting for an hour. They have an app that lets you see your place in line but it's deceiving because we were "next" for 15 mins or so before we got a table. They let you preorder your pizza so that it cuts down on the wait time for the pizza to come out. Great in theory but in reality it only cuts down your wait by 5-10 mins because they don't place the order till you sit down.  We finally got our pizza an hour and a half after we got there and it was undercooked. The dough was not done. Our server tried to reassure us that it was still safe to eat because there are no eggs in the dough. But who would want to eat raw dough?!! They put it back in the oven and it was burnt when they brought it back out. Only later did we discover a short HAIR baked into the crust. This is just absolutely disgusting but we didn't discover this till we had left the restaurant.  We had the malnati Chicago classic (sausage) and the lou (spinach, mushroom). The Lou had absolutely no flavor to it. It was bland and it was torture eating it. The malnati Classic was better than the Lou (but that's a really low bar)  but I wouldn't say it was good.  Raw dough and hair aside, the pizza here was not as good as the pizza at giordano's. We went to giordano's the night before and their crust is crispier, has more filling so the pizza is cheesier, and has more flavors. The food here is definitely not worth the wait.

It was our first time in Chicago and we were told by several local Uber drivers to dine at Lou Malnati's for an authentic deep-dish experience.  Long story short, it was great! We were told to expect a 40 minute wait, but ended up waiting around 25 minutes. They have a real-time SMS system that allows you to follow your spot in line. During the wait, we gave our deep dish order so we wouldn't have to wait too long.   Quality of the food was great, our service was excellent, and the restaurant was clean too.  I can't wait to return.

Service was great. Food was delicious. We went on a busy night and were made comfortable as we waited for our unreserved table. I recommend starting with the spicy chicken wings! And of course, their deep dish.

1. Calamari was good. Love the sauce and the batter was well done.  2. Love the beef barley soup. 5 stars.  3. Very disappointed on the deep dish, but it could be our poor selection. I think we ordered sausage so it's a layer of sausage on top. The crust is a little hard. I think it will be much better with more butter in the crust. However, I believe if it's not sausage and pepperoni instead would have made a big diff. The tomato sauce was very good too.  4. Thin crust pepperoni pizza was awesome.  Loaded with pepperoni, good amount of cheese.
Love the pizza!! They have great thin crust and deep dish. I'm a cheese only girl but I have had their deep dish spinach and it was so good! Fun environment, too!

I wasn't able to take pictures because I ate it so fast. I want to say it was because I was hungry but the pizza and salad was so damn good. I got the house salad with Gorgonzola dressing (it has a lot of chopped veggies in it but the dressing wasn't anything to write home about). The pizza though! You gotta get the Malnati's Chicago Classic. I just got a personal pizza and it was plenty along with the salad. I just wish they would open one in New Orleans, but for those visiting NOLA, you can get Chicago deep dish at That's Amore and it is good too.

This was my second time trying Deep Dish Pizza, and I should probably try a non chain based restaurant one next time. I just don't get deep dish, feels like eating a big bowl of cheese in a pastry bowl, and the sausage pieces were unnervingly large,  there was one slice of pizza that was 80% covered by a single piece of sausage. Each to their own I guess, because the line was crazy to get in, so maybe I am just wrong,but give me a standard slice every time.

This place is a must try! Loved it!  Plan for about an hour wait on a weekend evening, put your name in and grab a drink for while you wait. We ordered a medium deep dish pepperoni pizza and a family style Caesar for 3 people. Family style salad is so big- better for 6-7 people! But the salad was good and pizza AMAZING!  We also ordered the Chocolate chip pizza for dessert which is baked in a deep dish pan and topped with ice cream and whipped cream! We loved it, wait was long but worth it!

I had posted a review about their lack of organization around pick up in the South Loop and they obviously cared enough to read about it and called me and are going to fix the issue.... So next time will expect a more positive pick up experience or just have it delivered :-)
Very good taste with the Mozzarella Sticks and pizzas as well ! Good environment and great service from everyone in it.

Loved their deep dish! No doubt this is one of the best in Chicago. The crust is unbelievably delicious. It was crunchy and soft at the same time. A LOT A LOT of sausages. It's great!  And holy! The pizza chips.. Damn.. It was like heaven in my mouth. Everyone needs to try that appetizer. My favorite dip was artichoke. Will definitely come back. The prices are very reasonable comparing to the quantity and quality. See you again!

This was our first time trying a true Chicago deep dish pizza and it was delicious. It was either try Giordano's or Lou Malnati's and we chose to try Lou Malnati's. We ordered a medium half Lou's and half Chicago classic with pepperoni. I preferred the Chicago classic over the Lou's. Their sausage meat covers the entire bottom layer of the deep dish which was delicious! And the added pepperoni made it even more great. A medium has six huge slices and I was only able finish once slice of the classic. We  came in on a Saturday night at 5:55pm and it was about a 45 minute wait. We decided to preorder our pizza while waiting for a table so it could speed up the pizza process faster since it takes about 40 minutes to make the deep dish pizza. Overall it was a good first experience.

We visited this lovely Pizzeria while on Spring Break. We had spent the day at Shedd Aquarium and the staff had recommended it to our touristy-selves. We were not disappointed. We split a medium pepperoni Chicago deep dish pizza between the three of us. It was everything we had anticipated and more. Not overly-priced either! I believe our total came to just under $40 for the pizza, drinks, and even a few beers. We have since returned home and have ordered for 6 to be shipped to our home. We are hoping that they taste at least half as delicious as they did in the restaurant.  If you're just in town for a visit or a local that has yet to try the deliciousness Lou Malnati's has to offer - do yourself a favor and head on over for some of the best pizza you'll ever eat. You won't regret it!
We came here for real Chicago deep dish and were not disappointed. Perfect for a birthday meal. Staff was very helpful and just the right amount of attentive. Thanks for the great time.
The best deep dish in Chicago period!!!! Any time I need to impress someone from out of town... This place seals the deal!!! I love Lou's!!!
So far my favorite Chicago deep dish joint.
Best deep dish in the city.  Hands down.  The location is incredibly busy in the summer months but that's to be expected.

Only been in Chicago for a few days, but was already used to the wait times for every good restaurant out there. This one is definitely worth the wait. Since it takes a while to bake the perfect deep dish pizza, they give you a wait time and let you order the pizza first. We ordered a BBQ Chicken salad, and calamari as starters. Both were amazinggg (I would definitely grab seconds and thirds of that salad had I not been full up to the brim), and it only got better from there with our classic deep dish pizza. Can't wait to come back for more!
We've tried three of the big name Chicago deep dish classic pizza places and this was by far our least favorite.  Just not for us, Gino's or Giordano's are better, in our opinion.
They make one fantastic meat pie (or pizza as they like to call it here in Chicago). Recommend their special.
First time having deep dish I'd have to say I was impressed that the bottom of the crust wasn't soggy. It had a mild taste good place I'd come back if I was to come back to the chi.

Went there 4 min before closing, called in advance to pick up. Cashier was super cool about it.  We ordered a small Lou classic, was meaty for sure. The crust to me was the best part, If you like tons of meat, then this is the pizza for you. Personally I needed more sauce, but he what do I know -lol. It's a must visit if you're in Chicago.  Try it out yourself :).

The service was great, prices were fair. I didn't really like the pizza, but that's beef cause I'm used to New York style pizza and I don't like chunky sauces. The sauce was basically chunks of tomato and tomato peels. I took the bigger chunks off my pizza and even though there was still some actual sauce left on the pizza, there was almost no flavor. I think this would've gotten a better review if I weren't used to New York style pizza.

I ate there Friday night. Pretty long wait, but was worth it. I've eaten at Pizzeria Uno, Gino's, Giordano's, Pizzano, but this beat them all. The butter crust, the sauce, the texture and crunch--perfect. My cousin and I both declared this our favorite.

I guess it's safe to say that as a Jersey girl... I'm not a fan of deep dish pizza. And that might mean any deep dish pizza but unfortunately, Lou Malnati's is the only one I've ever tried. Came here with a group of 7 during a work conference all eager to try the pizza Chicago is famous for but unfortunately it fell short for all of us. It wasn't just the thickness of the pizza, it was so absurdly covered in cheese and the sauce was not very good. Our table ordered the Cheese Deep Dish, The Malnati Chicago Classic, and The "Lou". The personal size pizzas are in fact true personal pizzas, very small. There's a good amount of toppings. While we did not like the pizza (probably due to geographic preferences), we loved the Spinach Salad which came in a huge huge portion. We also enjoyed the calamari. The Stuffed Spinach Bread was a bit strange but tasty. The service was good and perhaps if I'm ever back I'll give their thin crust a try.

Good God! Best deep dish pizza I have ever had in my life and I have tried many!! I typically don't like chain type places but this place is a family business and I think they are keeping it very close to the original! The restaurant is full of old pictures from as far back as early 1900's. The history is really interesting and I love that the family shares these pics with the public and their story on every menu. We got the Chicago Classic. Every ingredient was fresh, delicious, and perfectly blended for a great pizza!! The sausage was so good. The cheese was plentiful, creamy, and covered the pizza. The sauce is so fresh that I think it was just made! We also had a salad. I ordered a small house salad... Big enough for two and extremely fresh! We also had the cookie for dessert. The ice cream was so good that it made the entire dish. The restaurant is clean. The staff are super friendly. The wait was about 20 minutes on a Friday night about 6:00. However, you order the pizza while waiting so you get your pizza pretty quickly after you sit down. Awesome experience. Don't leave Chicago without visiting Malnati's!!
First time visit.  Was fantastic!  Couldn't believe how fresh everything tasted.  Excellent experience, will return for sure!

Authentic deep dish has been on my foodie list for quite some time so we were so very happy to have the opportunity to dine at Lou Malnati's! We went in around 5:30 pm on a Monday evening, lucky to grab one of the few open tables still available. Food: They have a nice selection of craft bottle beers and a few wines. We decided to order a couple brews to quench our thirst while we decided what we wanted to order. After looking it over we go for the medium size Malnati Chicago Classic pie that serves 3. The pie takes 30 minutes to bake so we enjoyed our brews while we watch other tables around us devour their pizza. Finally our pie arrives, bubbly, golden crust, yum! First slice hits the plate and it doesn't' disappoint , definitely need a fork and knife for this..the sausage topping was very generous, the proportion to the rest of the topping perfect.The crust was excellent, stood up well to the topping, buttery, chewy and crisp on the edges..just a great experience. Service: Great services, fast, friendly, attentive. Our waiter made recommendations on portion sizes and was very helpful.  Atmosphere: Designed like what I imagined a pizza parlor would look like, plus lots of seats allows for lots of hungry diners to get their pizza on! Value: Medium deep dish for under $20 was a great value. The beers were priced reasonably as well.great value to feed a group. Overall: Our first visit and hopefully not our last. I hear they offer to ship pizza nationwide so I see Lou Malnati's in our future!

Frozen pizza tastes better than this place!  Visited Chicago and wanted to try deep dish pizza at Lou.   Seriously underwhelmed.   We ordered the classic and the Lou.   Sauce and cheese were good.   Crust was majorly soggy on both pizzas and although we ordered the butter crust, it wasn't spectacular at all.  The sausage tasted fake.   Loved the veggie topping, but they made the pizza super soggy.  A big let down for sure.

order a cheese dip dish pizza from here since my sister came before and highly recommended. Was amazing, service was good. Also got an Italian icy which was the perfect combination for a late night dinner.
Went there to pick up a pizza.  Place was lively.  Staff was pleasant.  Pizza was amazing
omg omg omg....the gluten free pizza is to die for!!! Connie's Pizza staff needs to come intern here to learn how to do a gluten free pizza! I always get sausage, tomatoes, spinach, & garlic.

ive always loved Lou's. do NOT get the personal pizza and think you have tried lou's for realz. gotta get the big think pan pizza. some love the sauce and cheese (unique!) some don't. I think it's a winner. so there! Ps salads could be improved. *** So I was asked to elaborate: the salads are boring and ho-hum. also the dressings are way way way way too sweet. especially the standard Sweet Vinaigrette that comes on as the default for the malnati. wayyyyyy too sweet did I mention that? lol Let me tell you salads I like for comparison: the chopped salad at Wildfire. Boom. good. the chopped at frankies is decent.  Lou's are just boring not awful just boringggg.  Id rather a wedge like at Gibson's to be honest. but again great 'za folks keep it up.
Good food, but terrible service. Took over half an hour on a slow Wednesday afternoon to get personal sized pizzas.
I don't like deep dish pizza. But this place is legit! Ask for the sausages to be cut up or else you get a sausage patty on your pie.

Meh... Maybe people put this place on such a high pedestal for me that it was impossible for the actual pizza to match my expectations. It had a personal deep dish pizza with sausage and olives. It was okay, but I wouldn't rave about it.
Ordered delivery and had the pizza uncut to avoid the watery issue. The lou is awesome. Ask for 10 bags pepper flakes and got 10 plates intead. Pretty funny. Great pizzas though.

I think anyone who has lived in Chicago for more than 10 days has at least tried to check this place out once. If you like Chicago pizza, you will like it.  I wouldn't say it's the best, I prefer Pequods, but I think different people feel differently about it.

My Order: Signature Malnati's pizza +spinach, mushrooms (no thank you, never again...)  Pros: + W/R: Clean washrooms...? Though I'd come to expect that from a franchise as big as Lou Malnati's.  Cons:  - FOOD: I've genuinely experienced better. I actually love the deep dish pizza in the Greater Toronto Area comparatively. The only saving grace in this meal was the sausage in the pizza. It tasted fresh and added a bit of tang to an otherwise lackluster meal.  - STAFF: I get this "I sort of hate my life" vibe from them. It seems like they're just there to be *there*. At least that's the vibe I got from my waitress.  Maybe next time I'll try deep dish at Pizzeria Uno. Maybe I'll just never come back to Chicago for deep dish. I feel like the effort towards good customer service/satisfaction is lost since this franchise is probably frequented by tourists. It could def use some work.

Better than Gino's East and Giordano's, but still not amazing. We ordered the Lou's Chicago Style deep dish pizza and the cheese bread appetizer.  The menu said the cheese bread was supposed to have garlic in it but you could barely taste the garlic. It tasted very bland. The marinara sauce that came on the side was not the best addition (the bread tastes better alone), and there was not enough for the whole order. I still ate the bread but I would not order it again.  The pizza was good but did not blow me away. The dough was tasty and soft, however it didn't have much of a crunch, and since I love Detroit style pizza I love a crust with a great crunch to it. The cheese was the best part and they put a lot of it on the pizza. All the veggies tasted fresh.  It takes a while to get a table but they let you put your order in while you wait (it takes a while to cook the pizza). The pizza was ready soon after we sat down.  The waitress was helpful and kind. I don't think I would visit this place again though, not because it's not good but because it's really nothing special. I'm still searching for the Chicago Style pizza that will make me fall in love.
It was so good with a classic Lou.  That buttery crust. mmmm  Did take them a while to get it out to us though.

Had a wonderful meal! Chicken tortilla soup was great (see posted pic). Personal deep dish pepperoni  was exactly as I hoped (see posted pic).  I would absolutely come here again.  Maria's service was wonderful too. Quick, friendly, and checked back appropriately. I would recommend.

Loved the pizza, liked the spinach bread. Would pass on the soup (it wasn't bad though). The salad was average (not in a good way) and is worth skipping. Service was slow despite the room being a bit empty. We'll be back and you should go if you haven't had Chicago style pizza. Staff was very nice and friendly all around.

This was our first chicago deep dish pizza, and we thought we just didn't like deep dish pizza after having it here until we went to Pizzaros in the loop. Where we LOVED deep dish pizza.  Heres what we didn't like: We ordered the classic with the sausage. The sausage seemed really rubbery. The sauce was watered down, and I had to ask for more sauce. There just wasn't a whole lot of flavor to it... I caked it in the parmesan, basil and red pepper sauce they put on the table and it was ok.  Aurelios, not far from here, has great pizza as well as Pizzaro in the loop.

It's definitely one of the best pizza places in Chicago. Their burnt cheese crust is out of this world and don't get me started on the sauce! I love everything about this place except that you have to wait an hour before getting a table and it's very loud.
I still haven't found a Chicago pizza that blows of my cap, but I definitely love this place, and it's the best deep dish I've had so far! Get the veggie! Make she you have some time to wait though
Expected a long wait for the pizza to be prepared but it was ready in 20 minutes. The crust is so crunchy. The cheese is so cheesy. My friends from the city suggested it and I was definitely pleased.

Five-star pizza. Three-star salad (plain and small). Average: four stars! The place was packed at 6 pm on a Saturday night. However, I ordered the pizza in advance and both pizza and table were ready when promised. Service was friendly and attentive.

Tried their deep dish pizza. First time there and waited about 10 mins at 3 pm, don't forget to order your pizza while waiting, saved us some time! My pizza was good except I only had one topping so the deep dish pizza didn't taste "deep dish" enough, how was I suppose to know since nobody told me that! Anyway I am willing to try it again and definitely will have more toppings in my deep dish pizza next time!

I was in town with a friend for my birthday and was very excited for Chicago Deep Dish Pizza! We came across Lou Malnati's on our walk and decided to have lunch.  We shared a pizza (half The Lou & half The Classic) and it was very cheesy and delicious.  I could not get enough of the slighty crispy, flaky Buttercrust...YUMMY!!! The stuffed spinach bread was good, too, and very filling, so glad we shared the pizza.  Hopefully, I'll be able to visit this amazing city again and come back to Lou's!

You can't visit Chi-town and not have deep dish pizza! It would be a sin for 11th circle of hell! But with a pizza joint on every block it's hard to choose! Thanks to all my fellow yelpers for lending a hand on leading us to Lou's!  The set up and decor faintly reminded me of Bucca Di Beppo back in LA! Which is awesome because I'm a huge Bucca fan! The service was friendly and everyone was all smiles! Our server even lended us a helping hand on which train would take us back to our hotel. Our food actually came out on time and in the proper order! I know that probably sounds strange but we've rarely gone to restaurants where the hot apps come out before the main entrees.  Our salad was the first to come out and oh my goodness! We were loving every bit of it! It had the perfect balance of acidity and salty! Our Calamari came out soon after and that didn't last very long either! It was crunchy and well seasoned and the squid just melted! Not chewy at all! It was a dream! And then! The moment we were all waiting for! Our deep dish heaven! The pizza itself was on a whole new level of bomb. I hate pizza crust mainly cause well it's gross. But I could eat this crust all day! The freshness of the roma tomatoes really added a lightness to the pizza which made it such an enjoyable meal! All in all, Lou's is doing great things and I'm  super happy they were our first Chicago Deep Dish experience.
Crappy pizzas. These guys dont care. The crush of people in Chi town ensures there always some suckers eating their garbage. Never.Going.Back.

Lou Malnaties really cares about their customers. I received a call from them after my review and they asked about the details about my experience. After speaking to a few people on their team, I'd definitely return to give them another chance the next time I'm in Chicago.

It's probably not fair of me to even review this place, as I am not a deep-dish fan, but... still gonna.  As far as deep dish goes, I suppose I haven't had better. We got the Lou with pepperoni added. Ingredients seemed fresh. Sauce was good. It was too cheezy for my tastes, but that's probably the nature of deep dish. Deep dish is probably why pizza is also called "pie." It's very pie-like indeed, with a thick crust and very heavy/rich contents. Even for non-deep-dish fans, I'd say it's worth a try; after all, you are in Chicago.  The wait wasn't too bad. They told us about 20-25 minutes but I think it ended up being probably less than 10. We started on a couple of really good beers while we waited for a table. Matilda (Beligan style) and The Poet (a porter by a Michigan Brewery).
Really appreciate gluten free options for pizza and personal size deep dish pizza , it's really cool . Also the waiter was really nice
Good pizza. It's one of the best "Chicago" style pizzas. I love everything about the pizza. New York can't compare with Chicago.

Great! I took my two friends who were from out of town and wanted some Chicago deep dish pizza. The service was great, Jazmin was our waitress. The food didn't take very long and my friends enjoyed everything. Pizza was cooked very well and I was happy that they got a good pizza experience when they visited Chicago.

There were a lot of people there when we arrived, so they told us there's a 45 minute wait.  But they let us put in our order early, and the wait was probably less than 20 minutes. The waiter/waitress served us our slices; I've never been to a pizza place where they do that. I loved the cheese deep dish pizza.

We usually go to Giordanos but tonight decided to try this place for a change. The atmosphere in the restaurant is  fantastic... So much better than Giordano's. The service was better, the noise level better. But the pizza sadly was not. The sauce has a wine taste to it... Almost like a pasta sauce. Out of 4 of us, 3 adults and a kid, kid didn't like it, 1 adult didn't like it, and 2 of us felt it was OK, but not great. With Giordano's so close, I can't imagine going back.

When in Chicago, you gotta have the deep dish pizza.  And if you're only in town for five days, you gotta trust your Yelpers to find the best place in town, and that brought me to Lou Malnati's.  I came here on a Saturday night, and it was packed, as expected.  You're cozied up to all the other parties waiting for their tables as well, and the delicious aromas of pizza and warmth permeate your senses and definitely works up your appetite.  We waited about 45 minutes for a table of five.  You can order your food when you're still in line so that by the time you sit down, they'll fully bake the pizza and it'll come out quicker.  Very efficient in my opinion. We ordered the combination platter since we couldn't just choose one appetizer.  This came with mozzarella sticks, cheddar cubes, breaded mushrooms and zucchini.  They were all good, but just a lot of fried food so don't fill up on appetizers too quickly.  We ordered a large The Malnati Chicago Classic pizza and it was to die for.  It was as good as I thought it would be.  The servers were super friendly and accommodating too, which made the experience even better.  They bring the pizza out on a tray to your table and they serve you individually.  Since it's deep dish, it's a lot more filling than you would expect, so I had about two slices, but we had some leftovers.   When I am in Chicago next, I will definitely be back!

First time trying original Chicago deep dish and I was not disappointed! The crust and cheese were so delicious and we also got the bruschetta, which for the type of place this is, couldn't be beat. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the Windy City!

I had a Layover before going to Mexico. Now I was extremely unlucky with the weather and decided to get a Deepfry Pizza. I had read on Yelp's Chatboard about good places to go and Lou Malnati's seems like a food chain with great reviews for their deepfry pizza  It's my first time trying the real thing. I did like 1 hours transit from the airport to the restaurant with like 15 minutes of being soaking wet by this wet-snow in this windy weather. So Chicago is nice, the place looks good but my only super positive moment that day was eating that pizza. Made me feel like the struggle was worth it.  I'll be honest, I'm not a huge fan of that type of pizza but I get the appeal and felt it had a almost healthy feel to it. The service was impeccable and my waitress was very nice. I will go back to Chicago in better circumstance for a longer period of time and I'm sure that when I'll go back to get a Deepfry pizza this will not be the only amazing moment of my stay there!

First experience ordering from Lou Malnati's was a bit of a whirlwind.  I placed the order online, paid for it online and was told what time to go pick it up, simple and easy. The website was super easy to navigate for everything and the options were so overwhelming to choose from. When I went to go pick up my pizza, they said that the card didn't go through online so they needed to ring it up in store, which was OK. Then, the cashier went back to check on the status of our order and then got the manager. The manager explained to me and my friend there was a problem with our order- they made the pizza with all the toppings on both halves instead of leaving one half plain cheese (which meant I couldn't eat it). They said they were going to remake the pizza and then refunded the money to my friend's card. The only downside was having to wait an additional 20-30 minutes for our pizza that we ordered an hour ago. The pizza was delicious and the butter crust was to die for. Definitely the best deep dish I've had since moving to the city. I was happy with how they handled the issue and solved it, the only downside of the experience was the additional wait time. I'm definitely going to go again, and eat-in this time!!

If you didn't get deep dish pizza, did you even go to Chicago? I'm a fan of both main chains that locals fight over for the acclaimed "locals' favorite" title when ur comes to deep dish. This experience at Lou Malnati's took the cake for me!  First off, service and friendliness is of great value for me when dining. Being my third time in Chicago this visit, I really wanted to show my friends a great impression of Chicago. The kind spirited, friendly, and spirited waiter won them over as he joked around and made our dining experience so much fun. Definitely big points on that.  We ordered a large "the Lou" and it was so perfect. Service-wise not only did our waiter inform us of all the possibilities for alternative ingredients for my food allergy (traded mixed spinach which had onions in it to fresh spinach which did not have onions), but also he gave basically a show for us as he cut the pizza and served us. The Lou is excellent and gives you great tastes of veggies. Man writing about it now even makes me want to go back to Chicago just for more Lou Malnati's. We left so satiated and happy from our first meal of our Chicago trip. Definitely will show all of my friends Lou's!
Good food, big portions, great service. Centrally located. Definitely a place to go when you visit Chicago

All that hype.. I was at the peak of it. You what comes after the peak, the fall. I took my friend from Toronto to deliver the authentic Chicago Experience. What is more quintessential Chicago thing than the mighty Deep Dish Pizza? I have been to other popular chains, hence curious me, picked this place.  We were greeted and seated right away. The interior is a standard Italian restaurant format cozy and welcoming. We ordered Medium sized The Malnati Chicago Classic with green peppers and olives. The waitress warned us that it would take half an hour for the pizza. So at least there upfront and clear about it.  The pizza looked good. The crust was nicely browned and the contrasting Parmigiano-Reggiano on the tomato sauce was a nice touch. When the waitress placed a slice/piece, it was intact. The Pizza tasted good. Chewy mozzarella was just melted right amount and buttery crust was may be too crusty. The pizza sauce was well, I would say not the best I have had. The Italian sausage was not spicy, but I wish it was bit more spicy. Overall the Pizza was good.  Oh I'm giving Three stars because of the aftermath. I think I got food poisoned that night. Prime suspect is the pizza. However I'm not leaving other food I had that day. I would visit another location of this chain to write another review.

Place is great for deep dish and the chicken wings are really good!! Next time I am there I hope I go with some friends so I can get a regular pizza versus a personal size pizza because I think I would like it a lot better. Would also like to try there salads. Place was very clean and the servers were very nice.

You know, there might be something to this deep-dish phenomenon after all. New York-style pizza is really my favorite, but at Lou Malnati's I discovered I can love deep-dish too. The key is in the expectations: it's really more like lasagna than pizza, so once you understand that, you can sit back and be amazed. The overall experience is definitely that of a chain restaurant: there are huge groups of tourists (we were behind a girls' volleyball team) and there's a whole procedure to ordering and getting a table (done in that order, which makes sense because there's usually a long wait for both.) Our server was polite but harried; he looked completely slammed even in the middle of a weekday afternoon.  We began with their house salad, in which they use crispy, fried bits of pepperoni as croutons -- talk about a stroke of genius! -- but it was nothing special, and the dressing was way too sweet. We didn't finish it despite the inflated price tag. Despite these quibbles, however, there's nothing on this earth quite like their incredibly rich "pizza" casserole, with a buttery pastry crust, thick sauce, crispy pepperoni and an avalanche of melty cheese. It really was amazing, and the next time in Chicago I will make time for a repeat visit. Meanwhile, I need to stop writing Yelp reviews when I'm hungry!

Conveniently located near the Hilton hotel. Personal deep dish pizza is really small. I would recommend getting salad and/or appetizers if you're hungry. The service is a bit slow but the staff is friendly.

Ordered out their signature Malnati's pizza, overall I'd give it a 7/10. I love pizza but this place is just not as good as they hype led it up to be. Also ordered a spinach salad, came with about 3 tea spoonfuls of goat cheese 3/10. Fit for a rabbit.

Chicago deep dish pizza... Always a must when you come into town... but never a stunner. Let's be honest with each other and set out all the facts beforehand -- I'm a NY pizza lover, so Chicago pizza does not tickle my fancy.  The pizza itself is massive. Unless you have a huge appetite or really love heavy pizza, two slices will be your max --  the waitress may try to tell you otherwise, but either you'll be full by then or sick of eating the same ol' thing. We ordered the sausage pizza -- which was heavily loaded with cheese. A fork and knife in hand, I attacked the pizza. Thank goodness for that, because the crust is not crispy. Overall, impressive? Prob not. But would I do it again, most likely because no trip to Chicago is complete without a slice of deep dish pizza.

I'm probably going to get crucified by LMP fans but this review was for the pizza ordered to-go and eaten in the hotel room as well as the frozen pizza I bought and flew back home to SoCal. Maybe we didn't cook it right, maybe.. First of all, the ladies over the counter were rude and unfriendly. I was willing to overlook that if the pizza was mind blowingly good. Sad to say, it wasn't. The crust was thin and crisp, yes. There was lots of gooey mozzarella cheese topped with loads of sausage and tomatoes but somehow, it's missing a "wow" factor. I thought it was just me but everyone I ate it with echo my sentiments. It could've been over hyped is what it is which made our expectations soaring high. It's too bad though. To be fair, I probably should have dined in but I'm partly relieved I didn't because there are just too many good places to eat in Chicago and if I had the same outcome as when I ate it at the hotel and at home, I'd be bummed out to miss out on a better restaurant in this city. Perhaps when I'm in town again I'll give it another shot. Until then, 3 stars is all I could muster.

This was GREAT pizza! Deep Dish, Chicago, Buttered Crust pizza!  These folks have an efficient process for getting you in and out. Don't be discouraged if it is busy and their is a wait. They put your name on the list, give you a wait time and encourage you to pre-order at the counter before being seated, so that your food is practically ready when you sit down. GENIUS!  The staff was great! very friendly and accommodating!

Quite possibly the worst pizza I have ever had. Very disappointed. My Dad told me to go here while we were visiting Chicago because he thinks it has the best Chicago has to offer in terms of the traditional deep dish. I also was sure to look on Yelp and see what others thought about it before coming. Sad to say we wasted a valuable lunch slot on this place. Pizza was greasy, and the sausage was horrible. Crust was thin and disappointing. Will not be returning on our next trip to Chicago.

There are tons of places to get a decent Chicago style deep dish pizza. I practically tried about 5 difference places during my short trip. Lou Malnati's, well you are franchised as hell and all over the place, but you are still a winner. Lou Malnati's won me for best buttery crust. I ended up stopping by this location during a trip around the Loop and walking around the snowy park. It was the lunch hour and this place was relatively packed. Lou Malnati's at this location took over 2 side by side restaurant spaces, so even while busy, there was ample space with minimal wait. -=-Lunch Deep Dish-=- Best way to eat deep dish is to not stuff yourself crazy, like most portions end up being. The lunch portion deep dish, perfecto. The sauce is sweet, but not over overly bearing. The best part though was the crust. It was flaky with a buttery crunch. It didn't quite excel in the cheesiness category, but you really can't have it all. A+, I will crave this again.

We had high expectations, ordered thin crust with spinach and tomatoes and deep dish with sausage meet, as announced the deep dish pizza took 40 min to be ready, unfortunately when served both pizzas were barely warm, had to send them back. re-heating the pizzas made a positive difference. We had the house salad family size, very fresh and huge. Too bad the Pizzas were forgotten en-route.
best deep dish in Chicago !!! just wooow

I had to get an obligatory Lou's review along with the rest of my pizza reviews. I probably get a deep dish from this location at least twice a month. Although everyone has their favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago (mine being Pequod's) this has to be one of the top recognized names along with Gino's and Giordano's. Lou's has a crispy crust, ample amount of cheese, and a large tomato chunk style sauce. I really wouldn't even consider it much of a "sauce", but more of a topping. Needless to say, there really isn't anything out there like it. One slice and you are full. The sausage also comes slab style across the entire pizza. I personally request and prefer their sausage pieces instead. Also, be sure to order the butter crust. It adds a great flavor! Other lesser known option that is nice is the lower-fat mozzarella cheese. I really could not tell the difference. As another "healthier" option, they now serve poultry sausage, which is also delicious. Taste a piece of Chicago history, stop by Lou's, and get a deep dish pizza!

Chicago classic pizza is delicious, I'm correcting an earlier review, as they have more than made up for it in my most recent experience. The butter crust is impossible to beat, best pizza in the city.

After everyone recommending this pizzeria, we expected a really good pie.  We came to Chicago really open and enthusiastic for a good deep dish pizza.  Instead, we got a very bland offering with a hard crust.  The only saving grace was the tomato sauce and the garlic bread with marinara.  Very underwhelming experience.  I wonder if it was just this location or the crust is just that bland.

Okay well everyone's pretty much already shared how great this place is, and it's a Chicago staple. I was in town for a conference and this was one of the place that the Yelpers led me to, and boy they did not fail. When you dine in during the typical dinner hours, more likely than not it's gonna be packed with tons of people waiting in the lobby. They have a great system where you can preorder the deepdish pizzas you want, of which they'll half bake while you're waiting and then complete once you sit. This definitely saves on time as it usually takes a while. We ordered the app sampler and fried calamari to start with, nothing special just a ton of fried stuff. For the pizza, we ordered the Chicago classic which comes with tons of cheese, buttery crust, and sausages. Holy wow it is sooooooooo good. So good. The sausage was stellar, the cheese was so cheese. Agh. It was definitely filling too, I could only do like 2 slices. It was so good that I had it twice in 1 week. That good. Agh.

Lou Malnati's has their own distinct taste that sets them apart from any other pizza's. Their crust, for thin or deep dish, it always crispy and has a rich buttery taste. The cheeses are perfectly melted on top with meat generously put on the pizza. It is the perfect mixture. Even though there are many Lou Malnati's, the taste is the same from every location, which is awesome! The service is always spot on, always friendly smiles and willing to help. The staff offers you options and leaves you feeling happy. The decor for this Lou Malnati's tries to capture a city atmosphere while still saying Lou Malnati's. They have several historical items placed around the restaurant. The feeling is a bit too industrial though and I don't feel like staying for too long...maybe that's the point?

Services was a little slow at first but food was really good. If you are wanting good pizza/ real Chicago deep dish come here. But don't come too hungry, deep dishes take at least 30min to make so get a few appetizers to hold you over :)

This may be a tourist spot, but I do not think it is a tourist trap.  When in Chicago, you must eat deep dish and highly recommend you have it here.  I went to this place with 3 other people and although we had to wait about 30-45mins for a table, it was worth it...plus, you get to order while you wait here...your food gets timed and is cooked so that once you've been seated, it's not long before it's ready.  Honestly, I think any kind of topping/pizza you get here will be good.  Their sauce is delicious, they can do dairy-free pizza with no cheese, the crust is great.  I recommend, if you want something to go with your pizza, get their house chopped salad...I don't recall its exact name but it has a bacon vinaigrette on it...it was awesome.  Service was also awesome.  If/when I go back to Chicago, I'll definitely be going here again!

This is hands-down my favorite pizza in Chicago, deep-dish of course.  (I think thin crust is for amateurs!) It's just something about the crust having the right amount of flakiness and buttery taste that no other pizza establishment has been able to compete with.  When it comes to freshness, you just can't beat this pie. I've tried the rest.  And for me, this is definitely the best.

The pizza was excellent. We had the "Lou" one, very cheesy - delicious. The salad was nice and I liked the house dressing. Our server was very friendly and nice but we felt very rushed - couldn't enjoy our food.

Lou Malnati's is at the top of my list when getting pizza in Chicago. Be prepared to wait: we had to order, then wait 30 minutes for a table. Once we were seated, our server was friendly and attentive. She was more than happy to change something with our order even when it was (probably) too late to expect it. The garlic bread is amazing and served with marinara for dipping. Then there's the pizza. This is true deep dish at its best. The crust is excellent and can be snapped with a fork (you MUST knife and fork it). Though they say a large feeds four, I think a medium would be plenty. (I'm an eater and was full after one slice).  Note: if you love Lou's, you can take home a pie or two and relive the experience in your own oven.

Never been to Chicago but wanted to try Chicago pizza, we chose this place because it was close to our hotel, and we were not disappointed!  Absolute delicious! We had a spinach and cheese stuffed bread appetizer and shared a small Chicago deep dish pizza. It was soo good!!!

We usually frequent the buffalo Grove locations bc I lost hope for the downtown locations. My fiance loves pizza, we were in the city that day. We stopped in, usually and always I order easy on the cheese and more sauce. I'm lactose in tolerant. Waitress never heard of that kind of order. I asked her to ask the manager and she said I've been here forever and never heard such a way. Let me ask if the cooks know how to make it. 15 mins later she came back saying it wasn't possible. So I had the crust of a slice of pizza and My fiance tried to enjoy his pizza without feeling bad. Thanks for ruining pizza service LM downtown again.  It sucks to have to pay for parking, pay for food and service that all blows.

The wings were really good but I was a bit disappointed in the pizza. Other people bad time me really good things but I thought it was just so-so. I had a sausage and mushroom pizza and I didn't really like the the taste of the sauce. However other people seemed to really like it and recommended the pepperoni but it was already to late. I would def eat there again the service was good and the staff was very friendly.

I've never really been a huge fan of deep dish pizza. I always though there's too much crust and not enough filling for something called deep dish. I knew I had to give it another shot though because this is one of the things that Chicago is known for. Tip: give everything a second chance! I think this was one of my favorite meals in Chicago (and there are a lot of good food)!  We got 2 mediums to share amongst the 3 of us - The Malnati Chicago Classic and the "Lou." Both were delicious! There wasn't too much crust because I hate it when it's too bready and there was the perfect amount of grease so that it wasn't super dry, but it wasn't super greasy either. It's a good thing they have someone to cut it for you at the table because it would have been a mess if we did it. There's a generous portion of cheese that stretches like they do in movies when you grab a slice. The toppings were delicious as well.  Overall, it was delicious! I wish I can get a slice (or a whole pizza) right now as I write this. I am definitely a fan!

I was nervous coming to this pizza place when I visited Chicago this weekend because of the popularity. You know how this get when they are too popular. But, this place is legit delicious and amazing!  We got here around 9:45pm on Friday night and there were a few tables left, all of a sudden it was packed!  Service was great! Very attentive and people always walking around to help/assist you with whatever you need.  Bathrooms were clean. But really Chicago, no toilet seat covers? What's that all about.  Now the best part...the food! We ordered a Medium Classic Lou Manati and added pepperoni. And a side of cheese curds. Absolutely mind blown on both of these items. Those cheese curds didn't last long on the plate as they kept getting dipped in that fantastic marinara sauce then down the hatch. The pizza was a deep dish with a buttery crust that was amazing! The extra pepperoni added the additional fantasticness, but the sausage was amazing enough just saying. I usually eat pizza with ranch, but I guess it's a slap in the face in Chicago, so I didn't go there. Absolutely amazing place!
Recommended by the hotel and we were not disappointed by the food... The wait was long but it's because the pizza is amazing.  Wish we were here longer to eat here again!

Another item crossed off my Chicago bucket list! Having a real deep dish pizza. Yum. And Lou Malnati does it good.  For appetizers, we ordered the Trio of Dips and Pizza Chips (not crunchy), it was a good starter if you like carbs. My personal favorite was the artichoke dip. This is a huge appetizer so it's good for sharing, but if you're hungry like we were, it might only be enough for two.  For the pizza (they warn you it takes about 30 minutes to bake), we got The Malnati Chicago Classic™. "Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust.™ It's authentic Chicago!". The buttercrust is delicious! If you get a different pizza, be sure to upgrade to this crust, it's awesome. The sausage is wonderful, it compliments the pizza so well and they make sure to put plenty of it in the pizza. We got the small size which is recommended to serve 2 people. At first you might look at it and think it's not enough but once you're finished, you'll realize, it was the perfect size.    During our visit, we had this place, TWICE! It was that good. We're not even going to bother trying another place.

Food was good as usual, but the service was so bad. The waiter didn't care about our table at all. I ordered coffee, he only gave me black coffee at first time without cream and coffee spoon. So, I asked for it. He brought me cream at second time but still no coffee spoon. So, I asked for it again. At third time, he brought me SOUP spoon, still no coffee spoon!!! I saw the other table a waitress served coffee with cream and coffee spoon on the side.  Also, when he took empty dishes, he didn't hold steady. So, it was falling down and food was on my hand. I said I need napkins. He said ok. However, he was going to another table and ignored me, I had to ask napkins again!!!  My table waiter didn't feel sorry at all. This was my worst experience ever!!!

Lou Malnati's is home of my favorite pizza of all time, it's simply out of this world. Every time my relatives come to town, this is a must-visit. Nothing beats Chicago deep dish! The Malnati salad is absolutely incredible too.
Fresh Salad, 60mins waiting turns to 15mins, pre-order pizza when we were waiting. Will come in next Chicago visit.

Ok, so I visited Chicago twice and discussed this with multiple people who are from Chicago.    Lou's is hands down my choice out of the Uno's vs LM vs Giordanos battle.  Perfect cheese/sauce balance and the meet pie has just the right amount of juicy and not overly greasy meat.   Ugh... just writing this review makes me want more.

Haven't had authentic Chicago pizza since the year 2000.  Went to the "Taste of Chicago" back then.  Although I have been in Chicago countless times since 2000, pizza was the furthest from my mind when it comes to dining.  It was my co-workers first time in Chicago and besides visiting a couple of bars downtown, he wanted authentic Chicago deep dish pizza.  Yelped best Chicago pizza and found this place.  It's down the street from the Oprah Harpo studio.  Restaurant has seating on the second floor.  Decided on a smooth Chianti that didn't disappoint. Also, ordered the personal size pizza, "The Lou", which was amazing!  The pizza had spinach, garlic, and cheese.  It was the size of a personal pan pizza from PIZZA HUT!!  It definitely brought back my old high school days.  The pizza was so small that it made the $9.25 price "highway robbery"!  Actually it might be 1- 1/2 inch(es) smaller.  Remember how that personal pan pizza at PIZZA HUT was equivalent to one slice of pizza back in the day???  Anyway,  needless to say, the one pie wasn't filling enough so I ordered 2nd one (cheese).  Price wise it was equivalent to ordering a larger pie with more slices .  I have to say the sauce was just right.  It was super cheesy (quality cheese) and the butter crust was melt in your mouth not too hard,  just the right amount of crispiness!!  Verdict: really good pizza but spent way too much ($20.00 on 2 slices of pizza basically).

I came here with a party of four, and this place was packed! It felt a bit disorganized at times, but it all ended up working out. I liked that we could order some stuff ahead of time and grab drinks while waiting. It took some time to be seated, but they were able to accommodate us. For food, we had The Lou for our pizza with mushrooms and olives added and the Chicken Louie. Although they said a large pizza would only feed four, we were super stuffed after going back for seconds and even had leftovers. The pizza was fluffy and cheesy with quality ingredients. The Chicken Louie pasta dish was also good but not necessarily that different from standard chicken Alfredo except that it was covered in cheese. I don't know how this compares to the other pizzerias, but our party was very satisfied with our food.
I enjoyed the crust but didn't like the large tomatoes chunks in the sauce. This pizza also didn't hold up for next day eating...

1st time in chicago and went here to try deep dish for the 1st time!The long wait time was dreadful, so come early, before you are hungry! (my dad was grumbling when he had to wait an hr or so to be seated for pizza and I felt so bad for the huge family with a pregnant mother who were waiting and eventually left because the wait line was too long) It's best to order your pizza when you book your seats so when you get seated at a table, the pizza will be almost ready. Besides that, the food was amazing, we got medium size with half classic deep dish and half of the 'lou'. Both were good, but the 'lou' was a lot better for my parents who like to eat a more variety of veggies than meat. Really didn't regret going there, the pizza was awesome and filling, we even took some back to our hotel to finish!
My first official real Chicago deep dish pizza. I don't really have anything to compare it to in that sense, but it was really good!

On my trip to Chicago, I wanted to try deep dish pizzas everyday of my visit there and this was by far the best deep dish pizza place in Chicago. Let's get right to it: Pros: service was awesome, chicken wings were okay, but got the chicago style pizza with sausages and that was amazing. They were super packed when we got there but the wait wasn't long at all, and the tiramisu dessert was just out of this world! Cons: none!! They let you buy frozen pizzas to take home. I took mine on a 4 hour flight back to Cali and that was fine. Definitely will come back here when I visit again!

Lou Malnati's is the definition of Chicago deep dish pizza and they are located everywhere in Chicago. This particular South Loop location was stupidly busy when I arrived in the early evening so I highly recommend ordering ahead of time by phone or online. We ordered take out by phone, arrived at the stated time, but still waited another 20 minutes for the pizza to be ready. Many others are using this strategy so the area directly in front of the cash registers is a packed mob of people waiting for pizza, waiting to order, or waiting to be seated. It's quite the hectic situation and I was worried at several times that my pizza was being given away.  We ordered the large Malnati Chicago Classic that is lean sausage on a thick bed of cheese and their classic butter crust. It was everything I expected out of Chicago deep dish - literally a full inch of crust, cheese, and tomato sauce under a hearty layer of sausage. Based on their nutrition information, two slices nets you nearly 1500 calories worth of delicious cheesiness. Only in America, only in Chicago, only at Lou Malnati's...

I asked several hundred facebook friends where the best deep dish in Chicago was.  I got mixed reviews however - ALL of the friends who were actually from Chicago suggested Lou Malnati's.  They were right.  Best deep dish eva......

The deep dish pizza are pretty good. I am not a big fan of deep dish pizzas so I usually can't eat more than 2 slices otherwise I just feel bloated. The malnatis chicAgo classic was delicious and the Lou was okay. I wasn't so crazy about the Lou. Oh & the Malnatis salad was so good!!! Minus the blue cheese, I'm not a fan of blue cheese but I recommend that salad!
It was decent, maybe too hyped for what it is. The veggie pizza was surprisingly GOOD even without any meat. Next time visiting Chicago, I will definitely get a big order of the veggie pizza!

1st time trying chicago style pizza in Chicago and it sucks to say that I liked the Chicago pizza in San Fran sooo much better. Coming from NY i prepared myself for non-NY pizza... and even then this was a disappointment... Crust was hard and tasteless like drywall. I will give Chicago pizza one more try at Pequods.. otherwise i'll save my stomach for the finer foods in this foodie city...

It's gets three stars because there's no such thing as a bad pizza. I went to Chicago for 6 days and while there my boyfriend and I decided to try as many deep dish pizza places as possible. This was the worst of our experience. The pizza was bland with almost no flavor. It's funny because the day before we were at Giordanos and the waiter brought us salt, and I jokingly asked: who would put salt on a pizza?! The answer to my question came the next day: people at Lou Minalti's. My pizza was basically a glob of bland greasy cheese and the bread tasted like water. I love cheese don't get me wrong but, if I wanted just cheese I would have bought a slab at tjs. There were times when I would lift the cheese and there would be no tomato sauce underneath. Bleh.
Ordered delivery and the pizza was very soggy. Got diarrhea from this crappy pizza. Will never be going back to this place.

This is my personal favorite Chicago pizza stop.  Arrived around 6PM on a Saturday night.  Quoted a 50 minute wait for a party of 2.  Seated in 28 minutes.  Since we preordered (brilliant option) our pie was ready pretty quickly.  We had the amazing Bruschetta while we waited for it.  Wound up getting the Malnati Chicago Classic which is absolutely righteous.  Finished with the pan served chocolate chip cookie, which is insanely good.

What is better than trying a deep dish for my first time in Chicago!? After conferring with friends, I decided that Lou Malnati's is the most popular and highly perceived deep dish place to go to. Because we came early around 5 pm, there was no wait, and we were immediately seated. We decided to go with a house salad individual serving and The Lou- spinach, mushrooms, sliced roma tomatoes covered with mozzarella, romano, and cheddar cheese on garlic Buttercrust in a medium (which serves 3 people). First thing we noticed- Lou's has giant portions. Our individual serving salad and pizza was good for 4 people; we couldn't finish our food! The salad had a bunch of toppings which was great, and after waiting 30 minutes (the wait time is on the menu), our deep dish came! The pizza was... delicious. The middle had spinach while the top was covered in tomatoes and cheese. I love how thick the pizza was and how juicy and flavorful it was! The crust was also nice and crisp, and it was great with ranch sauce. The food here was fantastic, and the service was also very attentive. Since I have never had deep dish pizza before, I don't really know what I can compare it to (hence the 4 stars). Let's see how other places measure up!
We got the Malnati's Classic. There was sausage in each bite! So cheesy. The baked spinach bread was amazing!! Definitely happy with our decision to stop here.

Bada bada bing, da Chicago style pie ain't necessarily the best, I like NYC style, new haven style, Nepalese style, I like Lou malnati style too. They have a good style, delivery is good to order but the folks who answer the phone have a bit of a tude sometimes. Check that tude at the front door and keep making good pizza pies with the tomato berries
Lou's eaten in a restaurant in Chicago is the very best pizza I've ever eaten.  Delicious Chicago style pizza- well balanced, flavorful & unmatched.

When in Chicago, one must try the Chicago deep dish pizza. To be honest, I didn't know how to eat the pizza when it first came out. I was just looking at it in awe trying to figure out how to eat it. The deep dish is like a pie. I ended up having to use my knife and fork to eat this since the slices were massive. My family got a large Malnati's Classic with sausage (make sure you ask them to crumble the sausage or else you'll just have 2 uncut sausages on the pizza). The pizza had Lou's lean sausage, cheese, and vine-ripened tomato sauce on a buttercrust. Sounds delicious doesn't it? The pizza was good but it was too doughy for my taste. The crust was crunchy at first but after 15 minutes or so, the pizza started to get soggy. In general, I'm not a fan of deep dish pizzas. Don't get me wrong, Lou Malnati's is good, but it is just not for me.

I'd say 3 stars for the pizza and 5 for the salad, and this averages out to 4 stars. Their Malnati salad was DELICIOUS!! I was hesitant at first because they had some salami bits mixed in, but that turned out to add the perfect amount of crunch and savoriness. The dressing was a light vinaigrette that was absolutely delicious!  However, I thought that the pizza was only mediocre. It seemed like a regular pizza with extra thick and tall crust... Maybe this just isn't my style of pizza...
Chicago deep dish is really great and I think they should reduce a little cheese in it.

This place was recommend by a friend of mine that lives in Chicago and Lou Manalti's did not disappoint, if visiting Chicago this place had awesome deep dish pizza. Be prepare to wait about an hour, but the food and service was great

Best pizza...EVER. First authentic Chicago pizza I've ever eaten, recommended by every local that we asked. Be sure to get the "Lou" for the full experience. We even ordered a large to take home to Philly!

It was nice that you preorder your pizza while you wait to be seated, so by the time you get to your table you don't have to wait as long for your food. The service here is on par, with very friendly and knowledgeable servers.  It's a great place to get together with friends and family. The pizza had a good amount of cheese and the crust had good flavor and texture which made the pizza. The sauce lacked seasoning, but the Italian sausage was good and gave it a good balance.  Over all the pizza was good and service was great.

I prefer this location over the River North location because parking here is fairly easy and it's not as busy.  Awesome service, awesome location, and pretty good tasting deep dish pizza. I'd still go with Peqouds over Lou Malnati's though. It just depends on who you are and what specifics you are looking for.  You come in, you are greeted immediately, and a waiter walks you to your table. BUT, we didn't like our first table because we were in the middle of the restaurant so we asked to move to one of their booths. The wait for the pizza can vary depending on how busy they are, the appetizers for some reason took a long time to get to us.  Like I said, plenty of meter parking outside! You're in the south loop, so overall less crowded.

Was told this was the place to go for a deep dish pizza. Not entirely sure why... We tried to order two medium pizzas but our server told us we were ordering too much food so we cut one back to a small... It wasn't enough for 3 of us. We are not large people and not really big eaters so this was disappointing.  The pizzas were ok but not worth the hype.
Yuck. The individual pizza is too small even for a three-year old. No loss, since this is by far the worst pizza I've ever had.

Delicious! Ordered the individual pepperoni pizza and although it looked small, it was perfectly filling and tasty. Wait was around 35 minutes for a table, but you can have a beverage while you wait - and pre-order your food, so it's not too bad. (Also their estimate was accurate which is always nice.)

Good Food, Great service. Pepsi products for soda and they only have diet pepsi for diet drinks. Arrive at odd eating hours to avoid the wait but even if you show up during peak times they will begin to prep your order so you will only have to wait 10 minutes once you get your table. They have both booths and tables. Not my favorite Chicago deep dish but still really good. Their version has less cheese than the competition. Crust Is very similar but they have a butter crust option. To me it added a little flavor but made me worry about my arteries . I would probably not order the butter crust again but that's just because I could feel myself getting fatter with the carbs, pepperoni oil,  and butter. But if you are not worried about your waist line you will probably love it!

It was ok. I wouldn't recommend getting a personal size pizza if you're looking for the authentic deep dish. Service was good. There was nothing special about this place. We went during lunch and there was no wait. It was underwhelming. Note: I did order the recommended classic.

Delicious deep dish pizza. Reminded me of my Italian grandpas pizza. Soooo delicious. Cheesy, crunchy yet soft, and the tomato sauce is perfect. The salad that came with my lunch was a bit sad. Old tomatoes and wilty lettuce, but I didn't come for the salad *wink wink.

As a budding foodie I love to ask The locals what their fav deep dish Chicago pizza is. Lou Malnati's Pizzeria did not disappoint! Pizza takes about 30mins so it's good to put in an order early to save time.

Headed here at the recommendation of the locals and was told not to leave without trying the Classic deep dish pizza. We ordered a large pie (6 slices) which was huge so don't order unless you haven't eaten in 3 days. We were so stuffed when we were done - you had to roll us out.  The pizza was lovely- sweet tomatoes...cheese that stretches for miles and a garlic crust to die for. It was little too much crust for me but still good. The ambiance is nothing to go crazy over so your focus will be on the delish poe in front of you and your date.

Ok this place had 4 stars and was walking distance from my conference hotel, so I opted to give it a try for dinner. At 5pm there was already a huge line outside which got me excited because I figured it *must* be amazing! Waited 45 min for a table which wasn't too bad given the massive line. Service was wonderful, but the deep dish was a bit of a disappointment. Sure, it was cheap and it tasted fine, but it was absolutely nothing special or worth waiting for! I've had much better deep dish elsewhere in Chicago so I wouldn't recommend this place. Also the ambience left a lot to be desired. Basically, okay overhyped pizza.

It was my first time in Chicago and everyone recommended me this place. First, the waiting time to take our orders was long. Second, the server was impolite with us and not kind at all. If he doesn't like his work, that's not our fault. Third, the pizza was so greasy and full of cheese. I didn't feel the others ingredients. I do not recommend this place.

Pizza should NOT be Deep or served in a dish--that's just CRAZY... Unless you're in Chicago and when here, gotta have it!  Crust is great and filling is always tasty. I don't even mind the 30 minute wait. It sure beats the order, eat and give us our table back mentality of so many places.
Pizza was really good, but restaurant was very "chainy". The were busy for lunch on a Saturday, but they let us order the pizza first. Don't know if it meets the hype, but glad we went anyways.

Sorry, Lou, but I just don't get the hype.  When visiting Chicago, I always make it a point to get deep dish pizza at least once.  On my last two trips, I tried Gino's East and Pizzeria Due (Uno's sibling), so I figured this time, I'd give Lou's a shot.  Since I was there in connection with a large convention, I figured the wait would be at least an hour, and was prepared to settle for take out.  However, I was quoted a wait time of 35 min., so I decided to wait for a table.  The quote was exactly right, and I put in my pizza order ahead of time to expedite things. I decided to try the Lou's salad for an appetizer ($9.25), which consists of romaine lettuce, Roma tomatoes, black olives, mushrooms, salami bits, and romano cheese drizzled with Lou's signature sweet balsamic vinaigrette.  This salad is quite generously portioned, despite being an individual size, and I wasn't able to finish it, since I needed to save stomach real estate for the pizza.  Despite that, it was quite good, and turned out to be the highlight of the meal. For my pizza, I ordered a small Lou ($16.30), which consists of spinach, mushrooms, and sliced Roma tomatoes in addition to the usual ingredients of crust, cheese, and tomato sauce.  Given that the small is designed to serve two people, I decided to order it rather than the individual size because I wanted to take leftovers back to my hotel to eat for lunch the next day.  While I will say that the butter crust is notable, and is superior to the crusts of other deep dish pies I've tried in Chi-town, I was less than impressed with the flavors of the other components of the pie, which didn't have the depth and marriage of other deep dish pies I've tried.  Like all deep dish pies, Lou's pie is quite substantial, so expect it to sit on your stomach like a brick, and plan accordingly (I forgot this the next day and regretted it). For dessert, I had the individual sized classic deep dish cookie a la mode ($3.50), which I'd eyed but never tried at other deep dish pizzerias.  While the temperature contrast was nice, again, I found the flavors lacking in depth, and the size was smaller than I'd envisioned.  I should have either ordered the regular portion or something else, such as the brownie sundae. Overall, while my meal at Lou's was certainly filling, it didn't quite meet the standards I was expecting in terms of flavor, particularly given that it's the best rated of the major deep dish chains in Chicago.  While I'm glad that I tried it, next time, I think I'll try a different deep dish pizzeria that I haven't tried yet, such as Giordano's or Pequod's, which seems to be a local favorite.  3.5 stars.
The pizza was really good. I got a personal size of "The Lou" and added pepperoni. The pizza isn't as deep as others, but that made it easier to eat with my hands. Definitely worth a visit.

Excellent pizza, PACKED on a Saturday night. That speaks for the food. seating in the bar area was very cramped with tables barely large enough for a drink let alone a pizza. But the food was very good.
Got The Lou and it was great. Wish they had good deep dish close to home, but I guess these guys can deliver some to your doorstep too.
Their deep dish pizza is surprisingly good with its crispy crust and tasty sausage in the middle. Will try again next time when I come back!

Really a 1.5 at best.  I ordered a small pepperoni deep dish with the buttercrust about an hour ago.  It tasted like it should cost $6 and not $15+.  If this is creme de la creme deep dish pizza, then I just don't understand the hype with this style of pizza.  The sauce was decent but the soggy pepperoni and underwhelming crust killed it.  I would prefer the cafeteria pizza I was served in middle school.  overall disappointed and confused by the popularity.
Awesome pizza. Best deep dish pizza I have every had. Service was awesome and very friendly. I ordered an individual pizza wish I would have ordered a medium it was that good

Service is  slow.  Ordered pie when we got there.  20 minute wait for a table and once seated pizza (heard staff say our pie was ready) arrived cold forty minutes later.  First beer was warm and flat.  Could have been the waiter..... Pizza if hot could have been gr8, ordered the "Classic".  We sat upstairs which may have been a key player in our experience.  Next time we'll sit downstairs despite a wait.
They did call and offered a reasonable solution to the complaint.

I ate here while on a business trip to Chicago and loved the place. When I walked in, the place was packed, a sure sign of the quality of the food. I checked in at the counter. Because each pizza takes 30 minutes to prepare, they take your order when you arrive. I ordered, gave them my name, and 20 minutes later was seated at a table. Like clockwork, 10 minutes after that I received my pizza. The deep dish Chicago pizza was among the best pizzas I have ever had. I highly recommend dining here, and hope to return here in the future.

The first thing we did when we landed and got settled in the hotel Hyatt at Mccormick place was order food. Thank God ! Lou Malnati's delivered because I didn't know there wasn't around the Mccormick!...I mean nothing!  We ordered our first authentic Chicago deep dish and some cheddar bites. The pizza was tasty but really heavy. It made me so sleepy that I didn't want to go sight seeing....but my husband dragged me out of the room. lol The cheese bites had a great crunch to it and the cheddar had a bite to it. It was little too salty for me though. The pizza and the bites both had very generous servings . If you just want to eat and chill out in the room watching a little TV Lou Malnati's is perfect!

The problem with deep-dish pizza is the name.  Call it casserole, call it pot pie, call it a hot dish.  Hey, stretch and call it quiche but pizza it is not. Why did I stand in a crazy line then wait with a shoulder-to-shoulder crowd inside for almost an hour?  The Lou.  That's what they call the casserole I ordered.  It's great.  Is it worth the braving the crowds?  As the late Yogi Berra said: 'Nobody goes there anymore.  It's too crowded.'  I would recommend having a meal before you go to Lou Malnati's because by the time you actually get your food, you'll be famished.
Just an update-The manager made it right.  Looking forward to staying a customer of Lou's for a long time to come!

I came here Friday night, my first night visiting Chicago. The pizza was good, but not as "deep" as I expected. It still had great flavor, just not much different than your typical pizza. My bf and I also split the trio of dips with pizza chips - delicious! Service was very friendly and helpful.

I ordered a classic Chicago personal sized pizza online and set a pickup time of an hour later. When I arrived, I still had to wait in line while people ordered, but once I reached the front, my pizza was brought out to me in a couple of minutes.
